Reviews.Title: “Location, staff and everything about this hotel awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty157
Reviews.Content: IQ Hotel was definitely a great choice for us. So close to restaurants, shops, transport but in a quiet street with no road noise. We loved having a laundry on our floor to catch up on all the dirty laundry, and the rooftop cafe area is soooo relaxing. This hotel has vending machines on many of the floors selling hot drinks, alcohol, sandwiches and snacks, all at really cheap prices (hot chocolate/coffee - 50 cents). Very large rooms with large bathroom. The only complaint we had is that the air conditioning was turned off when we stayed, and the room was rather hot at one stage. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and front service very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: notaholidayToronto
Reviews.Content: IQ hotel had amazing service. The room, although small was very clean and well taken care of. My husband and I walked to the center which is about 20 min leisurely.Breakfast on the roof top terrace was beautiful; the food wasn't something I would eat but my husband enjoyed it. They have a small fridge you can put things into. We were out from early morning to late at night. At night we would take a cab back. Make sure you have the address and specific location points because many of the cab drivers didn't know how to get there even. Language was not the issue my husband spoke Italian. The ride back by cab cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: SAF13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 4 days in this hotel, the hotel is very nice and clean; modern and elegant furnishing but relatively small rooms, the breakfast was fresh and full with different choices, and the best thing is the self-service machines for hot, soft drinks, chocolates… etc ,the staff were very friendly and helpfully, the location is very great, free Wi-Fi and Gem. Overall I will recommend anyone to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Couldn't fault anything !”
Reviews.Author: twix72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at IQ Hotel for 3 nights and couldn't fault anything about the hotel. It was very clean, modern and comfy and location perfect. There was free wifi and breakfast was fresh and lots of choice. We loved the vending machines and after a days walking and sight seeing the roof terrace and bottle of wine from the vending machine was a welcome break. The staff were freindly and spoke excellent english. Rome was amazing so was the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, bus ride to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: RupalLondon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were met by receptionist who was very helpful. The room was clean and furnished with modern twist. We did not have breakfast included but with cafes galore within walking distance breakfast is not required.

Reviews.Title: “Hi tech”
Reviews.Author: Maddaway
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Cleanest I've ever seen in Europe. Food is ok. If you don't like smoke, stay on street side, not courtyard. Beds are hard. Price was fair. No charm. Very high tech with automatic lights out when you leave and lower voltage outlet in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, Brilliant city!”
Reviews.Author: KathykinsBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ for three nights in July 2011 and it was brilliant! There were so many good things about it, here's just a few.. Room Clean and spacious with a lovely bathroom, air conditioning and a very comfy bed Staff All friendly and helpful - they reccomended a couple of restaurants to us, which were both 'un-touristy ' with lovely food (and there was none of that 'say we reccommended you and you'll get a discount' - which I'm always suspicious of) The Roof Terrace A lovely place to sit and relax with a bottle of wine from the vending machines. (The vending machines are brilliant and the prices for water and wine were cheaper than in the supermarket) Buffet Breakfast Had this on one morning - and it was definitely worth the money - they had everything you could want - and more (roast vegtables were an interesting addition in the 'full english' selection!). Everything was very tasty and items were replenished frequently Location Could not of been better. Just a couple of minutes walk from the main train station and within walking distance of all the major sites. We only used the tube once, to get to the Vatican - but then walked back as you really don't want to miss any of Rome - every street is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Take care!”
Reviews.Author: Renata B
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell that my parents stayed there and had some problems! Their Iphone and 2 sunglasses just desapeared in their room and the hotel told they couldn´t do anything! They didn´t even call the police!! This is not a safe hotel, i don´t recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, and Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: steph628
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ in Rome in November 2011 with my parents. The hotel has a great central location right off Via Natzionale, 5 minute walk to Stazione Termini. The hotel has just been renovated so all the room were new and clean. They are standard sized European rooms (aka small by American standards) but you're only in them to sleep, so who cares. The price was very reasonable for the accommodations and location. As others have mentioned, when we returned from a long day touring Rome, we grabbed a few mini prosecco bottles from the vending machine and say out on the roof deck. Breakfast was very good, with a wide variety of foods from meats, cereals, yogurt, eggs, breads, coffee, etc. It was $12 euros extra (which is a little steep) but for the convenience, it was fine. There is also a nice cafe around the corner where you can pick up a pane au chocolate and cappuccino for like $5 euros. If you're looking for a nice hotel on a budget, IQ would be a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: miatravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IQ for two nights in mid-March and thoroughly enjoyed it. Had a room with a balcony, an unexpected treat (I usually end up with an interior room with a view of an airshaft!) Breakfast buffet had a great selection - more than you could ever eat. Convenient to buses, metro and train station. The only problem I had was that I couldn't get the wi-fi to function properly. It would say I was connected but I couldn't do anything past that point. The clerk at the front desk couldn't figure it out either (perhaps it had something to do with the device I was using) and very kindly let me use the business center for a quick e-mail check. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roof top garden & Beer and Wine vending machine”
Reviews.Author: Watchung2
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome and loved this hotel. Close to the train station, clean and modern, firm bed,had a vending machine with beer and wine which was great and a quiet roof top garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chafchi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms are clean and there is plenty or room. Roof terrace was fantastic, vending machines for food and drink was a good simple idea and the prices were cheaper than all of the market stalls, 5 euro for bottle of wine, 2.5 euro for beer and 50 cent for water. WIFI throughout the hotel was really good and free. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We walked to all the sites, Vatican City is about 2 miles away but you get to see all the other sites on the way like 'Trevi Fountain' and 'Pantheon' and many others. Got a really good map from reception and that was all we needed. We took a guided tour when we got to the Vatican with 'What a life tours' excellent and well worth the 45 euros (including entrance to the vatican/chapel) Colusium is about 1 mile away again if you walk it you will get to see other sites on the way. Spanish steps about the same. Overall, a great hotel in a really good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gracefan2
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor I decided to book it for my New Years trip to Rome. Simply put, It was excellent. Easily found near the termini station (within walking distance). The staff spoke multiple languages and always willing to assist with slightest requests. The hotel itself was pristine and had convenient vending machines offering soft drinks, coffee and tea at affordable prices. Better yet, there were excellent restaurants nearby and I was able to walk to the Trevi found and the Piazza Navona from the hotel itself. Not only would I recommend this hotel, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MargaretS112
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Staff, service, location absolutely fantastic. Close to Termini Station and easy walk able distance to all sights and attractions. Clean and comfortable rooms, lovely white bed linen and towels changed daily, extremely comfortable beds, free wifi, excellent breakfast etc. etc. Roof terrace a delight, vending machines for reasonably priced wine, beer, soft drinks and snacks a great idea not to mention the availability of microwave, washing machine, tumble drier, iron, computer access etc.......excellent if on an extended trip. Definitely recommended. We stayed as a group for a w/e and will visit again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the iQ Hotel in Rome in March 2012 for our honeymoon. Overall, the hotel provided everything we needed while were there. It was clean, conveniently located and the front desk was helpful in providing directions and getting us cabs. The rooms and hotel are very modern so the hotel probably isn't right for someone looking for a B&B or home-y feel. It reminds me of a budget friendly version of the W Hotel. However, we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if we were back in Rome. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “city break @iQ”
Reviews.Author: NORA O
Reviews.Content: Just back having spent 3 nights at IQ Rome-great hotel,Room was immaculate,quiet and comfortable.Great location and amazing staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: nroe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from two weeks at the IQ Hotel in Rome. We selected the hotel because it was an affordable island of modern hospitality in a city of antiquity. The hotel certainly lives up to it's reputation. It's in a convenient location, walkable from Tremini Station or the Republica subway, and after a long overnight flight and an early arrival in the city our room was ready for us at 9 AM. The rooms are very well equipped, yes slightly smaller than North american standards but very function in layout and materials. The large and very pleasant roof top deck certainly makes up for the smaller space in the rooms. Besides, who wants to spend too much time in them anyway when all of Roma is at your doorstep. People complain about the beds being hard but they were wonderful on our backs and we both slept longer and better than we had in a long time. The bathrooms were outstanding and everything worked like a charm, and if it didn't the staff were there to fix things immediately. The breakfast room of the fifth floor serves a great buffet that has something for everyone. Some say that you can eat cheaper outside the hotel and yes you can but for convenience and quality you cannot go wrong. If you're smart you can eat a big breakfast and then skip lunch and enjoy dinner so much more. The portion size in Italy means that you can hardly get to the dolce sometimes because you've eaten so much already. The staff in the hotel were all excellent during our staff and addressed any of our small issues quickly. The rooms are spotless and efficiently cleaned each day. If you like to sleep with the windows open you'll probably notice the street noise around 3 AM, then the deliver trucks and the garbage at 4 AM but it's all part of the city's life. Some people suggested that the neighbourhood is a bit seedy, but honestly it's not. There were always a few street people around especially at Termini, but we never really felt at ease. Lots of good restaurants are within two or three blocks of the hotel, the hotel can recommend a few but other are found by chance. One tip, avoid Strega. It's overpriced and a trap for tourists. Smaller is better. All in all, a great deal, great location and a bit of a look at what hotels will be like in the future. Try it you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: bowater23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January with my girlfriend, stayed for 4 nights. I will keep this simple, if you would like a nice hotel in the heart of rome. look no further.. Hotel and staff are brilliant, hotel room was great (dont really spend much time here). Very close to everything. We walked to all attractions. Roof top garden is great and the vending machines are good for a couple of beers. Everything about this hotel made the trip a great experience and if i was to go back to rome i would not go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased with IQ Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheOldPairCoMeath
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and so pleased we chose this Hotel. It is in a great location, convenient to Termini train/bus station. Within walking distance of all sights, so we didn't use any public transport or taxi. The Hotel is clean, well run, staff are so helpful. The room was clean, spacious and well furnished. The bed was so comfortable. The free Wi-Fi was much appreciated. The restaurant had a great selection at breakfast-time, lots of healthy fruit etc. The rooftop was such a lovely place to relax at any time - a lovely extra to a lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LG384
Reviews.Content: The IQ Hotel was incredible! It was extremely easy to find and a short walking distance from the main train station. The staff were the friendliest by far from my entire trip. Stayed for a few days while visiting Rome and thought this hotel was a breath of fresh air. The rooms were huge compared to most European hotel rooms. Walking distance from the subway making it easy to sightsee Rome. Everything was super clean and new and the rooftop terrace was great! We would drink a bottle of wine in the rooftop after a long day of sightseeing, amazing. The only complaint would be that the breakfast they offer isnt worth the cost, much cheaper and tastier to eat at some of the local bakeries nearby. When I go back to Rome the IQ Hotel will definitely see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Belle_E_Flops
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in this hotel and we were very pleased. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel isn't the luxurious sort but it is spotlessly clean and suited our needs perfectly. We didn't bother with breakfast, and chose instead to eat in cafés instead. The best part of this hotel is the fantastic location. From the hotel, the Colosseum and Roman Forum are just a 10 minute walk. All the other sights such as Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon etc are all walking distance. I could not recommend this hotel enough, and if I return to Rome again in the future I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but excellent”
Reviews.Author: katie1680
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simple, straightforward and what they offer is perfectly executed. The reception staff were very helpful and polite, the rooms spacious and very clean. The hotel is less than a 5mintue walk from Termini and around 10/15 minutes to the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. This hotel is a perfect base for a busy trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: erntravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel in March and it was just perfect for us. Definitely a 4 star by European standards. It's location within walking distance of the train station means it is a bit of a walk to other parts of Rome (the Forum, Spanish Steps, etc.) but we are walkers and did not mind the exercise. A metro stop at the train station could be used. The hotel is right across from the Opera house and quite new. The furnishings are spare and modern and the mattress is very firm. If you like a soft mattress, you would not like this hotel. Among other good things, there is a lot of lighting and the bathroom countertop extends the length of the bathroom, so stuff is not dropping on the floor or into the sink. It looked as though the room had AC but the HVAC unit was not operable. (They probably turn it on only in warmer months, in spite of the balmy weather in Italy this March.) There is a small TV but no English channels, a fridge, safe, free wifi, and a small closet (our room was #422 and from the floor plans, it appears that other rooms have bigger closets.) There are also plenty of electrical outlets. The room was quiet but we are not sure what it would be like when the opera is in season. Other advantages: a washer and drier so we could clean our clothes (bring your own soap), vending machines which sell inexpensive wine and sodas (the corkscrew is nearby) and an ice machine, although the rooms have no ice buckets. The bath amenities are sparce, probably to keep their costs down. They provided kleenex, shampoo, bath gel and soap bars but no hand lotion or conditioner. We had to leave notes to get them to resupply the soap and shampoo. In a few years, they will need to spiff up the carpeting which already shows a bit of wear. The service at the front desk was excellent and cheerful. We did not have breakfast there so can make no comment other than it costs 10 euros/person. There is a Carrefors around the corner and several restaurants within several blocks. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend the IQ hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Travel Lodge”
Reviews.Author: BandMe01
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it was rated in the top 10 hotels in Rome. Was disappointed in it. Everything was really basic and the room was small and cramped. Barely enough room at each side of the bed to get in and out. No restaurant except for breakfast time. However, it was spotless and staff were friendly and helpful. No bar either but there is a roof terrace with a vending machine that sells alcohol at reasonable prices. It was Ok for our weekend trip but don't think it merits its 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: tc0411
Reviews.Content: I rescheduled my trip because of this hotel when I stayed in Rome for 5 days, cuz I saw a lot of positive comments about this hote so i really wanted to stay here. really nothing much I can complain about this hotel, friendly staff, nice area, clean and comfortable, the closest station was Republica which was about 2 mins walk, but then it's only within 10 mins from the Termini, so it wasn't bad when u ha to carry luggages, next time if I go to Rome again I will stay here for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected”
Reviews.Author: Solcito63
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the pillows were hard rock as well as the mattress. Wi-fi service was hard to get connected and stay that way.The TV was so small that you need binoculars to see what´s going on the screen. Bath - on the other hand- was good and clean.Breakfast quite expensive. Finally, besides the limited snacks that the vending machine offers- the hotel should have at least a small dining service available.

Reviews.Title: “IQ is the clever choice!”
Reviews.Author: MHI_1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March and were pleasantly surprised. The staff were really helpful and pleasant and the hotel was new and very clean. We highly recommend this hotel. Also the hotel is in the centre of Rome and so was a great base for our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted ...”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0travel55
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, comfortable and well located. A great find - we thought it was great value for money. Like other guests, we found breakfast was good & we loved the idea of the vending machines (drinks & snacks at reasonable prices). Staff were very helpful & polite. Only negative for us was that we had a room on the ground floor next to a loading/unloading bay where the dustcart would pull up at in the early hours of the morning & it was a bit noisy. But i am sure that if we had asked to be moved, they would have obliged. We chose not to bother changing rooms but would suggest that guests ask for rooms on the upper floors if they wanted to avoid this problem. But we would definitely stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family with young children”
Reviews.Author: Jjs6038
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 21-month-old twins and I emailed asking if we could get a room with a bath tub for easier bathing and they accommodated our request. We loved the vending machines. I was expecting them to be overpriced but they were reasonable and we purchased a few snacks and tons of drinks from them every day. The room was cleaned, replenished with fresh towels, and beds made every day which is rare in European hotels.  The roof-top was awesome.  There was a place for adults to relax and a fenced in swing and slide area which was perfect to let our twins burn off some energy after being in their stroller all day.  The location was great! Main train station was about a block away and there were cheap bus shuttles to FCO. Plan for about an hour ride each way though.  We walked to everything except the Vatican for which we took the subway which is just around the corner from the hotel and a ride of 5 stops.  The staff suggested great restaurants for us to try which is difficult with children in tow.  Overall, a really nice hotel. Wish there were more like it in Europe. My one complaint would be the lack of access to the AC.  It was available but not working during our stay.  We were there at the end of March and the weather was perfect but with the sun out and temps around 70 degrees Farenheit, the room became very warm.  We live in Europe and know that AC is not common, our house does not have AC.  For this reason, we always look for a hotel that offers this amenity. It's nice to be able to come back to a cool room and with two adults and two children the room can get pretty stuffy. There were great floor length windows that opened completely to a little balcony but our room was facing the street and it was impossible to sleep at night with all of the noise. People talking, cars/motorcycles, trash pick up, etc.  I got up four or five times a night to open and shut the windows because the noise was waking our children but the room would become unbearable with the windows closed.  Don't advertise AC if it's not available at the guests choosing. Breakfast seemed a little expensive (10€ per person, per day) but there is a little grocery store around the corner where we picked up things and a pack of water. It's nice that there is a mini fridge in the room that is not a mini bar. It's empty and you can put your own things inside. I even brought back leftovers from dinner and reheated in the hotel microwave the next day. You can purchase plates and silverware at the front desk which we did one night when we brought pizza back for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at IQ Hotel Roma. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. We stayed for seven nights in a standard double room overlooking the opera house. The room was nice with enough space for two adults and the bathroom was a decent size as well. The hotel is in a central location; it's within walking distance to many sites, shops, and restaurants. There are several bus stops nearby or you can easily catch a taxi. We had breakfast three times and there were plenty of options. There is a washer and dryer available for three Euros each and plenty of options in the vending machines. We would definitely stay at the IQ again when we return to Rome. Thank you, IQ Hotel Roma, for making our vacation in Rome amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sentinal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a spacious standard double room. I picked the hotel on the overwhemingly positive reviews on this site and can confirm they are entirely accurate. Can recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Going to rome? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_P_UK
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in March 2012 and absolutely loved it! It is very central, just a 5 minute stroll from Termini station and 10 minutes from the Coloseum. Very handy metro station just up the road which is 6 stops from the Vatican on the A-line (but we walked it) and all the other major attractions are walkable. Room wasn't massive but felt brand new, beds are unbelievably comfortable and the double glazing means you sleep in perfect silence despite the busy Rome streets. Free wi-fi for as many devices as you like and there is the most amazing vending machine on the 5th floor which has to be seen to be believed! Cannot recommend this hotel enough - I will definitely be going back here!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC_5
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the metro and the main train station but located on a nice quiet street. Room was new and furnished very nicely. Just wish there was a little more room between bed and desk but it didn't stop us from loving the room. Bathtub was great for baths especially with their bath foam. Inside the room was the most peaceful quiet ever encountered in any hotel room considering that there were rooms to each side of ours. Got great rest and in the mornings really enjoyed their breakfast. Would definitely go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern, trendy hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TerraIncognito
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in March. The price was approximately £125 a night for the room, which wasn't cheap, but compared fairly with similar hotels we looked at, Rome being quite an expensive place to stay generally. The hotel is very modern, with a stylish lobby, with bright red chairs, very Italian. The staff were all friendly and efficient. The location was just to the west of the railway station, which proved to be handy for all sights, the colosseum, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain all within a 15 minute walk. The Vatican is just within walking distance, around 45 minutes away, which is not a hardship as you see more of Rome that way. The rooms are smart, reasonably sized, though not large. The bathrooms are good, with a powerful shower and nice toiletries. The buffet breakfast was lovely, at 10 euros, with lots of choices, from various fresh meats and cheese, fruit, cereals, cooked breakfast, a toaster, juices, coffee, iced water, and a lovely selection of pastries and cakes - ideal to fill up on for a tiring day walking around Rome. There are also reasonably priced vending machines, with snacks and wine, Champagne, coffee, with a fridge in each room to store food or drink. There is a nice, spacious, rooftop terrace, with lots of chairs & sofas, available for guests to eat, drink and relax in. I'd recommend Strega, a traditional, reasonably cheap Italian restaurant, a couple of minutes walk away, where we ate twice. If seafood is your thing, then F.I.S.H. on Via Serpenti, is a ten minute walk away, with gorgeous food. I would highly recommend this if you want a fairly priced, centrally located, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel it is not!”
Reviews.Author: tripbugUK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was ranked 2nd at the time of all the hotels in Rome and graded 4 star but can say it was definately not . Whilst the location was good, the rooms clean and quiet, the ambience of the hotel reminded me of a high quality hostel. With its vending machines, artificial grass on the roof terrace and lack of any extra services. The roof terrace was the only outside space and not all that wonderful to say the least. No food available except for breakfast, no room service and only vending machines which were extremely expensive compared to the supermarket just round the corner to the hotel. Who wants to use vending machines in a 4 star hotel! 2 corkscrews on chains by the machines for opening wine bottles! Paper cups to drink out of even in the rooms. The room windows looked out over a courtyard and were not big enough to let in enough daylight to enable one to turn the light off in the room even on a sunny day. Most of the staff were helpful apart from one (male) who had a patronising attitude. The so called lounge was situated in reception and consisted of a few sofas mainly used for guests waiting to depart and to pay their bills. Definately not conducive for relaxation or a long stay. A definate disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel the weekend of the Rome marathon, securing a good rate online. Five minutes walk from the Termini, it is easy to find and the hotel staff are welcoming and helpful. Rooms are clean and nicely furnished, with all the usual amenities. The unique feature about this hotel are the "self-serive" elements, but don't let that put you off; the vending machines (supplying drinks, snacks and any forgotten toiletries) are well stocked and fairly priced, so you won't be ripped off. There is a Spar about 2 mins walk from the hotel and like other guests, we stocked up on some Prosecco and snacks and sat on the hotel's lovely roof terrace, perfect for an after-dinner/pre-dinner drink. Don't be put off by the location; it is deceptively close to the Via Nazionale, and you are no more than 10 minutes walk to the Trevi fountain, 15/20 mins to the Forum/Colosseum. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiveLoveLife84
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. This was convenient location to get around the city and go sightseeing. The vending machines were a plus! The rooftop deck was a nice place to hangout at night or when it was a rainy day. The smoking decks on each floor was a nice feature if you are traveling with someone who smokes. Rooms were very nice and clean. Only con was that the bed was hard. I have recommended this place to several people. If we make it back to Rome we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “iQ Hotel Roma - Two Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly V
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent, everyone in the hotel is very friendly and polite, the breakfast buffet is really good, the rooms look very modern and clean, the price is reasonable and the location is very strategic. All of these factors contributed to making our stay in Rome a very positive experience! Being honeymooners, we were also given a 1 night free upgrade to a bigger & better room on our last night.

Reviews.Title: “lovely modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: alivealiveo
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this hotel for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is very clean and is furnished with modern decor. One feature is that the rooms all back on to an internal courtyard so you are guaranteed a quiet night's rest. However natural light is sacrificed and you can feel somewhat claustrophobic. Staff were generally courteous but on the day we arrived we found the person(male) at reception quite curt when detailing the terms of our stay. I thought I had booked breakfast and he let me know I hadn't and that I had no option now but to stay put! Another very good feature was the roof top terracer-a nice place to relax after a busy day in Rome. The location is close to the bus station and buses run close by to the tourist hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, everyone needs to stay here! It is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Caz-Wood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in! The staff were extremely friendly and the rooms were perfect. We only stayed for 3 nights but every night was great. LOVED the alcohol vending machine that came with clups, ice and bottle openers. It was incredibly cheap too!! There were other vending machines too that sold food and snacks for midnight munchies! The roof top terrace was great too, with built in patio heaters for the colder nights, and comfy sofas and play area. We had the breakfast on one of the days and it was lovely. All you can eat, and the variety was spot on. We were full after that and didnt need to eat all day!! We were a stones throw from all of the major attractions, including the coleseum which we walked to in 15 mins. It is also a 2 minute walk from the train and bus station. It is nicely tucked down a quiet side street next to the Opera house, so it is easy to find and use to get your bearings. We used the sauna one night at 11pm, it was great!! We got a bottle of wine from the vending machine and went for a cheeky sauna. The gym is good too, I was gutted I didnt bring any gym wear so I would use it!! the machines looked brand new! All in all, after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, it lived up to EVERY expectation and more and if I go back to Rome I will definately stay a the IQ again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience with easy walking access”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, and great location. Breakfast was very nice. Room was modern, up to date and had everything that we needed. Easy walking to all of central Rome attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, and love the rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a very central location, less than a 10 minute walk to the main train station (roma termini), and less than 5 minutes walk to the metro (repubblica). it is new and clean and very reasonably priced. the rooms that we had were small, but more than adequate. both rooms included small balconies, with full glass doors, making the rooms feel very open and airy. the rooms are very 'modern' in their design...think scandinavian wood (i.e. ikea) with crisp colors and accessories. the breakfast was fine; a decent-sized buffet with all the usual suspects available to eat. the best, in our view, however, was the rooftop terrace. as our trip was in march, there was practically no one using the roof. we did avail ourselves of the terrace each night, after returning from dinner, and had a drink in the open air. there are vending machines on the terrace floor that include wine and beer and snacks. the prices are, to say the least, cheap. and in all honesty the wine was not bad at all! it was awesome. do youself a favor and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: p0ppy021
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value and central to many of the main attractions. The rooms are comfortable and quiet with a large bathroom. The hotel staff are excellent and very helpful. Vending machines are located on many floors and provide everything from bottles or beer and wine to sandwiches and toothbrushes. The breakfast is also excellent value at 10 euros with a large selection buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in March”
Reviews.Author: mstraveller78
Reviews.Content: We landed at the airport there are various different shuttle buses from the airport that you can get that take you into central Rome, takes about 20mins. depending on traffic. We got off near the central train station, Termini, and with a map from our guide book, managed to find our way to hotel on foot, took about 10mins. The receptionist was very friendly, and spoke fluent english. He gave us a map and explained where we were on the map.. (never been to Rome before!). Check in was quick. The hotel is very new and also incredibly clean, in fact never stayed in cleaner!. They have a breakfast service, which we didn't go to, so can't comment, but there isn't a restaurant as such. There are lots of vending machines that are cheaply priced. There is a self service laundary and also area for ironing. There is a roof terrace, nicely furnished, which was quiet when we went, but I am sure is busier in summer. There is machine that sells drinks on the roof terrace, once again all self serviced. Its a slightly different hotel experience to what I am used to, but it was absolutely perfect for what we wanted. Couldn't get the wifi to work, not that it matters much, also the only english speaking channel was CNN, once again, not that this matter much either!..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcuccioletti
Reviews.Content: Very well located, good breakfast, nice service. Very near Terminoi train station. One bloc fron via Nazionale. Also close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: cabornez
Reviews.Content: We arrived at just after 8pm in the evening and were greeted by a friendly receptionist, given our room key quickly and offered free wifi which was great! The room was small, which I knew about beforehand, but was perfect. It was clean and well laid out. The only small thing I disliked was the bed was a little hard. Breakfast was brilliant, enough to set us up for the day at a very reasonable cost. We used this facility twice during our stay. The location of the hotel was excellent, 12 minutes walk to the Termini for local buses and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ngill84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ for four nights. Modern, clean with friendly staff. The location is very good, close to termini. The roof top terrace is beautiful, although make sure you use bug spray! Some great restaurants near by and good vending machine selection at the hotel as well. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AN1986
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near the Termini railway station which was handy for getting to the city from the airport and all of the main sites are within walking distance, Colosseum only a 15 minute stroll. Staff are very friendly & helpful, especially for recommending places to eat. Rooms are modern and very clean. They are quite small but this seems to be the norm in Rome. Has self service vending machines that sell bottles of wine/beer & snacks which you can take up to the roof terrece. Overall a great stay - would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Annarion
Reviews.Content: I stayed at IQ for 3 nights in early February with my boyfriend. I chose it based on the good TA reviews and with the aim of having a comfortable place to return to at the end of each day. I think IQ achieved this - it is modern, very clean, warmly decorated and quiet. Some minor things that annoyed me were the internet access - you had to log in every 15 minutes or so and it was quite slow, there were also some initial problems with my password (easily sorted though, the staff at the front desk are always ready to help. A tip: if you have more than one device, ask for a password for each. Sometimes the staff forget to ask you when you check in), my boyfriend found the bed to be too narrow and the pillow too hard (he is average size and a difficult sleeper) and there is no convenience store nearby that I could find. The closest were some carts selling snacks and fruit. However, as mentioned by other reviewers, the vending machines in the hotel offer a good range of snacks and toiletries for cheap prices. In terms of location, very close (about 5mins walk) to the termini, walking distance to roman ruins and collesum, and we found a yummy restaurant nearby, (about 5mins walk; ristorante tema) that we went to for dinner each night. I would recommend this hotel for its location, reasonable prices, and modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: CELIA K
Reviews.Content: IQ Hotel is exactly what we were looking for: location, design, cleanliness, kindness and sleep quality. Very nice room and a terrace where we enjoy having our dinner. There is a microwave to heat meal one can buy at the supermarket, and very practical vendor machines with good prrices (coffee, beverages, sandwiches, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ole60_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my family. The location was good, near Termini, and the rooms were clean and with many practical solutions. The beds are a bit too hard. Nice, small balcony (at least on the side facing the Opera). Very helpful staff. Good breakfast, worth the 10 Euros. Pretty roof terrace. I spoke with other guests, and everybody seemed to be as satisfied as myself. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: willis100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. Very clean room and the staff are so helpful. The breakfast is an extra 10 euros but I thought it was worth it as there was a lot of food to choose from. Also it is close to all the attractions, you can walk to the colosseum, trevi fountain and spanish steps. You can walk from Termini station to the hotel - it's a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perferct Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sigal R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ Roma for four nights and loved every minute!!! We are a family of four and we stayed at a quadruple room which was specious and clean!! Loved the fact that the hotel is modern and new!! Location was good too! Short walk from the Termini station and from the Metro. Staff was very friendly and helpful!! would deferentially go back!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel we chose to stay at for 4 nights while staying in rome and it certainly didnt dissapoint in any way! The rooms are spacious, the staff are so curteous and friendly day and night! The breakfast for 10 euros is a bargain! It is all cooked great and a really good selection, there is no way you can complain about it! Very safe and quiet location to stay in with a 5 minute walk to the restaurants and 20mins to almost all of romes attractions. I honestly can't recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nitemonkey
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to go with this hotel. I wasn't disappointed. The room was clean and quiet. I don't mind walking so the location was perfect. Walked to the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, Trestavere and even Villa Bourghese. The staff were very helpful. Two examples: The vending machine ate one of my 10 euro bills and the staff were able to open it up and return the money to me. Then, I had them call a taxi to go to the Vatican and accidentally left my phone in the taxi. The front desk called and stayed on hold to try to track down the taxi cab. (I eventually found the phone using the Find my Phone function on the iPhone -- the cab driver drove around the Vatican till he saw me in line and returned it to me!). The roofdeck was a nice place to hang out before or after the evening plans. My only reservation is the buffet. It's okay, but the not spectacular. I certainly got my money's worth but I only went once and preferred stepping out in the city to get better coffee and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: RowlyP
Reviews.Content: Hotel IQ is well positioned as fairly close to everything. Only 5 mins from bus station. Fairly impersonal as no service in rooms etc but everyone should know this up front. Clean, beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: miglozoya
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just fantastic; not luxury, but I trade it for the cleanliness of the almost-new rooms, nice bathrooms, good location, etc. I would say that I'll come back to avoid other surprises in a difficult city as Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: soupiemac
Reviews.Content: My husband (an extensive traveler) and I were both impressed by this hotel. The staff was very friendly and warm. We arrived before our room was available, so the staff immediately asked if we wanted our luggage stored. While we waited, we took a walk around the area and discovered just how close we were to a number of the major sites and really good restaurants. When we returned to check in, we found that we were given an upgrade without even asking for one (we had booked our stay through Expedia). We stayed in room 301 for four nights. I was shocked by the size of our room and the bathroom -- they were HUGE! We had a tiny walk-out balcony that overlooked a quiet street. We thoroughly enjoyed the roof-top seating, complete with heaters to warm the area on the cool nights. I would certainly stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Good location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: renovia
Reviews.Content: We were friendly welcome by the staff, and during our stay we felt comfortable and cozy. There are vending machines sell many kinds of soft drinks and daily needs; toothbrushes, shaver, umbrella etc. This hotel also provide washing machines, very convenient for traveler This hotel also provide smoking area. The location is very good, near many restaurant and shops, and within walk distance to Termini station. We can get many interesting places by city tour bus near this station. The room was bright, very clean, quite spacious and well designed. The bathroom also very clean. The breakfast was plenty, we would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lexy_Essex
Reviews.Content: Great location- walking distance from the main (Termini) railway station, and most places of interest are walk-able, but the Metro isn't far away either. Room was a little compact, but nicely presented and very clean, even had a small balcony. Shower was fantastic, only downside was the bed was very firm, not that comfy. The hotel staff we very friendly and helpful, we had the buffet breakfast a couple of mornings (10 euro a head) which was very good, nice selection and self service bean to cup coffee machine. There is no restaurant at the hotel and no bar as such (they do sell some drinks at the end of the reception desk), instead they have vending machines, the one on the top floor sells alcohol, reasonably priced too. Bottle beer 2.50 and water 50 cents. By this machine, they also have a roof terrace with comfy seats and heaters under a covered area (we went in Feb). No doubt this would be busier in the summer months. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 186306Cathy
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked through the door of the iQ Hotel, we were most impressed by everything we encountered. The reception staff greeted us warmly and, although we arrived early in the morning and our room was still occupied, our cases were locked away for safekeeping. The man on reception was really helpful, giving us lots of useful information about where to visit and how to get there. When we checked into our room, we were surprised and pleased to see how large and immaculately clean it was, as was the ensuite bathroom. The iQ Hotel is in an excellent location, very close to all the tourist attractions and only a 5-10 minute walk from Termini. However, it is situated in a quiet street so there is no noise.The vending machines provide a varied selection of very reasonably-priced snacks and drinks and even the late night drinks we had at the bar were much cheaper than we expected. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nobby505
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, going home tomorrow. Been a great base for myself and my daughter to see the sights of Rome. Clean and modern with a basic self service style approach. Good breakfast for 10 euros a head to get you started for the day. If you are looking for room service etc then this hotel is not for you, but a good "premier Inn" style of accommodation. And free in room WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Londoner42
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Triple Room at iQ Roma - very spacious, big bathroom. The iQ is a very good choice - have no hesitation recommending it. I don't understand previous reviewer's negative comments - the iQ is a modern contemporary hotel, which is obvious from the hotel description and pictures. If you are looking for traditional old world "charm", then this is not for you. But if you are looking for a good-value hotel with modern comforts in a great location, then it fits the bill perfectly. Also, everything is very reasonably priced (unlike most hotels which try to rip you off on "extras") - free wi-fi throughout hotel, very good breakfast buffet for only 10 euros, very good value vending machines and "easy bar".

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very simple. very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: dfundfun
Reviews.Content: New hotel (or we better say hostel...). very clean very helpful staff. from the other side its very basic and simple hotel - look more like a good hostel. we could find much better choice for this price. we paid 105 eur for night and we met friends that paid 5 eur less and got mucht mutch better hotel, in better location incl breakfast. the iq hotel will be a good choice for about 50-60 eur for night. dont pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gill H
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. My 17yr old daughter and I stayed here 11 Feb for 4 nights. Warm friendly staff from the beginning to end. We had a corner room with a massive bathroom that was spotlessly clean, the beds were a little firm for my daughters tastes but great for me. The room was warm and comfortable, the vending machines located on every other floor reasonable prices - cheaper than the corner vendor.. and worked on every occasion, even the 5 Euro bottle of wine was drinkable!!! Great location - easily walkable to all the main attractions and the termini. Would stay here again like a shot

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: divachitown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in February (during the snowstorm). The hotel really went the extra mile at 1:30 AM and was able to secure a taxi to come pick us up at the airport (there was no train service or taxi service available at the airport during the snow storm) so the beginning of our trip was saved! The hotel is modern, new and clean. We had 2 adults and 2 children and were comfortable in our room (I think it was a Quad). The breakfast had many choices and was only 10 Euro. I also really enjoyed the vending machines that were reasonably priced for snacks, beer, wine. There is a kids area and outdoor rooftop area which we didn't get to take advantage of but when the weather is nice I am sure it is delightful. The location was great as well! I would return without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome new hotel with all the comforts”
Reviews.Author: Whitna85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here November 2010 when the hotel was just newly opened. They had AMAZING rates for being a new hotel. I know now the rates have almost doubled since. Which is a shame because I loved this hotel and we were on a budget. We had a huge corner room with a view of the opera house. I woke up to pretty opera music playing outside each morning, how lovely. Lots of plug options in these rooms. COMFY beds! The rooftop deck is a great place to have a cocktail too. Also located just a short 5 minute walk from Termini. And tons of great food around. Loved this hotel so much!

Reviews.Title: “Intelligent? Definitely!”
Reviews.Author: Aranvale
Reviews.Content: There are no negatives I could find about IQ hotel in Rome! Location is excellent for buses, Metro and walking to major sites. Staff were friendly and helpful especially Georgio at the front desk. Room was small but ample and beautifully decorated. Large shower room (one hears horror stories about bathrooms in Rome hotels!) Windows which open, varied lighting and and excellent kingsize bed topped off the room. The facilities are second to none with roof garden, shop, vending machines (not too expensive), microwave for guest use, gym and sauna, ice machines and a fridge in the bedroom. Clean is not the word! It was spotless they washed the corridor carpets and I defy anyone to find a speck of dust or stain anywhere. Breakfast was generous and varied for many palattes (even here its impossible to find a cup of tea like home, however - one of the adventures of travel!) Rate was very reasonable for Rome. Thoroughly recommend and really wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The Reviewers Were Correct!”
Reviews.Author: Kerri-Kenneth
Reviews.Content: Having traveled through European cities previously, I knew better than to expect accommodations like the U.S. (i.e. room size and amenities...unless you want to spend "a pretty penny" and be on the outskirts of the major city) So, I searched and searched for a hotel that looked CLEAN, especially the bathroom/shower. Room size: we actually had enough roof to walk on either side of the bed and still had a decent amount of closet space which included a safe (ideal for our laptop). Comfort: bed was a platform bed, a little firm but, which I thought was fine, Kenneth thought it was not bad. Overall, the room was inviting enough to just hang out and relax in without feeling claustrophobic. Cleanliness: GREAT both room and bathroom....and if anyone prefers a clean bathroom, free of mold, this is it. (Note - just remember that the stand-up shower is smaller than normal U.S. showers so, don't be alarmed..it's common by European standards) The I.Q. Hotel was very easy to get to from the Termini train station. We actually walked with our luggage in-tow. Although some may want to take a cab. It took maybe 10 minutes to walk and was great when we used the train for a day trip to Florence. We walked almost everywhere, the Coliseum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and took a short train/subway to Vatican City. There were plenty of places to eat around the hotel but, the best breakfast bargain was the hotel's rooftop buffet..$10 Thank goodness for the past "trip advisor" reviews and the photos! Not only did we concur with the higher ratings we wanted to post our opinion, also. Unfortunately we don't have any photos to post but, PLEASE look at others' pics. They're pretty accurate. We would definitely stay there, again and recommend the I.Q. Hotel to others looking to stay in the heart of Rome. Happy travels everyone - K & K

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: crema0228
Reviews.Content: It's really a good stay at this hotel! It's very close to the train station, Termini, and thus suitable for those visiting Roma by train. I like the decoration very much. (Cute and innovative icons everywhere.) In addition, the staffs are very warm-hearted. If I have the chance back to Roma, I'll surely choose IQ!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: ARRSandes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new and very well located nearby the Termini Station and not so far from the main attractions of Rome. The cleaning is very good. The bathroom is huge and shines! They have self-service laundry service, which was essential for our stay with young children. The staff in the front desk was very very helpful and provided us with useful information and also arranged for a perfect private guide for us. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and clever”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in late January, we were both impressed by the reception staff, the location is top notch, close to the main train station, and within easy walking distance to all the must see attractions that Rome offers. The only disappointment was the bed, the mattresses are very ordinary at best. Well done iq, well priced and recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.........”
Reviews.Author: Cornelius O
Reviews.Content: For travelers who would like a little more and not have to spend a fortune, this is what you are looking for. I have not had good experiences in Rome with hotels and have been very wary of online reviews but on a recent four day lay-over on my way home from a rather grueling business and leisure trip to Europe and North Africa, I spent four nights here. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful, the location is great, and even though my room was on the ground floor and facing the street, it was very quiet during the day and at night. The room itself was large, very modern, bright and comfortable and the bathroom large, clean and with lots of light. The location is perfect and if you like walking, full of lovely discoveries on the way down to the Coliseum or along the Via Quatro Fontain and Via Sistina to the Spanish Steps. There is a fridge in the room and the breakfast on the top floor is a great value. This is a very modern, boutique style hotel and will (I am) sure become very popular and impossible to book especially at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and attention!”
Reviews.Author: Alejandrabc
Reviews.Content: Minimalist decoration, normal size rooms, comfortable bathroom (with shower, no bathtub), safe box, dedicated attention from employees, and amazing LOCATION.... located next to Repubblica metro station (line that takes you to Spagna, Popollo and Vatican city), a 5 minute walk to Santa Maria Maggiore, Monument to Vittorio Emanuele II and Fontana de Trevi and 10 min walk to San pietro in Vincoli and Colosseo. We went the weekend it snowed and with the ice, snow and rivers of water from the melted snow, we found that everything was very close and that Rome isn't as big as it would seem on the map. On the 4th floor there are vending machines and microwave, it has a sauna and fitness room on the 1st floor (which we didn't use). The rooms have empty fridge, which we found very convenient, cause you can buy water, yogurt, fruits, limoncello, etc and have it when you want. There's a great little restaurant one block away, which is also recommended by tripadvisor, but I’m incapable of remembering the name. Il Grillo Parlante, another great restaurant near Piazza del Popollo. For sure I will stay here again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Center of it all, I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: J V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect place in Rome. Walking distance to the Colosseum, A block away from the Termini Station A nice 20 minute walk to the Vatican--passes the Trevi Fountain on the way Next to a main street with restuarants Next to the Opera House You can't go wrong with this hotel. It was incredibly convenient from the Train station with an extremely helpful staff. I will stay here again. There are only 2 washers and 2 dryers in the hotel (in case you need to do laundry)

Reviews.Title: “Not so friendly management”
Reviews.Author: uptown_girlNY
Reviews.Content: location is great. Close to metro but quiet. our rooms were pretty new and clean. However, people at the front desk were not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Would Deffinatly Go back”
Reviews.Author: Amyz123
Reviews.Content: We went to rome in January and when we got to the hotel we were very impressed with the look of it, walking in we got a good reception of the staff and it looked lovely inside, the staff were very helpful, and even had spare plug adaptors as we forgot ours! We had emailed the IQ hotel before we went to the hotel and asked if there was anything they could do to make it more specail and they upgraded us to a bigger room, which was great! The room was nice, however quite cold, beds were maid daily and room spotless. We had a lovely Breakfast, were there was everything u could think of, fruit, yoghurts, bacon,eggs, toast, cerials... everything! The location is a walk away from things however we didnt mind it at all! great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for an inexpensive, modern stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Laurenprassas
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, very modern. Hotel is very central, 6 euro cab ride from the train station, and two minute walk to underground metro that takes you to colosseum, Spanish steps, etc. you could easily walk as well, but it was pouring down rain when we stayed. Very clean room, but also very small. (not a big deal since who is planning on staying in their rooms in Rome?!!) optional breakfast buffet for 10 euro/person. We didn't do it, but is a nice option. We thought the vending machines were very useful and helpful (5euro great bottles of wines, selections of beer, champagne, food, waters, sodas, also a coffee vending machine!!!) overall, very good price for a nice stay in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised..exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: D K
Reviews.Content: Location: 10 minute walk from Roma Termini. If you decide to take a taxi from Termini, it should cost you about 10-15 euros. If they decide to go down Via Cavour, then it will be more than 15 euros (they will claim that all these 1 way streets forces them, but if they go towards metro Repubblica and then down Via Nazionale, it will be shorter). The way back to Termini should be quicker and cheaper if your hail your on taxi (since the 1 way streets will naturally flow back to the Termini). The hotel is great for those that like to take public transportation as metro repubblica is only a few blocks away (5 minute walk). The metro will take you to Spanish Steps, Colosseum/Forum and Vatican. For Piazza Navonna/Pantheon, you will need to bus it or walk it. Metro is only 1 euro or 4 euros for a day pass. Rooms: Very clean, modern, good closet space. Bed is firm (foam). Bathroom is very nice. I had both a shower and a shower/tub. I stayed at Artemide Hotel and iQ has better bathrooms. The amenities are done by the same company/brand. However, for some reason iQ gave me only 2 shampoo bottles and 3 bath gel bottles. Many of the bottles were opened and used before. Artemide had a wider selection and always gave new bottles. Management seemed to have cut corners here to save costs. Amenities: Wifi was decent... not blazing fast, but manageable and free. Self service laundry room was very nice. A bit expensive, but good to have for long trips. I did not go to the "kids play area", but thought that was unique for a hotel to have. Overall, great hotel.. terrific value... I would pay $100-$150 for a double room here.

Reviews.Title: “It works!”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel designed and run for the busy traveler. Small functional room with plenty of hot water, room safe, and clean. The hotel offers an extra charge breakfast buffet - worthwhile if you like a breakfast before taking on Rome, vending machines for the Q-tips and toothbrush you left at home, and a rooftop terrace to get out of the streets. The staff is exceptional. They made restaurant reservations for us, located sights we couldn't find on a map, and were cheerful and friendly. The hotel is opposite the Opera House. If you love opera or music, check out the Opera House schedule to avoid a sell-out. IQ Hotel is not an old world hotel. It would fit in very nicely in Washington, DC or Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, ideally placed and priced.”
Reviews.Author: Matt6825
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a surprise 30th birthday present for my wife. I chose the hotel based on location, facilities and obviously price! The location is perfect, only a 5-10 minute walk from termini station. We walked everywhere during our 3 night stay, including The Colosseum, The Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Vatican City. The Vatican was the furthest place to walk to and took about 40 minutes each way. If you look on the restaurant review section of Trip Advisor you will find several quality restaurants around the hotel. All are very reasonably priced on the food but drinks can sometimes work out expensive if your not careful. The hotel is fantastic. Very modern and clean. The staff are very helpful. Upon check in we were given a very helpful map of the city and told to ask if we needed any advice. Our room was on the second floor and we looked out onto the Opera House, it was perfect. In the mornings if we opened the window we could listen to the band practising. While we were there the weather was 30 degrees and the air conditioning in the room worked perfectly to keeping the room cool. As everyone has mentioned the hotel has the vending machines on most floors. They are very well priced and very handy for pretty much any drink you want. The small bottles of water were only 50 cents which is a lot cheaper that you will get while out and about. If you want larger bottles of water for your room then I would recommend going to the Spar supermarket on Via Nationale. Its a 5 minute walk from the hotel and you can get a two litre bottle for around 1 euro. All in all, we had a fantastic trip and would definitely book at the iQ Hotel again if we re-visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern oasis..”
Reviews.Author: SK6
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful modern hotel, don't think I've stopped anywhere before that has felt so new. All the fixtures and fittings were perfect and the layout was excellent. The staff were very attentive and pleasant to deal with. The business centre was nicely hidden away and could not have been better. The vending machines had excellent choice and were good value for money. Smokers are catered for with outdoor areas on each floor. Some minor points though are firstly the fact the heating system was too high and it was almost impossible to lower it which meant the room was always too hot. And the location whilst being in a nice area and having traditional Roman surroundings is rather a long walk from major sights, at least 20 minutes to get to what would be considered a main attraction. No problem if you don't mind walking but it does mean a lot of walking! I would definitely go back to the iQ and wish the owners a successful year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlanaidH
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, SO close to a metro stop. Small but exceptionally planned contemporary room. Blackout blinds. Safe in the room, amazing water pressure/heat in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Suzin L
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better location for commuting to and from the city of Rome. The hotel rooms at IQ Hotel were modern, clean and perfect for a duo of women trying to capture the essence of the city. The shower was clean and had great water pressure. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with making reservations, giving directions and answering our needs. Given the Italian transportation system was on strike the first day of our arrival, we were able to walk many miles to Vatican City even though we were miles away. Attractions are within walking distance and the key ingredient was having the central train station a 6 minute walk away and the Metro just a 2 minute walk. Commuting to Florence or other cities was a snap. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone that isn't looking for a fancy European hotel. The only suggestion we'd make to a female is to bring along a hairdryer that has a strong voltage that works in Europe. We're planning to return again if the opportunity allows itself. Plus, free WIFI was a huge benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best.”
Reviews.Author: LoSo12
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Near the subway station - Self service laundry machine & dryer - Comfortable bed - Vending machines with great prices Cons: - Helpful but unfriendly staff. They seemed a bit snobbish. They don't often smile and hardly greet you as you come through the doors. - The bathroom gave off a terrible stench. The shower drain seemed to be the culprit because just as I opened the sliding doors, I was hit with the awful smell. I told the reception desk and they just said that they would tell housekeeping. I asked to switch rooms instead and they obliged. - The heater didn't work in our room, which was bearable until housekeeping left our windows open all day. The guy at the reception desk kept telling us that we had to set the dial at 30. We kept telling him that it was set on 30 for 3 days. He finally sent a bell man that confirmed that it wasn't working so they sent up a portable heater. - The towels, sheets and the pillowcase all smelled a bit like old worn clothes. Overall their staff handled all of my complaints relatively quickly which is why they get an average rating from me. If I get to go back to Rome, I will most definitely NOT stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hammy2709
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights at the end of January and hotel was amazing. Free wifi, this was great as have new iPhone and easy to contact home and find out information about the places that we where goin to visit the following day. Rooms are lovely and modern, nice place to go after a long day out and about. Location was great, everything was within walking distance apart from Vatican city so therefore saved alot of money in transport fares. Also only a couple minute walk from termini and McDonald which always helps.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel located in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tiffofirechick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel IQ for three days in January and now consider it the only hotel we would stay at when visiting such an incredible city! Pros: -Clean, modern, well appointed room. -Bright and cheery hotel decor and amenities -Water and soda in the vending machines are far cheaper than most vendors on the street -The breakfast buffet is a bargain at 10 Euros per person -The location is fantastic! 10 min or less walk to Rome Central Termini station through safe neighborhoods. 4 minute walk to Rome Repubblica Metro station. -Free Wifi is easy to set up. Just go down to the front desk and they assign you a password and code. Then TADA! No problems! Cons: -Lack of a nice restaurant for dinner around the hotel. Tourist traps mainly, so eat when you are out and about in town. And as always, and through no fault of the hotel, watch for pickpockets on the Metro. I got grabbed once and my husband had an attempt by a group of small kids... but we were warned and we had taken precautions through purchasing Pacsafe products and dressing appropriately. So, no problems for us! We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again. I hope to see the Hotel IQ concept come to the States!

Reviews.Title: “New and Clean”
Reviews.Author: CheriYap
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011,2 nights for 3 people. Spanking Brand New Hotel, with the modern contemporary design as their theme. Nice big,clean and modern rooms. Was a surprised to find a new modern design hotel smack in the middle of Rome (ie old and ancient historical buildings) and surrounded by other hotels. Price wise, i think is slightly pricier as its a 4star hotel but if your looking for modern design i think thats the only few hotel with that price range(slightly higher than a 3star hotel) available. The breakfast was so-so only, but because places in Rome are actually further and due to the lack of time we didn't waste time walking around to find for breakfast. However, didn't like the fact that there they do not provide boiler/mini kettle in the rooms. They have this vending machine kiosk at every interval floor pantry where you can pay to buy a small plastic cup of hot water. I find the staff at the receptionist abit snobbish and wasnt really helpful. Wanted to seek their help to plan out our itinary as we have limited time. Needed help with the tourguide books because they were all in italian ( No more english version) which i can only make out the title and the price. I arrived at 9 am and was hoping to be able to start the morning tours ASAP. Anyway, manage to get it all sorted out in time and it was a great trip nevertheless. Location- as we took tours for the 2 days straight, and travelled mostly by taxi to save time, there is nothing much to comment whether if its strategic or walking distance to many places.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheughone
Reviews.Content: lovely modern hotel within walking distance of the train station, enjoyed the buffet breakfasts, was able to walk them off every day. took our time and managed to walk to all the attractions- except the vatican,- when we got a bus there and walked back. plenty of restaurants nearby to eat in, roof terrace a great idea, would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “beautiful roma”
Reviews.Author: jwalshKent
Reviews.Content: Marvellous hotel. Brilliantly situated close to main attractions and train terminus. The service was excellent - always friendly and helpful when needed. The room was very spacious and scrupulously clean - well done to all the cleaning staff. The hotel is very close to main attractions if you don't mind a stretch of the legs and there is the nearby metro at republican which takes you to main attractions if you would rather not walk. Perfect stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Altancan
Reviews.Content: Only 7 minutes away from Roma termini train station. Hotel has got a free wifi. The staff very friendly and helpful ! Especially I wouldl ike to thank Hitcham and Cezar ! They really know how the customer relations is supposed to be !

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: daren l
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. People at hotel were of amazing help. Our luggage was lost by TAP and people at the hotel were very helpful at all times. Room is really nice. At arrivel, we were served complimentary snacks because we were hungry. The only drawback is that hotel is not close to Colosseum and Trevi, but overall it is a great choice for it´s price, quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: LeoOlgaAna
Reviews.Content: 12 friends and I - we were 4 families, with 6 kids - were at IQ between 06th and 11th of January. Everything was perfect ! The location, the cleaning, the laundry, the wi fi internet, the breakfast and the staff - specially Alberto, who helped us everytime we need, with good tips about restaurants and travels around Rome - were great. We loved it !!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Missing clothes”
Reviews.Author: Ed R
Reviews.Content: A pair of my jeans went missing during my stay in January 2012 which when queried Melanie Peer - Guest Relations Officer I'm still awaiting a reply to my email sent over 48 hours ago

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: soyleyenbht
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was fantastic, very close everywhere by metro or bus. Building was modern. Room was very clean. Breakfast was wonderful. Only negative thing in the room, there weren't any shelves in wardrobe. All stafs were helpful and nice. If I go to rome again, I will absolutely prefer this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, functional, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nic_Auckland_NZ
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a great location. Nice and helpful staff. Free Internet and lots of 24 hr services via vending machines for drinks, snacks, laundry etc. Good starting point for walking or sightseeing tours of the city. Rooms are small and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo34
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that the staff was very helpful and friendly and the rooms were very clean. This hotel is very modern chic. It tries very hard to be hip and new age with its styling and decor. The room itself was small and the bed was very hard (like most European hotel beds). I have to say there was nothing really wrong with the room, but we were just disappointed because we had upgraded to this hotel from a cheaper one thinking we were getting something special, but it wasn't. If you want a real taste of Roma don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “STERILE CLEAN HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: 21Linda21
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 weeks at the IQ Hotel in Rome, the end of November and beginning of December. We were concerned about choosing a hotel that offered a good location and clean facilities. We were not disappointed with the IQ. We picked the IQ based on Expedia and Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is clean to the point of being sterile. One could eat off the floor. We arranged ahead of time for a car transfer and everything went smoothly at the airport, our car was waiting for us. The location of IQ is very close to the Termini Train Station which is very convenient if you are planning to travel to other cities in Italy. We used the Termini for trips to Florence and Venice and found it very convenient to the IQ and easy to navigate. The IQ rooms were of adequate size, our room faced the Opera House right next door. It has a rooftop deck and vending machines for snacks, drinks, etc. We were too busy to do breakfast at the hotel but peeked in one day and found it to be very nice looking. Although breakfast is never included at the IQ, it was only 10 or 12 euro and for Rome prices that's not too bad. I would definitely recommend the IQ, the front desk was very helpful. Although close to Termini, major sites required a taxi. This was by far the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great stafff”
Reviews.Author: RLA94
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August as part of our 'mini-moon'. Absolutely perfect! We had a fantastic room, massive bathroom and the best aircon you can imagine (which was great considering the heat in August) In a great location, right next to Termini and the general sights. Sme great little places to eat around there too. Loved the fact there were vending machines for drinks and snacks of all sorts...even mini bottles of Prosecco. The only slight niggle was that, as we were close to the gym the running machine made our entire room shake!! Not good for sleep quality. Just ask for a room not near the gym! To be honest, I wish there more more hotels like this that focused on the quality that IQ does. Would not hesitate to stay here again. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: candyhohoho
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel with a no-frills yet high quality concept. A popular hotel so do book in advance. We booked online for a small room at the cheapest rate as it was the only one available but managed to change to a standard room by topping up the price difference when available. We monitored the room availability regularly ourselves. The email correspondences were prompt and efficient. We can purchase bottled mineral water, liquor, snacks and toiletries cheaply from the vending machines in the hotel. However we could hear people moving chairs upstairs (rooftop restarant) in our room late at night and in the early morning. The hotel's location is good as it is walking distance to most tourist attractions. The new and functional gym was mostly vacant while we were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Taxsideyths
