Reviews.Content: Very nice, NEW hotel, located near metro line. 20 minutes walk far from many sights. Clean, comfortable, quiet. - Cooling was very strong Recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: P_and_P_Adventures
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during our week in Rome. The hotel is located in a great location. It's only about a 15 minute walk just to the Colosseum and only about a 5 minute walk from Rome Termini. The furniture and bathroom in our room was great. Everything was modern and stylish. The double bed room and bathroom itself had plenty of space. The wifi is free and there were plenty of vending machines (coffee, snacks, and alcohol). The roof had a nice place to hang out and even a little play ground for kids. The breakfast in the morning cost 10 Euros, but it is a breakfast buffet so you can definitely get your money's worth of food. The assortment and quality of food was adequate. The hotel was a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to say but....”
Reviews.Author: Anouk199
Reviews.Content: Awesome. Amazing. Great find. Very modern. LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: navyjenn26
Reviews.Content: I been living in Italy for the last 3 years and go to Rome often. This is the best hotel I have had the pleasure to stay at. Great staff and location. This is going to be my hotel of choice in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean accommodations for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: zeppo33
Reviews.Content: Clean, straightforward hotel and zero frills here. My room heater wasn't working, they moved me right away and comped me breakfast. I like the vending machines (coffee to wine to water) and there is a washer/dryer and a gym. If you are looking for a nice, basic property to stay in while you are sightseeing, you won't be disappointed. The beds are a little too firm and the rooms are small, but it was fine. The 10 Euro breakfast leaves much to be desired, however. Skip it and go elsewhere for less. The desk staff was always very accommodating and very courteous. I got a good deal online, but wouldn't want to pay much more than 115 Euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Jocaxxx
Reviews.Content: The iQ Hotel is located near the Termini Train Station. That means you can reach the hotel on foot when you arrive from the airport with Leonardo Express train. It also means that you can use the subway to reach the Vatican City and the Coliseum (as the station Teatro dell'Ópera is very close to the hotel). These are the only positive things I can say about the location. Although the neighborhood is quite pleasant, given the proximity to the creepy Termini Station, you're going to walk a lot to check out Rome attractions. There are 2 McDonald's restaurants and a supermarket near to the hotel, and also a great number of little restaurants. The breakfast buffet is fresh, tasty and abundant. The rooms are not huge, but they aren't uncomfortable. The bathroom is clean and well lit. The bed is cozy. There's in-room safe. The wi-fi was fast and stable, but you're required to log on every time your device wakes up from sleeping or stand by mode. One thing I didn't like about the room is that it is paved with carpet, which I find rather unhygienic. The rooms facing the street have a little balcony. The hotel is brand new, which is a rarity in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: iQ is a modern hotel near the Opera House in Rome. My mom, sister & I stayed for 3 nights in November. The location is wonderful - only a 3 block walk to the Metro. The hotel staff speaks wonderful English and are very kind. We stayed in a triple - good sized room with a large bathroom. The best part about the stay was the continental breakfast. It was the best breakfast we had on our stay in Italy. The food was excellent with several Vegetarian options (my mom is vegetarian). The only complaint we had was the room was very warm but the hotel staff accommodated us with a fan which definitely cooled things down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at IQ hotel Roma”
Reviews.Author: Ally4685
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the IQ hotel for a week for our honeymoon. The service was amazing, we couldn't have been more impressed. They went above and beyond to meet our needs and were always welcoming and friendly. The hotel itself was very clean and modern, with a luxurious bathroom. I especially loved the huge bath which is rare in Italy. The complimentary wi fi was also very handy. It was also in easy walking distance to the colesseum and termini station. We would happily come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRGRealtor
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a modern feel. Staff was very friendly and spoke English very well. Rooms are sufficient in size with complementary WiFi. Breakfast buffet proved to be a good value. Hotell location was very convenient. We would hightly recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathrynjc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November for our honeymoon. I knew when I booked it that it was modern and not grand or traditional like a lot of hotels in Rome but we both loved it! the reception staff were very helpful when we checked in and out and the entire hotel is spotless. We stayed in room 101 which had a small balcony, very good for observing a little bit of life. The room was spacious enough for two but the bathroom was really generous with seperate bath and shower. We paid extra for the breakfast which we both enjoyed although I stuck the the pastries. If you're from the UK and expecting a 'full English' then you will find the breakfast to be very European but it was plentiful and available until half ten which is a bonus. The hotel is centrally located as you can walk to all the main sites including the Coloseum and the Trevi Fountain. There are plenty of restaurants nearby also and the termini station is very close. We even walked to the Vatican which takes about 40 mins but as it was 20 degrees C and sunny when we were there the walk was lovely. However, the main selling point for us was the rooftop terrace. We took other travellers advice and took our blanket up there one night to enjoy some Frascati al fresco. The vending machine is brilliant and so cheap too, perfect for before or after dinner. The only way this hotel could be improved is if there were onsite facilities for dinner but walking around the nearby streets looking for a good place to stop was part of the charm of our visit. The staff were very efficient during check-out and outlined all the options for us to get back to the airport. There is also a luggage room which is attended so a bellboy stows the bags for you. Not a hugely important detail but made the trip slightly more pleasant. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Spiderman1970
Reviews.Content: Nice and modern hotel perfectly located in the city center. Reasonable quality/money approach. Professional and ready-to-help staff. Well-balanced and appropriate solution for smokers and non-smokers.Two small problems worthwhile considering: small leakage under the washbasin and slow WiFi that is quite frustrating. In all other respects - one of the best hotels I've used to stay which really deserves to be recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travellingmama1
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last city stop in our most recent Italian trip. We decided to book at IQ Hotel Roma because friends said it was modern, clean and had free wifi. They failed to mention that it was also near the Metro- this made sight seeing even more convenient. Fontana di Trevi was just a stop away. While the Vatican museum was just 5 stops away. Check in was easy and hassle free. You get access to the internet for all your devices (my husband and I had an iphone and a laptop each). We opted not to take breakfast here (quite pricey at 10 euros each) but it was not a problem since there are so many nice, quaint coffee shops nearby. We actually walked from the Termini to the hotel- another plus. I would recommend this hotel to travelers who don't mind taking the Metro instead of being right in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean hotel, privacy, quick internet!”
Reviews.Author: etarmo
Reviews.Content: For those who seek for a modern standard hotel, this is the one! Free internet on a very high speed level. Breakfast good (very good bacon!). Location very good. For those, who seek an on site hotel restoran or at least a bar, there is none. It is a different type of hotel, with vending machines for everything: from coffee to toothpaste (btw. with reasonable prices). Modern garage for parking just beneath the hotel. We took this hotel because of a high rating at tripadvisor, and indeed, IQ is worth its top position! It offers a lot of privacy, which is often not available even at 5-star hotels. Would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: webbsm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay in Rome based on trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed in a triple room where the double was made from two beds pushed together but u couldn't tell. The beds are firm which they seem to prefer in Europe. After mentioning this to reception they put on a foam topper. Bliss. The buffet was good although quiet so staff stood around and watched us eat. Awkward. Other big pluses are the free wi fi, laundry and big bathrooms. If IQ were a chain we would stay with them all through Italy

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and well priced for a good base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Waynaldo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December. It's a modern hotel that serves its purpose of a well located base to explore Rome from. Would recommend if you are looking for a clean, well presented hotel and you are not interested in 5 Star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: buddenbrooks
Reviews.Content: Such a friendly reception from the clerk on duty when we arrived. He was so so pleasant. Quiet location. Decor international bland but very functional and pleasant but you could be anywhere in the world. Room was very pleasant and comfortable and wonderfully quiet. I loved the vending machines with such reasonable prices and loved the way there was a little lending area for books in reception. But did not like the pop type music in the corridors but this was not at all audible in our room. Noise pollution is becoming more prevalent everywhere. Silence is such a pleasant state.

Reviews.Title: “High iQ”
Reviews.Author: Kendal B
Reviews.Content: The iQ Hotel was a very comfortable and affordable hotel for our trip to Rome. It was clean, the fridge wasn't crammed with expensive little drinks, there was a vending machine with snacks and toothbrushes on our floor, and another with bottles of various alcoholic drinks on the top floor as you enter the rooftop terrace (which I wish I would have spent more time on!). The breakfast buffet was great, the location made it easy to get to from the train station (if you don't get lost!), and we didn't have any problems! It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sachin R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at iQ Hotel for 5 nights from 28 Nov - 3 Dec 2011. This is a great hotel. Modern, clean and comfortable. The rooms are reasonably sized, although the walls are a bit thin! The breakfast's good. No frills. I would still call it a 3-star hotel. However, it was more than satisfactory for my needs. The location, however, is absolutely fantastic. As somebody else mentioned, you can easily walk to the great sights, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. Perfect if you like exploring the streets. Metro stations are close by. The main junction, Stazione Termini, is a 5-minute walk from the hotel. So getting to the Colosseum or Vatican is easy. Would recommend it for first-time travellers to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Guapbob
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 weeks in Itlay, mostly in rented apartments, we decided to book this modern hotel for a stress-free few days before heading home. We loved it. The room was not huge but large enough for us and a comfoprtable cot for our daughter. The hotel was very modern and clean and walkable to many major sights. Since it's fairly close to the train station, all the major bus lines are also nearby. We decided not to pay for breakfast at the hotel, since it's a bit pricey, but found terrific cafes nearby where we breakfasted with the locals. Nice feature: the hotel vending machines provide very adequate coffee, espresso, capucino, and even wines and snack! I would not hesitate to receommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic relaxed hotel - good with kids”
Reviews.Author: Aleezoop
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel - its clean, spacious, great location - we walked to Trevi Fountain and Colosseum and Piazza Venezia - all around from here with kids. Very helpful, friendly staff. Lovely roof terrace with play area. Breakfast is good too.

Reviews.Title: “IQ Roma - Just book it!”
Reviews.Author: Roland E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at IQ in late November 2011. This is a new, modern, clean, and centrally located hotel that has all you need to be your home base to explore Roma. The staff was very friendly, and always willing to help with a smile. Bathrooms were pretty big when compared to other european hotels, our room was a triple, and it included a jacuzzi tub which you don't see much in hotels in central Roma. Breakfast was plentiful, with a nice continental/American style menu. The hotel is very close to the metro station which is crowded, but takes you anywhere in Rome in minutes. We walked to Trevi fountain both nights we were there...about a 10 min walk. Vending machines stocked with wine and beer was nice. This is a self-service hotel, so if you prefer to be serviced hand and foot this is not the hotel for you. It was great for us, since we did not come to relax in Rome, but to explore this great city. We were so tired at the end of the day that all we wanted was to shower and sleep. Book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “iQ hotel not Roman but very nice..”
Reviews.Author: ic2ss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the iQ in early October. This is a very chic modern hotel as shown on their website. We didn't mind the fact that it wasn't decorated in a Roman motif. We wanted a reasonably nice sized room, which we got. The rooms a simple but comfy. We didn't have the breakfast included and didn't end up eating breakfast there but we checked it out and it looked like a typical buffet with hot/cold selections. We opted for pastries and coffee at a coffee bar/liquor store just on the other side of the opera house. Great coffee. Some points: 1. Clean, spacious rooms 2. Good wifi 3. Quiet location about 10 minutes from Termini train station 4. About 25 minute walk to Coloseum, same for Trevi fountain. We're walkers so we walked everywhere. Even back from the Vatican. 5. Friendly staff Plenty of restaurants nearby. We loved La Taverna dei Monti about a 8-10 minute walk away. Great food at reasonable prices with complimentary biscotti and limoncello after dinner. See reviews for this place on Tripadvisor. We wouldn't hesistate to stay here again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLcmm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel before and after our cruise in October 2011. It's modern, new and clean. It was convenient to have a washer and dryer in the hotel, the washer also already comes with detergent built in. The wi-fi worked well most of the time except when it rained the service would intermittently not work. The location was close to shops but a little bit longer of a walk to sites. Our room overlooked the street and it had a small balcony you could walk out on. My only complaint is that the beds were a little on the hard side.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and forward thinking”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Kite
Reviews.Content: Thanks for pointing us to the iQ Hotel Rome. It's a very efficient, modern, quiet and friendly hotel, about 4 blocks from the bus and rail terminus. Not far to pull bags as a new arrival without your wits about you. Over our two day stay we had three problems with our room. Firstly no heating, then only bathroom towel rail heating, then a constant whine in our room. Each was quickly dealt with when we reported the problems and gradually all settled. The hotel was full, and we had a disabled visitor room as that was the only room left. Maybe it had been closed a while. We slept very comfortably in our clean and modern room. Safe provided. Others have mentioned the sensible facilities, be it vending machines down to small bottles of wine... the small gym/sauna.... washing facilities etc. But as people have mentioned, breakfast is the key. It's served on the top floor - roof terrace available in summer. Huge range of cereals, meats, cheeses, hot buffet, juices, fruit, coffee, lovely cakes. At €10 a person it's not a big hit to make your mind up on the day if you choose - but well well worth it. The subway is only a couple of blocks away so getting to the Vatican, Colosseum, Spanish Steps is easy. A main shopping street is just at the end of the block as well. All in all, very central, very clean, very polite, very quiet and very convenient. If you're tired on arrival like we were, try Bertizello for a cosy pizza or pasta. We went both nights and had excellent meals at a great price. See separate review, but thank to the iQ for our stay, and that dining recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “IQ Works”
Reviews.Author: Steven W
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on the basis of: 1) Rick Steves, 2) Trip Adv ratings/comments and 3) Ability to accommodate family of four. Highlights of the hotel: 1. New and clean. 2. Sharp contemporary design. 3. Excellent location near Metro 4. Quiet for being in the middle of everything. 5. Staff quite helpful. 6. Breakfast on 5th floor great way to start day.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and comfortable; great location”
Reviews.Author: mmcgrath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights (2 couples in 2 rooms) and thought the hotel was good -- I would rebook it without hesitation. The main plus points are clean, modern rooms (I like a firm bed and ours was perfect), excellent breakfast and friendly staff. My only negatives are very minor: the internet arrangement is convoluted -- you need to log in every time you come back to the hotel which I thought was a minor irritation. Also, the concept is unusual -- there's no hotel bar and you don't really interact with other guests like you might in a more conventional hotel. Whether this annoys you or not depends on your own personality I suppose! Any interaction with the staff found them to be polite and knowledgable so I have no difficulty recommending it to prospective Rome visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful... just wonderful Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AlexM458
Reviews.Content: Got an idea to visit Italy 3 years ago. Then 6 moth ago started planning my vacation, because actually persuaded my boss to give me a week off. Then I found one website - Economybookings.com. It's a car broker, but that wasn't the fact, that helped me - there were routs around some great places... and for happy me (and my family) found there a nice trip around Rome! So, I bought my tickets and went to my dream-city or city of my dreams... and it was LEGENDARY! Visited a lot of great places like Campo dei Fiori, The magical Trevi fountain (oh... my wife and me just loved it! Also threw a coin to be back))) and, of course, The Colosseum! We've spent there a week (5 days actually)... and all of these days we've stayed here, in iQ Hotel Roma! Not so expensive and with very good service. Actually if we're coming back - we'll stay here too. Don't know what to say more about this hotel - we just liked it - just like at home)) And, of course, we want to get back as soon, as it will be possible. I know, that there are a lot of reviews like mine, but this trip was just WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a great central location.”
Reviews.Author: marklgraham
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based upon the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed in this hotel for four nights in March 2011. Upon arrival, we were informed that there was a problem with our room, and we would be "upgraded" to their sister hotel which was around the corner, for the first night of our stay. We were slightly concerned at this, but the staff assured us that we would like the "premium" hotel that they were providing. As it turns out, the hotel was fantastic, and we had no further problems after this first night. The rooms weren't massive, but they were of an adequate size for what we needed them for. They were of a modern decor, and very clean and tidy each day. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was very modern also, and extremely clean. The location of the hotel is perfect, very to close to Via Nationale, which is a prime location for most sight seeing opportunities - 5-10 minute walk to Colosseum, Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Due to being relocated for the first night (which was no inconvenience to us), we were upgraded to free breakfast each day for the remainder of our stay, which was a very nice touch. The breakfast is typical Continental breakfast buffet style, which was very nice. Perhaps one of the best features of this hotel, was the rooftop terrace. It has plenty of comfy chairs/sofas, and also has a vending machine stocked with very reasonably priced alcoholic/soft drinks and food, such as sandwiches and snacks. We found this to be a great feature, and somewhere very nice to relax after dinner, as it was always open and quiet. Overall, a great hotel and we will definitely return when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: FRMPBH
Reviews.Content: So we just spent 12 days in Rome (work/fun). We stayed in 4 different hotels, this was by far the best value. That said the rooms were a bit prisonish but stylish, sort of what a white collar prison might look like in the future. Now the front desk staff; Cezar and Cristian were great!!! They gave us good recommendations and were very friendly. The location was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excelence @ Rome”
Reviews.Author: EdwardRodriguez
Reviews.Content: Great place, great service, nice and clean room, extraordinary locations. It's the best place you can find to stay at Rome. We loved!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in ROME :)”
Reviews.Author: devedge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and the hotel was surprisingly very nice. This botique hotel has very nice modern interior, clean and comfortable beds. Location was accessible to any ancient sites, colleseum, roman forum, etc. neighborhood was also safe its very near Via Nationale, lots of shops and restaurants nearby. What I really like with this hotel is its remarkable service. I need to print some documents I left, and the person in charge at the front desk (Christian) gladly ask me to email it to them and they'll print it or me, free of charge! :) Definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to Kick Off Our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room for 3 nights during our first stop in Italy. It's not too far from Termini, which makes transit a breeze. The front desk was efficient and our room on the 4th floor was ready for us at 11am. Our room has a balcony that overlooks Teatro dell'Opera and a vending machine that sells basic necessity aroud the corner. On the first floor, there is a washer and dryer that cost 3 eur per cycle. If you have a big load, you might need two cycles for the dryer, which I did. I read the instructions closely, but somehow the second dry cycle didn't work as expected and I had to call the front desk, who sent up a grumpy porter who asked me "Did you read the instructions?" in a not so friendly tone. Umm, yeah I did, which is why the first dry cycle worked without a glitch. Anyway, he came back up again and loaded the machine and we are back in business. The 5th floor has an awesome alcohol vending machine - champagne, wine, beer, plastic cups/glasses are widely available. A separate coffee machine and snacks machine are in the same area. You can get your drinks and walk out to the rooftop seating area if weather permits. It's a very cozy area to unwind and relax before dinner. We utilized the gym on the second floor once during our stay. It's very compact - 3 treadmills, several bike stations, weights and a stairmaster. During the stay, we hopped on the 64 bus multiple times on Via Nationale (2 mins walk) to a lot of the attractions (it goes all the way to St Peter's Basilica). Also, the Republica station is only 3 mins walk away but there were constructions going on which shuts down the metro system at 9pm most days. Overall, great stay and couldn't ask for a better hotel to kick start our trip!

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: dri44
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel. room cosy and quiet. service top class, staff really nice and helpful.breakfast very good. location perfect. would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel - very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MaltaTeresa
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for one night as I was in Rome for business and I can't fault it in any way at all. The only thing it is missing is the 'personal touch' which I always look for in a hotel. The staff though very helpful and polite were very business like and I always enjoy befriending staff whenever I travel and putting characters to a person's face rather than just a name. The rooms are huge and perfectly equipped. The bathrooms are also fantastic! There is free Wi-Fi and the breakfast (additional cost) has an excellent choice. I loved the little touches such as a night light near the bed. There is a small bar at reception but other than that there are self service pay machines located all over the hotel. Families with young children will love this hotel as there also is a self service launderette!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B
Reviews.Content: Thank you IQ Hote Roma for making our trip even more great.. Modern, clean hotel. We had a 3-persons bedroom with a very good size! The breakfast buffet was more than enough. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. The vendingmachine on the 5the floor (wine!) is a great alternative for the hotel bar. I would recommand this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bexy83
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I felt like I was in North America in it, and then when I went outside I was in Rome. It was clean, quiet, comfortable and modern. The shower was awesome too. The staff were also great. Great location too...5 minute walk from the main train station and even closer to a metro stop. Oh, and they also have free Wifi (that actually works) and a really good breakfast ($10). Got a good deal on Expedia for this hotel as well. Basically, it's the perfect home base for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, modern, upclass”
Reviews.Author: Dean L
Reviews.Content: Great upmarket modern hotel. Pillows were slightly thin. Other than that, no complaints. Alberto at front desk was excellent. Slightly on the expensive side for us but highly recommended if within your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dondon253
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better hotel to stay in for 4 nights in Rome. Clean, comfortable, well positioned with very friendly staff. Restaurant recommendations from the front desk were spot on, and we found working our way around to all the major sights very easy indeed. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Modern Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: prncessmou
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the IQ Roma for 3 nights during our Italy Honeymoon and absolutely LOVED it! As soon as we walked into the lobby, the staff was very friendly and informative about guided tours as well as areas to walk around. One of the great things about this hotel is its location - it is within walking distance to most of the major sites, as well as the major transportation hub / subways & hop-on hop-off buses! Our room, on the 2nd floor facing the theater, was extrememly clean and spacious (for European standards) with a HUGE bathroom. The only complaint I have is that there was no clock in the actual room. We had paid the 10 euro extra / day for breakfast and it was well worth it (we both said it was the best breakfast we had on our entire trip to Italy). The spread of cereals, meats, cheeses, pastries, fruit, yogurt was delicious and kept us full for most of the day. We ate at one of the hotel recommended restaurants (Cotto). The food was good, but I think there are better places to eat near Piazza Navona / Pantheon or Piazza Popolo areas. I definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again on my next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: timk42
Reviews.Content: This place is great! It has all the things you want or need and it is clean and close to just about everything. It is very modern and the staff are helpful and informative. We would recommend this place to anyone as we enjoyed it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, great location, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa M
Reviews.Content: I booked the IQ Roma for 3 nights for my husband and myself. I booked it beccause, while I can really appreciate visiting the historic parts of Roma, I really can appreciate a modern hotel with modern conveniences. The hotel is in the best location that it possibly can be, within walking distance to all the major sites. The price for this 4 star hotel beats all the rest. And the conveniences far outweigh the rest. There are vending machines with beer, wine, champagne, drinks, and snacks. The breakfast buffet is stellar, and the breakfast room is very sunny, and lovely. We also spent our evenings relaxing on the rooftop sipping on wine. Staff were friendly, and so helpful. Superb hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet, well located”
Reviews.Author: Julien J
Reviews.Content: We travel with my wife and my son (1.5 years old). Everything was perfect. We recommend the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in its simplicity”
Reviews.Author: caydiner
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I have selected this hotels based on reviews I read online. On the other hand, I was a little anxious that most of them were a little too favorable. I dropped them an e-mail before my wife and I arrived to check if they offered airport transfers. They replied swiftly with as a matter of fact a little lower cost than the taxi. They also reserved a table for us at a restaurant I mentioned. On our arrival, we were greeted with a smile and directly shown to our room although we arrived 3 hours before the regular check in time. Our room was spotless and provided all the required amenities. The hotels policy to not rip you off with mini bar prices by placing vending machines (that you can buy soft drinks, alcoholic beverages, snacks and even travel accessories) was refreshing. When it comes to location, the hotel is about 250m from the Republica Metro Station and also Termini. The staff was always pleasant and helpful during our 5 night stay. For this price range, I doubt that you can get a better location/service/amenities package in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Old World City”
Reviews.Author: fawkolgirl
Reviews.Content: We researched for quite a few months all the hotels in Rome, before we booked IQ. We were very happy with our choice. This hotel is in a good location, with reasonable rates and facilities. The decor is very clean, bright and modern. The front desk staff are all cheerful and very helpful. The hotel is close to Termini Railway Station, and within walking distance to most major attractions. It is located at the side of the Opera House, on a lane way. Close by are local restaurants, grocery shop,atm's, retail stores for clothing, shoes etc. I booked early, and requested a quiet room with a balcony. I received a 5th Floor room with a balcony at the back of the hotel. I was very pleased with my room. The room size was very adequate for two people, with a nice modern bathroom. The beds were quite firm, but comfortable. We had breakfast for 10euro each, and was pleased with the quality, variety and service in the breakfast room. The Hotel has a garden roof terrace on the top floor, and is a lovely retreat to spend time there at the end of your day. The vending machines are a terrific facility, and prices are very reasonable. I'm glad we chose IQ Hotel, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGill05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in October and were very happy. The hotel is well placed in a quiet but well lit street next to the Opera. The Colesseum, and Trevi Fountain were within walking distance, as was the main Termini rail station. The rooms were very clean, well designed and modern and wifi was free. Breakfast was 10eu each. It was very good but if you just want a coffee and croissant then go to one of the many little cafes near the opera. The staff were very friendly and helpful. One tip if you are arriving at the Termini station after dark from the Airport then walk through to the front entrance of the station, otherwise you end up on a dark (but busy) side street with no proper pavement.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: rhonda l
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this very clean and modern Hotel, centrally located. The room had everything we needed including high speed internet very functional. Beautiful batrooms. help is very helpful and they try hard to make your stay exceptional. Flawless Hotel, congratulations to the management for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleVino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at iQ after a conference to enjoy Rome for 4 days. The hotel is modern, very clean, a great value, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Our room had no flaws. The gorgoeus bathroom had both a shower and a tub. The shower was amazing, including the black currant soaps. We had everything we needed and loved the modern minimalistic feel, yet lots of room (surprisingly for Europe). We just can't stand old fashioned hotels and iQ was perfect for us. The wireless internet worked great, and we used their business center to print our tickets for the Vatican museums. It is also worth mentioning they have a vending machine that has a great selection of affordable wine, bubbles and beer. A wine opener is conveniently attached to the neighboring wall. The 10 euro breakfast deal was totally worth it. If you are to explore Rome every day, you need a good breakfast. The buffet included fruit, yogurt, cold meats, delicious pastries, eggs, cereal, milk, juices, espresso, etc. It is served on the top floor next to a very large and lovely terrace. We would make sure to fuel up every morning before heading out to walk our feet off. The location is pretty good too. You are a short walk from a metro stop, although if you like walking you can easily head to Rome's core on foot. There is a grocery store less than half a block away for all your needs. We rarely dined in the area though. The concierge recommended a restaurant when we arrived but sadly it was closed and we ended up eating at the Irish pub nearby (you'll be surprised how popular Irish pubs are in Rome... anyway the daily menu offered decent italian fare), but of course I would not recommend it unless you can't find anything else. The restaurants near the hotel always looked empty, with eager waiters trying to attract customers by the sidewalk: never a good sign. The historic areas offer lots of great cafes and pizzerias, so that's where we did most of our eating. The hotel is in a great location for shopping. Via Nazionale has a long strip of clothing and shoe shops with good prices. All in all, we were really impressed by the great value offered by iQ Roma. We'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: amaroo_9
Reviews.Content: IQ Hotel Rome was fantastic and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. Stayed for 4 nights in October The vending machines are a great idea and not overpriced as would be expected. Loved the fully functional laundry no need to bring washing powder or softener as all was built into the machine, however they could do with a few more. Front staff were more than helpful, had a room overlooking the Opera which was nice. Termini and Repuplica Train stations were within a 7 minute walk, Republica takes to straight to the vatican but suggest you buy tickets for vatican on line first or its a good 3 hour wait and thats in the off season. Walk Trevi, Spanish Steps and Colesseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: eliza261
Reviews.Content: We Stayed 3 nights in Late October before our cruise at the hotel IQ the staff were friendly, the location was perfect for exploring the city. We really enjoyed the tub after a long day of sight seeing.. It is close to restaurants and the washer/dryer was so handy! We would definitely stay again and recommend to friends...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl W
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with extremely helpful and friendly staff. It is a little more expensive and is a new hotel. Great breakfast and the staff went above and beyond the call of duty even when there were language barriers. The rooms were a decent size (double with 2 single beds) and the bathrooms were nice. I wish the restaurant was open for more than just breakfast but there were so many restaurants right outside the door of the hotel that it was not an issue. They arranged my car service for me to and from the airport and had relationships with the tour companies even when they did not make the arrangements for us. I would definitely stay there again and recommend them if you want a moderately priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IQ Hotel Roma”
Reviews.Author: brauksim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely, modern, well located hotel for 3 nights in September We felt it provided excellent value as our comfortable standard room was large with a modern ensuite complete with a seperate shower and a bath. The breakfast buffet was plentiful in quantity and choice and the garden terrace was a relaxing and pleasant spot to unwind after a long day of sight-seeing. We did not make use of the business centre, but felt that the daily Wi-Fi charge quoted was reasonable. The IQ hotel has its own coin operated laundry facility (cheap) and is located a few minutes stroll from the main train station and in the opposite direction to Via Nationale that has buses and a metro station giving access to the major sights Rome has to offer. There were numerous eateries nearby and the staff were informative and helpful. Vending machines in the hotel provided refreshments (chips, chocolates etc) at prices cheaper than at the local supermarket! In addition, our floor (and probably all floors) had a free self service ice-machine. We loved this hotel for its fresh feel, convenient, quiet location and client focus. We would not hesitate to stay at the IQ again and recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “IQ Hotel Roma”
Reviews.Author: barnmeister
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the IQ after reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't let down. Excellent value, good size room, good breakfast with large choice of items, great roof top terrace and briiliant staff. Ideal location for exploring Rome and plenty of eateries nearby for an evening meal if you don't want to go too far after a day exploring Rome. Metro stop 5mins walk away. Loved the self service machines located in the hotel for drinks and snacks, good value and plenty of choice, especially the beer and wine machine. Would certainly be our 1st choice when returning to Rome..10 out 10

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Quality, Marriott Prices; Uncomfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: cmorri
Reviews.Content: Being frequent travelers and regular users of TripAdvisor, we were surprised with our experience compared to the posted reviews. Pros: - Good location - Friendly staff ("No's" are delivered friendly too) - Clean rooms Cons: - Very uncomfortable, hard bed. - Crummy pillows. (Lousy bed and pillows make for a rough night's sleep. ) - Rooms are very small. - "No" to reasonable requests - Nickel-and-dime strategies - The Ground Floor Discount Ward - No value to the excessive prices. It's a clean 2-star hotel at a 4-5 star price. Overall, this is a nickel-and-dime you hotel that expects excessive rates and offers the minimum in return. They are somehow competing in a category to which they do not belong. That is all that needs to be said, but for more detail on our experiences, read on... - The Plastic Cup Strategy. Here's a real money-maker. You are given two flimsy plastic cups at the beginning of your stay. Subsequent flimsy plastic cups can be purchased from a vending machine for 50 cents each. Glasses will not be made available for guest use at any price. Try and buy a cocktail to use the glass in your room, or tip for the use of the glass, and you will be told "No, that is not our concept. You must buy the plastic cup to use in your room from a vending machine on the nth floor." This is a real fit for a 250eu/nt hotel. (Don't wash two glasses for a customer paying hundreds of euros, or even let them buy use of the glasses from you, we must maintain focus on the 50 cent plastic cup margin.) Find other comments about the plastic cup obsession in other reviews. If I am making it sound endearing, then I am telling it wrong. - The Ground Floor Discount Ward. The ground floor rooms are offered at "special rates". If you book on-line or through brokers, they might be giving you the ground floor room, which are also disabled-access rooms. Why is that a negative? It shouldn't be. You should even have a little more space. What they are NOT disclosing is that the showers do not drain fast enough, and there is no containment, such that the bathroom floods after two minutes. So your choice is to turn on/off the water throughout your shower, or flood the bathroom and subsequently the adjacent carpet. I cannot imagine who would offer such a thing to their guests. Instead of correcting it, they still market the rooms as-is for a discount, without specifying the discount is for standing in a pool of water in the bathroom. That is not ok. What would you pay to stay in a room where you must turn on/off the water every 2 minutes while flooding the bathroom, standing in water at the sink and toilet, knowing that this is known by the management but they still want you to have it? It's a lousy thing to do to someone. Thankfully in our case, they changed our room begrudgingly--we would have checked out otherwise-- but imagine if the hotel is full, you are stuck with an intolerable situation. So I'm giving it 2-stars instead of 1-star for saying Yes on the most important item. We stayed because they changed our room (and I only have one day of photos with unwashed hair). But the hotel is still overvalued and uncomfortable, so we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mitchiemong
Reviews.Content: Fantastic modern hotel. Great for today's traveller. Rooms were very clean and spacious with great bathroom facilities. Liked that Wifi, room safe and fridge were all free....BONUS. The hotel had great breakfast facilities which for €10 was well worth the cost considering prices on the street. Great roof terrace to relax throughout the day and night.The hotel had laundering/ironing facilities to use at a reasonable cost. They even provided microwaves for your convenience. Vending machines are located on the 5th floor next to roof terrace and contain sandwiches, confectionary, beers, wine, juice, water and coffee all at very reasonable prices. There is a small well equipped gym with sauna which has upto date machines. Hotel staff were always courteous and polite and very keen to give advise and recommendations for places to go and to eat. Location was fantastic, central and within walking distance to all the great attractions. Based on my stay I would definately choose this hotel next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “iQ Hotel Roma”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneF449
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel in Rome. Everything is perfect, location, large room with large bathroom, a nice big bath which is welcome after long walks in Rome, service, staff, breakfast is very generous and the terrace is wonderful to share a cocktail with other guests before going out for diner.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: Daver46
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor reviews, my wife and I chose the iQ for 4 nights prior to a Mediterranean cruise in early September. We requested an inside room, 3rd or 4th floor, to avoid any street noise; and yes, our room was quiet. The hotel is new, clean, comfortable, has great washrooms and firm beds. Some might consider the rooms small, but we found them on a par, size-wise to most European hotels. The staff very helpful despite our sad attempts at Italian. All the sights were within walking distance, so we wandering Rome on foot in 30-35 degree weather for 4 days, and returned mid-afternoon for a relaxing rooftop rest in comfortable loungers close to the handy drink dispenser (wine 5-7e, beer 2-3e, water .5e). After a rest and a shower, we were off to dinner - lots of choices nearby. The extra 10e for breakfast on the rooftop terrace was well worth it. After our stay, we spoke to other cruise passengers who had come into Rome a few days early - after hearing of our iQ experience, they wish they'd stayed there. We highly recommend iQ, and although a smaller hotel, found it as good as many 5 star hotels in other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: NFGal
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel last year and were delighted. Our room was chic, stylish and perfect for us. A very high end bathroom, modern foyer, beautiful rooftop patio, and high speed internet; this place has everything you need. A wine vending machine just outside the rooftop terrace and buffet breakfast for an additional fee make this hotel perfect. We loved how close it was to shopping and attractions. My only critism would be the laundry area. While it is a great perk, we weren't able to access it largely because there was tremendous demand and few machines. We left laundry until the last minute and couldn't make it happen before we had to leave. Plan to do it early and it may be easier! I had a terrble cold while in Rome and the front desk staff person was incredibly helpful translating the medication instructions from italian to english. I am considering returning to Rome with my husband next year and would definately stay there again.Wonderful service, wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonCjs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in the iQ Hotel Roma. Room was clean and decorated to a good standard. We tried the breakfast buffet one day which was pretty good value and had a good spread of cold buffet and a gew hot items. Roof garden is lovely, only downside is there's no great view. Drinks machines were great value - 0.50 Euro for bottled water and bottles of wine for under 5 Euro. Overall a great place to stay - I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: Paxlulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights and it was a wonderful experience. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean from top to bottom. Vending machines provide reasonably priced food and accessories. The washer/dryer on the second floor cleaned my clothes very well and it's only 3 Euros per cycle. Wifi was included with my room rate and had a strong signal. My room was facing the side street and for the most part it was quiet. I did wake up one night around 2 a.m. to what sounded like a garbage truck or dump truck from the street below. If you're a light sleeper I suggest bringing ear plugs or request a room facing the inner courtyard. The breakfast buffet was not bad: Scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, yogurt, deli meat, cheeses, fruit, coffee and juices. But for 10 Euros I would like to see more variety such as waffles, sausages, eggs benedict, etc. Overall, I loved my experience at IQ hotel Roma and I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: likestoeat53
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean and very modern. Only drawback is we had a "small" double room and boy, was it small! But for the price it really was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jared C
Reviews.Content: My group of 7 were all extremely impressed with the hotel both as a concept and as a place to stay during a fantastic holiday in Rome. The rooms were immaculate and quiet, the breakfast superb and the reception staff extremely helpful. The location was excellent for access to all the main locations and we could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean and new, but misses something..”
Reviews.Author: Barloe
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a young atmosphere, it is kind of trendy without being a design hote, but most of all it all works and it is clean and fresh. I did how ever have the expectation of the hotel being either more luxurious or more of a design-hotel, but in reality it is a veru simple and good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a modern, slick and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location, 5 minute walk from termini and rebublica metro stations. Walkable distance to trevi. The hotel was very clean, our room cleaned daily. This standard of cleanliness we found throughout the hotel. The rooms weren't massive but not tiny. The bed was a king and comfortable! We enjoyed the breakfast (served 7-10.30), a mixture of continental fayre and a few hot bits; bacon, eggs, sausage (I'm fussy on sausage and this was very good) and tomato. @€10 each was a fair price. The hotel doesnt have a bar as such but a roof terrace with vending machines+ coffee machine. They had a decent selection of beers €2.50-3.50 and full bottles of wine from €6 plus equally sensibly priced soft drinks and water. Really impressed with this as beers and soft drinks were cheaper than the carrefour supermarket round the corner. Downside is u cant get spirits and the sandwiches looked a bit poor. Staff spoke good English and were friendly, helping us to store our baggage on the last day whilst we made the most of the gap between checkout and our flight. I will stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab-u-lous”
Reviews.Author: HeatherCyclops
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the hotel. The reception staff were excellent. We had a family room overlooking the theatre which had plently of space, storage space, and a large bathroom with a bath and a shower. Very comfortable beds. It must be the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. Really liked the roof-garden area and the unique 'alcohol' vending machine. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Although not right in the heart of the city everywhere was still walkable even with children.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Roma Stay”
Reviews.Author: BCGlenda
Reviews.Content: There's nothing negative to say about our stay with iQ Roma. Check-in was seamless & the staff very helpful (Rome map is provided), rooms are spotless with wonderful showers that don't spray water all over the room. The area is very quiet & allowed a great sleeping atmosphere (perhaps better to get a room facing the courtyard). The gym is small but useful cardio equipment is available. The laundry (3 euro per wash) is convenient but the dryer doesn't work very well (don't think it's vented properly so hang clothes to dry in room). The roof top terrace is a nice place to enjoy some wine or beer (available at decent prices in the 5th floor vending machine) & the 10 euro breakfast was enough to get fuelled up for the large amount of walking that we did (eggs & low fat yogurt were available along with the typical pastries). The location of the hotel cannot be beat- 10 minute walk from the train station with luggage was no problem (took the 65 euro for 4 people hotel shuttle to the airport for convenience sake) & we were able to walk to all of the sites (Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Vatican City, etc) very easily by going down via Nazionale. We will definitely return to iQ the next time we're in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lyn”
Reviews.Author: Lyn27524
Reviews.Content: We had three excellent days in Rome staying at I.Q. Hotel. It was an excellent location and the staff very helpful. Reception held our bags when we arrived in the morning and by mid-day our room was ready. I.Q. hotel provided all we needed and it was an extra bonus to have laundry facilities, which I have never seen in Europe before; the vending machines are also a great idea. Breakfast too on the rooftop terrace is excellent. I would not hesitate to recommend I.Q. Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hard bed but good choice”
Reviews.Author: transom
Reviews.Content: agree with most of the reviews on here. We found the bed very hard but some like them that way. Rather soulless place to be honest, but perfectly adequate in every way. Like most cities the area around the train station is a bit run down and now that we are familiar with Rome we would look for a hotel in the older area of town which has a lot more character.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you want”
Reviews.Author: NumbersPete
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with friendly staff and all you need for a relaxing stay in Rome after spending the day exploring the city. Beds are firm but spacious and comfortable. We had a good size bathroom with excellent shower and plenty of hot water. The maids are very friendly and kept everything clean and tidy. There is even a space in the fridge for your own food and an ice machine every other floor. Breakfast is a little pricey but there is a Carrefour a minute away where you can pick up items for breakfast. Location is a simple walk from Termini and it's easy to wander to most sights. Close to the metro as well if needed. P.S. no swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PasquaB
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms although somewhat tight. Great staff. Very helpful with directions and travel arrangements to and from the airport or pier. We stayed 3 nights and were pleased with the arrangements. Hotel is built around an indoor atrium. Our room faced the atrium so we had no daylight. Breakfast buffet the hotel offers was very good, but very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well-located”
Reviews.Author: ruma02
Reviews.Content: We booked IQ Roma after seeing the reviews, and we were happy here during our short trip to Rome in September. Of course, it's very modern, quite a change after the old-world charm of our other Italian stays, but the location and general efficiency made up for that, so we didn't mind. What impressed me was how handy the much-discussed vending machines were (a decent array of wines and other knick knacks, even a coffee dispensing machine) and a washing machine & dryer as well so we could catch up on our laundry. The rooftop is a good option if you don't want to go out to eat ...a guest told me he picked up wine from a well-stocked shop at the square, bought some pizza, and dined quite happily out here! The beds are firm yet comfortable, and the empty fridge means you can store your own wine/water without displacing any mini-bar stuff. We didn't have the breakfast (but heard it's good), preferring a tiny place across the square which served delicious hot croissants & coffee. The hotel staff are extremely helpful, giving directions, advice, calling cabs when needed. Housekeeping is efficient. There's a business centre where we printed out our flight boarding passes for a small fee. Useful.Also the free wi-fi. The whole self service concept around is very handy, and in these days especially, is just what many guests want - not to pay for unnecessary frills, yet have all the comforts. Termini, Rome's main station is a short walk, so my teenage son just walked down there to catch his train to the airport. There are also lots of very nice restaurants & pizzerias around, as well as some shopping. With the Opera house facing the hotel, I would have loved to have gone one evening, but this was between performances. Next time perhaps! Don't expect high luxury here, as everything is functional, yet modern and well-fitted out. If you're looking for value and a good location, then this is a good bet. As for the minus points, I won't dwell on it. Read Little Cupcakes review, he's spot on.

Reviews.Title: “The francombes and khannas getaway”
Reviews.Author: Rachel F
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the Iq Roma we were very pleased,we had rooms on the 4th floor and they overlooked a quiet side street.The rooms were very modern and pleasing to the eye and the wallet.The beds were memory foam and very comfortable,the best experience for us was the roof terrace,this became a frequent place for us to visit and the drinks from the vending machine were reasonably priced,probably cheaper than from any bar,the great thing is that you have a fridge in your room to use as you wish so we bought are own drinks from the supermarket .We met some lovely people whilst we were lounging on the roof terrace,and the whole experience of Rome will leave happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KifTos
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 4 nights and were very satisfied with the hotel. The rooms were modern and new. Beds were a little hard, but I still slept great. Modern aircondition was great in the heat. All of the hotel was in very clean and quite centrally located. The staff was also very friendly. Good breakfast offered on rooftop for Euro 10 where you could sit both inside or outside. They also offered coin wasing mashines and vending mashines selling everything from food, coffee, wine, beer, snacks to personal items. And at a great price! The best was the rooftop. Here we could bring our own food and beverages (or buy from the nice priced vending mashines) and get away from the croud and traffic. Expecially great if you have small children and small italian coffee shops aren't ideal. There was also a playground there, but still very quiet. The hotel is very modern and minimalistic, so not for you that are looking for a typical italian style and atmosphere. Great value for your money, and would absolutly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overdelivers As A Budget Choice, Don't Pay Full Rate, Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: LittleCupcakes
Reviews.Content: I had a 7 night stay in mid-October in room 404 (room type: small double), for which the rate averaged 167 Euros per night. You've read much about iQ, mostly glowing praise, and mostly well-deserved. Instead of leading with the the worn-out yays, however, I'll get this review on the road with the minor niggles. Note that even these things couldn't take much lustre off the iQ, as long as it's booked at their "50% off for 3+ nights" rate. At full price, much of the appeal would be lost. The wi-fi was fairly wonky (unreliable) late a few nights (not necessarily a big deal) and it's also filtered within an inch of it's life, with plenty of non-adult sites on the no-no list. Not cool, iQ. The toiletries are fairly low-quality. Bring your own soap if possible. There is very little flat space in the bathroom to place a toothbrush, hair product, shaving stuff etc. This was more than annoying but less than maddening; two guests' worth of items might be quite maddening to juggle. The soundproofing is not so good-I could hear Blackberry chimes and coughs from the next room, and housekeeping sounds in that room were very loud. Plastic cups in the room! In a $200/night hotel? And along those same lines, no bottle opener (or corkscrew). The ceiling lighting (I swear I'm not making this up) popped and clicked as it cooled down. Turn off the ceiling lights well before bedtime if those types of noises would be bothersome (lost an hour's sleep myself)-housekeeping always turned them back on. The "Do Not Disturb" door hanger alone is a suggestion sometimes ignored by the staff; put your key in the lighting slot AND use the sign AND use the "Do Not Disturb" light (switch is by the bed) for full protection. That's about it for the negatives, so moving on... My "small double" was pretty small, but not cramped-two travellers might find it a little constricting. The iQ Roma is actually fairly basic, with few of the niceties that might be expected in a four star hotel (this is a government rating-USA guests might see "three star" as more accurate). While modern, still fairly new, and with a classic European vibe, the room is still very basic-bed, desk, closet, bathroom, TV, refrigerator. No iPod dock, clock radio, etc. Fourth floor rooms (street views) have balconies which is cool. Anyway, all the rest you've read (or will soon read) is pretty much true: Roof area with foosball, vending machines, friendly staff, hard bed, close to Termini, fitness center, laundry room, sauna, etc. There're restaurants close by, there's shopping, a fruit stand, a Post Office, and a McDonald's (traveler's tip: McDonald's is Italian for "restroom here"). I walked to many major tourist attractions in 20 minutes or less. Vatican City and Trastevere are further, but that's why there are subways and buses. With Termini nearby, all that's pretty easy to arrange. There's one USA voltage/plug shape outlet in the bathroom. Make sure the switch is set properly. I didn't have breakfast at the iQ, or turn on the TV so nothing to report on those fronts. The iQ Roma is a good value at half-off, and I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: 576Rosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Italy and were very impressed with the rooms and services provided by the hotel. It is close to public transport, shops, tourist attractions and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The breakfast offered for Euro10 was excellent. We had previously stayed on arrival in Italy in a typical Rome hotel, i.e. old establishment which offered small rooms so were presently surprised with the high standard of iQ Roma. Although we didnt get to use the rooftop garden it looks like it offers the traveller a break away area to chill out and rest your legs after a day of wearing out the pavement from looking at tourist attractions. Would definitely stay here again when next in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: kristinatravels
Reviews.Content: It has been a few months since our lovely trip to Italy. I already reviewed a few places we stayed, but I was reminded of the lovely IQ hotel the other day (they helped translate a traffic violation we received in the mail the other day). While there is something to be said for old world charm and history, there is also something to be said for modern convenience and cleanliness. After spending all day looking at beautiful art and history, it was nice to come back to an ultr modern shower and clean, comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in a central location”
Reviews.Author: drjohnLaValle_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the IQ Roma. Very nice, new hotel, with a large room. The roof top terrace was fine, but no views since it was fenced in all around. Hotel staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. No language problems at all. We walked throughout the central district from the hotel. Walked to the Galleria Borghesi in about 20 minutes. Several very good restaurants within a block or so. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotels- IQ right up there”
Reviews.Author: PatRepa
Reviews.Content: Pleasant well located Hotel with good amenities very close to Termini and also most of the main attractions of Rome. Excellent staff who were aware of our early arrival and early departure and went out of their way to ensure that we were well accommodated with our requests. Very pleasant experience for Rome. Will use them again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Laura V
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy with my family in March of 2011. We started in Venice, then Florence and then Rome. I was excited to see iQ Hotel Roma because it was new and supposedly very nice. I was slightly disappointed. My family had two rooms. One for my two daughters and one for my husband and me. The rooms either face into a courtyard- where smoking is allowed, or face the street. My daughters room faced the street out front, and my husband and I had a room that faced the courtyard. My daughters and complained of street noise during the night. We requested for them to change rooms, and after a couple of tries, succeeded. We asked to have a room facing the courtyard, and far away from the smoking section. My husband and I kept our room while our daughters moved up a floor to their new room. I didn't like that they were on a different floor, but they people at the front desk told us that it was the closest room. The breakfast was wonderful. There was a huge selection and it was all pretty good. I would recommend this hotel, but make sure to ask for a room that faces in, and far away from the smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: trritch
Reviews.Content: Ou 3 night stay at the IQ Hotel was perfect. Its a short walk (3-5 minutes) to the Termini Station. Probably about a 10-15 minute walk to all other sites(Colosseum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps). Very convenient. The Vatican requires a bus/taxi. Hotel is close to various bars/restaurants. Bank machine right next door. Hotel is very modern (which we like) and has everything you need but a onsite restaurant However they have a great european style breakfast, in a nice room, or you can sit outside in the Terrace. Probably the best hotel breakfast we had on our trip. The have vending machines for all your needs(especially the first night when we did not have our luggage). They also have a vending machine with wine (short or full bottles of wine), beer, water, other beverages). They also have a coffee/espresso vending machine. There is a very small Lobby Bar, but not well stocked. Room was very clean, decent sized, not big but room enough for two. Bathroom was clean, modern and decent size as well. Shower is your typical European Hotel sized shower, but had 2 shower heads. Along with a bidet, if you so desire. Hairdryer for the folks that care. Also had a safe, empty refrigerator, and good storage. Staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Would we stay here again, Definitely!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, efficient”
Reviews.Author: trvlcrzy
Reviews.Content: Our group got 6 rooms at IQ Roma hotel and the hotel delivered as advertised. It was in the modern style which I loved as opposed to a lot of hotels in Rome. I liked the accessibility of having vending machines for purchase of certain necessities at decent prices like water, juice, wine. No need to make that grocery run. The all inclusive washing machines are great too (comes with a loading of soap per wash, so no need to buy that either). Staff is efficient and friendly. Very close to Republicca metro stop too.

Reviews.Title: “Will book this again when next in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Boston1533
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews and it certainly lived up to them! Very clean, modern rooms, friendly staff, well priced and excellent location. This was our first visit to Rome and the hotel was easy walking distance to all major attractions and has many restaurants close by. The room was very relaxing to come back to after a long day exploring the city and easy to get back to when out later at night. No room service or mini bar but they had self service vending machines (including hot drinks and alcohol),good breakfast area and gym – very well thought out.

Reviews.Title: “Great contemporary hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rach3380
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the iQ hotel for a week in September and really liked it. It's an easy walk from Termini station and we walked to almost all the sights from the hotel. I particularly liked the roof terrace which was great for relaxing in the evenings, and made even better by the bar-in-a-vending-machine, which we thought was genius. We had the hotel breakfast on the roof terrace most mornings which was good, although the coffee wasn't great. We had a room looking out on to the atrium which was nice and quiet, a reasonable size and furnished well. We liked that the fridge was left empty. The hotel's self-service vibe really suited our style of traveling. Having said that, we found the reception staff really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: sue p
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 3 nights but thought it was absolutely ideal for a Rome visit. The rooms are so clean and slick and modern The area is good too as it's close to the train and metro so not too much walking needed. Reception staff are lovely and the breakfast up on the terrace is great. You can really fill up for the day at a decent price! We would stay here again if we return one day to this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: Penny2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a recent trip to Rome and was pleasantly surprised. Handy location within walking distance of Termini station (5 min stroll) or 2 mins from Republicca metro station. If arriving into Termini its much easier to walk than it is to go via Republicca metro station as there are lots of stairs which is awkward! Room was really spacious, very clean (although this is a new hotel so would expect that). Some thought went into what travellers need with insure, cheap self-laundry facilities, vending machines covering everything from snacks to umbrellas. Great rooftop area for hanging out and drinks (both alcoholic and non) available St supermarket prices. Staff were great. Will definitely stay here on my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and modern hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: umgeni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel after a long struggle to find affordable family accommodation in Rome for two nights before our apartment became available. Overall the stay was comfortable with modern clean rooms and pleasant service from the front desk. Be aware however that the hotel is charmless and very expensive for what is on offer and the location is not ideal with being close to the railway station and metro but not much else. Breakfast is buffet style chaos think Las Vegas $9.99 buffets and beware as we were under the impression that it was included in the room rate but it was not. I can see why many travellers rate the hotel highly as it is almost a relief to find an American style hotel in Rome but for anyone with a family apartments offer much better value and a much better travel experience. Would not stay here again unless price was a bargain as the location does not justify it.

Reviews.Title: “September 2011”
Reviews.Author: George_Boise_Idaho
Reviews.Content: I have made six different trips to Rome and for a centrally located hotel this is one of the best that I have stayed in. A good value for the money considering hotel prices in Rome. Staff was very helpful, the rooms were modern, clean and quiet. Breakfast of the rooftop terrace was good. We loved the wine and beer vending machines and the prices are very reasonable..great idea. I would stay here again the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the IQ Hotel and it was perfect. Great room, great location and very reasonable prices in the self-sevice chillers. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: tammyNsteve
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Rome, having stayed 3 nights at the iQ Roma Hotel in a triple room. The service was really exceptional as we were greeted with warm smiles and offered assistance with dining, taxi service and sightseeing opportunities. Our triple room was very spacious, modern and quiet. It was centrally located next to the Opera House and within a short 3 block walk to the Termini station so getting around on foot from the hotel was quite easy. This was my second trip to Rome in 2 years and I have stayed at or visited a number of different establishments and would certainly recommend the iQ Roma Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fresh, well located hotel with all the necessities”
Reviews.Author: baxter82
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights with a group of friends. this is a hotel in pretty great condition, with all ur modern needs (wi-fi for free) and even a self serviced laundry ( 3 euro for each cycle, + gym and sauna as well. the rooms are reasonably priced and the toilets in good condition. the hotel is within walking distances to central station (rome termini) and other main attractions around rome (even the vatican, but this is a very long walk). didnt try their breakfast, given so many options nearby. in particular, down the road on via nazionale, the place is called teatro opera, great coffee and sandwiches (tremezzino). perhaps a point that is well pushed forward previously, if u want to go cheap for ur coffee, do not take a table/seats. stand up like the locals! would come back to stay here at the hotel again! addit: most of the hotel staff was very helpful and nice, except one who was a bit short and needs to learn to be more hospitable. perhaps he needs to continue on his training a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel, loved the wine vending machine!!”
Reviews.Author: pandatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in Aug-Sept 2011 and thought it was a great value and great location. We loved the proximity to the metro (although due to another subway line being built, the metro is only open until 9pm except Sat., something I didnt read anywhere in all my reasearch before going) The nearest Palazzo it is near- Republica is very beautiful when lit up at night, a great place to get a bottle of wine and people watch! The hotel is very clean and modern. The vending machines and rooftop terrace are very nice, and the front desk is helpful. They have one wahsing machine and one dryer, but we found it diffucult to use becasue other guests would leave their items there, skip ahead etc. Not the hotels fault but plan accordingly if you plan to use it. Also no irons in the room, only one to use in the laundry room. Overall a very good place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great new modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: even i have been in rome many times its not easy to find new hotels with normal rates in a good location ,old properties many but new ones few with that in mind i loved this hotel we got a very large king bed room with street view but not noisy at all location is far away from restaurants ,sites and action but if you need to be near termini station its perfect ,we were here one night and then rented a car from termini station so choice of location made sence for us breakfast included was also great walking time to trevi fountain its at least 20 minutes through a unglamour tunnel you can cut this time

Reviews.Title: “A European La Quinta - for $300/night. yes - that's right.”
Reviews.Author: k-tonian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying at our last of 3 nights in Rome ath the iQ Hotel. I read a *lot* of reviews/looked at a lot of sites before booking this one. This is not our first trip to Rome, but it has been a decade since we were here last. That said - I'm a spoiled American, and it always takes me aback when in Europe how much less they get for so much more money. That said - this hotel is *very* clean and new - a big positive. The staff is friendly and helpful - another great positive. The rooms are tiny (like most Roman hotel rooms). But - for the price (I think around 300/night with all the myriad taxes) - it's not any better than a La Quinta back home. I'm not being sarcastic. I'm a fan of La Quinta for the same reasons - clean, comfortable, solid service. The location was decent - not great. Short walking distance to the metro - longer walking distance to any good sites (Trevi Fountain). Would I recommend it? sure. Again - *very* clean/great service. Would I stay here again? probably not - it lacked charm and no views. The rooftop terrace was okay - lacked charm. The same way I wouldn't recommend a tourist new too the states staying at a La Quinta - this is more for the serious traveler just looking for clean and comfortable - not necessarily any charm.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near the train”
Reviews.Author: maude_leroux
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on our last night in Rome because it is near Termini train station. We payed a very high price but there were not a lot of good hotel available. The neighborhood is not pretty and does not feel safe. We walked more toward the west to find nicer surrondings. This hotel is extremely clean and the rooms are big. The bathroom is a good size. There is a great terrace on the roof with self-serving machine for drinks and snacks. To me, it is not really good value for money because you don't find in this hotel the little ''plus'' that habitually goes with this kind of hotel. The breakfast is not included. If you want to see Rome and not just travel from or to the airport or the train, I would not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us (clean and well situated)”
Reviews.Author: LadyMcD
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews we are glad we chose this hotel. Loved the roof top terrace, the clean rooms, and the buffet breakfast. Staff very helpful. Great location, especially if you will be leaving Rome by train!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but sparce”
Reviews.Author: traveler5
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for price and convenience. It was near to the train station where we were picking up a car for the rest of our trip. The rooms and decorations were contemporary, clean and convenient. My only regret was that the beds were a bit hard to our taste, but quite comfortable. Lovely bathrooms. Breakfast was extra and nice, but we used a local shoppe for getting coffee and bread in the morning (right around the corner). Terrific gelato around the corner each evening was very nice, too. Walked to the Pantheon and took cabs to some other spots - Colliseum but could have walked (It was very hot for September). Very helpful staff and I'd recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Abbie B
