Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy, and when in Rome we stayed here for 2 nights. From the train station we got lost finding the hotel, but that was lack of proper research, on the way back to the airport at the end of our stay its a total breeze, very easy walk of just a few mins. It was my husband and I (late 20's) and my parents (mid-60's), and it was great for all four of us. We received early check in for one of the rooms so we were able to store our luggage, refresh and hit the pavement. PROS: Clean, modern, new, free wifi, beautiful roofdeck, convenient to walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, other historic landmarks. Most of the hotel staff was very accommodating (they were great about calling us a taxi when we went to Via Veneto, Vatican City) and when I needed to print our train tickets they let me use the business center free of charge because the reception printer was down. We also found the vending machines to be super cheap/affordable and on almost all the floors ( this came in handy when we needed fresh water/sodas/etc.) AC was great too. We also did laundry one night in the self-service laundry - this was very helpful. CONS: There's not much happening with a 4 block radius. It's a convenient location to get to/from sites, but not if you want to walk outside your door and have plenty of restaurant options/shopping/cafes. The breakfast is not included - its 10E per person. It is worth it if you like pastries, continental style, especially considering that there aren't a ton of places to eat close by. (There are a few restaurants, don't get me wrong, it's just a limited selection) The rooms are super small. The bed is super firm. None of these things bothered us, but it's good to just be aware - it's not a bed that you are going to mind getting out of, lol. Overall, this was a great place for us to stay. We enjoyed our stay, and would stay here again if in Rome. I would recommend this hotel to others, especially if you want a clean, sleek, modern feel. The highlight of this hotel is the roofdeck. Every night we'd go up and share a bottle of wine (also cheap in the vending machines - and good too - who would have thought!?) before dinner. It was beautiful weather, comfortable couches and made for a great start to our evening. I have some pictures - I will try to post them soon. Enjoy your time if you chose to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...nothing special”
Reviews.Author: aafendy
Reviews.Content: Rome was our 3rd stop in our Italy vacation, and I was looking very forward to it. The hotel is very near the train station so that was a good thing. There were 2 men at the reception desk and the one guy that was checking us in was beyond rude. When we were about done, we asked if there was a service that booked tours for us, and he said no you do it online. We were on the ground floor, one of two rooms. Our room was the only handicap room in the hotel, and the hotel failed to tell me that, they just said you have a ground floor room. The rooms feel a bit dark and depressing to me, the beds were hard and uncomfortable as well. I went to complain to the front desk that night to the same rude receptionist and he kept on saying well the ground floor is handicap, you booked the room. It did not say anything about handicap when booking the room, and he said there is nothing he can do and if we want we can change the room at an extra charge. I decided to sleep on it and decide in the morning, after taking a shower, I needed a new room. The floor was completely wet because there was no tub for the shower. Thankfully there was another girl at the reception that morning, and she was very helpful and said we can change our room without charge. So avoid groundfloor rooms. Our rate did not include breakfast, so we decided to try it one day, and ew, worst breakfast I had. Not work 10 euros at all. The location was good, was able to walk to most of sites. Overall average hotel, my least favorite hotels from the 4 that I stayed at in Italy. Will def. look for another hotel if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ciffs_travels
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here (Sept 17-21) at the end of our 17 night holiday in Italy. We arrived by train from Naples and having never been in Rome were a bit challenged to find the hotel. Using our map we did come upon it in about 10 or 15 minutes. It is truly just a stroll from the main Termini/ train station. The property is modern and has only been open for just over a year. It is close to all of the main attractions and historic sites, except the Vatican (although we did walk back from there). The rooms are small but nicely furnished. The rooftop deck is really a great idea and we met many nice people there in the evenings. The hotel also sent out notes before and after our stay which we felt were a nice touch. Our only criticism of the property is that although they encourage you to bring food into your room, there is nothing there (no cups, glasses, bowls or cutlery) and you have to purchase or acquire these elsewhere if you want to eat or drink in your room. Also, the bed is hard (like a futon). They called us a private car for our departure from Rome airport which was a very nice Mercedes sedan versus the typical small cabs in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Leandrodd
Reviews.Content: 4 nights we stayed at the hotel IQ Roma, the hotel is new, clean, organized, modern and mostly comfortable. The room has a great size, with excellent bedding. Breakfast plentiful and set. roofing in a space with chairs and sofas very nice, not to mention the optimal location, close to everything. we must keep two bags for 5 days when we went to Positano, the hotel kept them and not charged for it. dont think twice if you are looking for hotel in Rome, this should be your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and Vending Machines!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the reviews. Great value in an expensive city. The location was ideal to walk to most of what Rome has to offer. The vending machines, which were incredibly reasonable, and the roof terrace were both an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Missy A
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in early September, and would definitely stay here again. It was quiet, clean, and tastefully furnished. The staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke very good English. They offer a reasonably priced rooftop breakfast with good selections and quality. It is a 5 minute walk to the Republica metro stop, and we felt very safe walking around the area. It was less than 15 Euros for a taxi ride to just about any other tourist location we went to. The only down side is that the beds are rock hard, and didn't make for the best night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel IQ - Lived up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: FifiTrixiebelle7
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel in Rome. Good reviews say it all. It is clean, modern and has everthing you need in a good central location. Felt very safe out at night although it is close to Termini station which has a bad reputation. Vending machines are an excellent idea for making after dinner drinks affordable as the bars can be very expensive. Rooftop terrace is an excellent area for socialising with friends. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome who enjoys modern boutique hotels. Best restauraant we found was 10 minute walk from hotel - Tori de Imperiali

Reviews.Title: “A really clean hotel with everything you need as a traveller.”
Reviews.Author: Wajjin
Reviews.Content: Very very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel. Extremely comfortable beds, unless you like soft and sloppy ones. All basic amenities in good prices. E.g 1 bottle ice tea for 1 euro. In kiosks it costs 3,50 and in shops sometimes 1,29 or 1,45 even. Stayed 2 nights in iq and 5 in waldorf Astoria. Next time will choose IQ anytime. Only slight downside, male staff at the desks didn't seem too willing or helpful in providing info as compared to the female staff who was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect moderate priced hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dwgcontact
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 friends stayed at the IQ Hotel for our 10 day trip to Rome. The hotel is within easy walking distance from the main train station. Of course, the train from the airport delivers you to the farthest platform - so be ready for a hefty walk with your luggage. The hotel is close to the city's limited Metro system (Repubblica Station) which will whisk you to either the Vatican or Herculaneum. We had 4 different standard rooms on two different floors in the hotel during our stay. All of the rooms were nicely equipped with comfortable (but firm) beds and equipment that was in good condition. We had plenty of space for two adults - including hanging and storage space. The room had a refrigerator and safe. The bathroom had a nice sized shower and good quality toiletries for our use. The hotel is equipped with vendor style machines for basic food items and drink including wine. A decent grocery store is located nearby for purchasing any additional food items. An ice machine is located on the top floor to fill your glass [tip: we brought a small collapsable ice chest to keep more in our room]. The hotel has coin washer and dryers - which automatically fed soap and softener. The laundry also had a iron and ironing board. Several rooms included an outdoor balcony space without any seating or furniture which would have been a nice addition. That said, the rooftop deck had plenty of comfortable seating in its shared space. We discovered that each floor was equipped with a small 'smoking' deck with chairs and sofa which I never found occupied during our stay [tip: good escape for your morning coffee]. The exercise room was well equipped with weights and cardio equipment. The hotel is a good walk from many of Rome's main attractions so we gave up on using the gym. We also discovered the many attractions near the hotel that were terrific - and a welcome short cut to the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. Staff was extremely helpful in meeting all of our requests from additional pillows to securing a taxi [a feat more difficult than you might expect in a large city]. They never grimaced at any of our requests and always came through with a smile and success. All in all - IQ Hotel is a solid option for your visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jodyh02
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous stay at this hotel the rooms were excellent very clean and modern , the roof terrrace is great and the vending machines are an excellent idea at very reasonable prices enjoyed a couple of nights at the roof terrace with a prosecco. It is in an excellent position 10 minutes walking distance from the train station and within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions would highly recommend and would definitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Central to the city and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our first 4 days of honeymoon. It's close to the metro station and also a 10 minute walk from the main station which takes you interstate. It was comfortable and spacious. Well worth the price. The service was perfect and the staff all spoke english so it was easy to ask for directions, and you get free wi fii!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value for price, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Katleen1973
Reviews.Content: location is great (city center, but in a quiet street), rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Excellent price/quality

Reviews.Title: “Like nothing else for the money”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel was such a great surprise. It was modern. It had rooms that could accomodate 4 people. We had two rooms for a girls trip and all of us really loved this place. If you are going to Rome for the first time and especially if you are from the U.S., this is a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Nazanin M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and modern with amenities you don't usually get at older hotels in Rome. There is a coin operated washer and dryer which comes in very handy. On almost every floor there are vending machines with coffee, snacks and drinks (excellent price for bottled water). On the top floor there is wine and beer vending machine (good prices) on your way out to the rooftop terrace which is great to enjoy a drink before you go out for the night.

Reviews.Title: “New & Totally Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: Mabir
Reviews.Content: Its a new hotel off a main road near Termini and Repubblica. The hotel is very new and worth every cent we paid for it. The rooms are somewhat small but good enough for a couple. Its a hotel where everything is there and there is no need to bother the service staff time and again. You have the washing machines which cost 3 Euros for washing and 3 Euros for drying. The dryer was spoilt so ended up drying our clothes in the balcony. There was an iron so ironed my clothes at the laundry area as well. Then there are the very handy vending machines which we usually went to before we headed out to stock up on our waters and some bites as well. And while walking around saw some other hotels around the area and were glad that we selected IQ Hotel as its new. This was our first stop in italy as we moved onto Florence, Venice & Milan where the hotels we older and were not as good as IQ Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: em h
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the IQ Roma in November of 2010. The rooms were very clean, modern, and well-furnished. The hotel staff was super helpful, and went out of their way to assist us with tour bookings. The hotel's location was ideal - just one block off one of the major shopping streets and literally across the street from the Opera. Cute little restaurants are located on the streets surrounding the hotel. There's also a grocery store located close by. Public transportation (buses and the train) is also located within walking distance. The only caveat I have is that if you're in a room facing the street, the early morning garbage collection can be quite a racket.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1219
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms are a bit small, but very clean, modern hotel. After traveling for a week, my husband and I were happy to find a washing machine at the hotel. Granted they only have one, but it is better than nothing. Nice rooftop area, convenient vending machines with water, beer, wine, and other toiletries available.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Lublasi303605
Reviews.Content: When you search for hotels in Rome, it's really hard to find something new or renovated. So, if you´re looking for a modern place, with great beds, very clean bathroom and the best breakfast I ate in Europe, this is the place to go. You can go to major attractions walking, it usually took us about 15 min to go to Fontana di Trevi. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: 5Travellers1263
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the iQ Hotel Roma for a long weekend with our three children ages 8, 9 and 11. The hotel was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The rooms were efficient and had nice little balconies. The staff members were all very helpful with restaurant suggestions, directions and happily changed the configuration of the beds in the room when asked. We took advantage of the hotel's transportation service. This was really a wonderful service for us- our evening flight was an hour late and it took another hour for our luggage to come off the plane. I went out to meet the driver while my husband waited for the bags. The driver was there with a sign bearing our name. He was very kind and had no problem waiting for us. It would have been a nightmare taking a train and then the metro to the hotel at 11:00 PM with three children. The hotel was located just a few minutes walk from the Repubblica metro stop and there were several decent restaurants in the area. I would certainly stay in this hotel again as well as suggest it to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: UKavidholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor about this hotel, we were looking forward to this 3 day trip to Rome to celebrate our 32nd wedding anniversary. We contacted the hotel via email for restaurant recommendations and they responded promptly, giving 3 websites. They then kindly booked a restaurant at our request. All staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay and the hotel and room and terrace area were spotlessly clean. We were however very disappointed with our room as when we checked in they did not tell us our room was adapted for people with disabilities, hence we were on the ground floor and had a floor level shower, no bath, but all necessary bathroom adaptations including basin and toilet. When we showered the floor was very wet, even with a plastic shower curtain which was not sufficient to stop the floor becoming dangerously slippy for able bodied people. Being on ground level and with a road adjacent to the room which throughout the night was noisy with people walking past and traffic noise, we did not sleep well. We did question at the reception after our first night about whether the room had been adapted for people with disabilites and the receptionist seemed reluctant to answer the question at first but then did say 'yes' and then offered to move us if we packed our bags for the hotel staff to move whilst we were out for the day. We did not take them up on this offer as we were on our way out for a tour and didn't have the time to repack.The room was functional, and easy on the eye, but 4 hangers and 3 very small drawers are not enough for 2 adult's clothes. The TV has a lot of channels but only 2 in English, and both are news channels. We did not use the mini fridge in the room as we were out a lot sightseeing and preferred to eat in local restaurants, but thought it was an excellent idea and would be very beneficial as a norm. The vending machines are excellent for drinks and affordable. The food and snack items did not appeal. We had breakfast the first morning which was adequate, nicely presented and plenty to choose from. At 10 euro each and because we don't like to eat masses of food it wasn't really cost effective for us. The coffee in the breakfast area machine was of a better quality than the coffee in the vending machine areas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the iQ Hotel based upon the reviews we read and were very happy we did. The hotel is very clean and offers a very comfortable atmosphere, the front desk staff and cleaners were always happy to anwser our questions and help out in any way. The top floor patio was a wonderful break after a long day of site seeing, the vending machines offer everything from snacks to espresso, wine, beer and water at prices hard to beat! We also ate at the breakfast buffet 2 mornings, very nice selections and the quality was good. We were able to walk to many of the sites from the hotel (Trevi Fountain, Colosseum), those that were a little out of our walking distance (Vatican) were a short cab ride away When we return to Rome we will definitely stay at the iQ

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: trip atkins
Reviews.Content: Just 5 or 6 few blocks from termini station but very quiet. Can walk from train, bus or subway, even with wheeled luggage. Nice clean modern room. Helpful staff who speak English. Wi-fi worked,as did in- room safe. Excellent for price point, not a full service luxury hotel. Good bed but very firm mattress. AC did not cool adequately- room too hot in August. Located right next to Opera hall- we got lost walking from the train, get a good map or directions to Opera. Would stay again but not in the summer because of AC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly, and efficient. Everything that you need from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThomB123
Reviews.Content: From the ease of booking online, to the express checkout, this hotel rates high in our book. The hotel is convenient to transportation. The Repubblica metro station is three blocks away, and the bus lines stop along Nazionale, just one block away. Taxi to the heart of the old city is under 10 Euro from the hotel. The staff was very helpful, all spoke English well, which was great for us, and though we asked a million questions, they never acted bothered. The rooms are very clean and modern, and though they may seem small by US standards, they are quite adequate. Everything functioned well in both the room and the bathroom. Vending machines in the hotel dispense wine and beer with good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & stylish”
Reviews.Author: Mjour
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the iQ during our stay in Rome. It is very modern, spacious and comfortable. Perfect for short and long stays. Staff was helpful, smiling and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turmansky
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great and staff were very helpful. The breakfast bar upstairs is a great feature. Air condition is very quiet and beds are firm and comfortable. Room was facing courtyard and no street noise could be heard. Vending machines on every floor enabled us to get food and drink if we needed. Ironing + laundry machines were also available in a dedicated room on Floor 2 I believe. Good mix of high end and self serve features.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, new, A/C, contemporary finish.”
Reviews.Author: JethroAvon
Reviews.Content: Alberto was a great host, upgraded room upon check-in. He showed us on the map he supplied how to get to all the sites. The hotel is very new and modern. The vending machines are very well stocked with very reasonable pricing for water, soda, coffee, etc. The location is 10 min from train station, 5 min from subway. Had a good stay of 3 nights, would stay here again. My wife's luggage was lost by BA and Alberto made several calls to BA trying to help us, that was very much appreciated. Very nice rooftop area for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE HOTEL. NO FAULTS HERE!”
Reviews.Author: tennismomof2
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The location, the staff, the hotel itself were all exceptional! This is an incredible hotel, accessible to 2 metro stations (Repubblica and Termini), and is also accessible to many buses. It is on a quiet street off a main road (Via Nazionale). It is perpendicular to the Opera House. This hotel is beautiful, modern and very clean. Very well exceeded all my expectations. We had a double room, balcony view with a king sized bed, a baby cot, and a sleeper and still had room for our toddler and infant to play, plus all our luggage. The bathroom is huge w/ a separate shower stall, and shower/tub combo, all modern fixtures, as well as a bidet. The bed was a bit on the hard size but we were so tired from touring, it did not prevent us from sleeping. Even the baby cot was clean and acceptable to my standards. The breakfast was is not included, but when doing the math, it would've cost the same as staying at another hotel that we probably would not have loved as much as iQ. The hotel has wonderful vending machines where you could find anything from water to beer to wine, all at very affordable prices. Water only 0.50E and beer starting at I believe 3E. There was also a snack vending machine w/ sandwiches and other snacks. There are also microwaves and vending machines selling toiletries and other sundries you might have forgotten for your trip. There is a grocery store within a 2 minute walk so you can stock your cold minifridge with food. There is also a wonderful roof top patio and playground for the kids. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome. It is quite pricey but well worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: james0463
Reviews.Content: After a princess cruise tour, we stayed Roma for another one night. We booked this hotel by reviewed other traveler's comments in Tripadvisor. Hotel is clean with very good decoration in the room and toilet. Or I should say the whole hotel. Location is very very good. It is very near Republique. Will definitely stay in this hotel again when we travel to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ren_mac
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel in an ancient city! Very close to many attractions. It is very clean and very economical. Was great to do a load of washing in the middle of our trip. Staff were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Economical Stay”
Reviews.Author: AP-WA
Reviews.Content: As many travelers know Rome is a very expensive city. I was pleased to find the IQ Hotel Roma at a price that I was really surprised at. I was a little apprehensive at first due to the lower price but I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were exactly what they promised that they would be. I would agree with other reviews that this hotel is a no frills hotel but I would assume that’s why the price was so reasonable. I like the value aspect of that. It is in a good location and the metro is an easy walk. The hotel was very clean and my room was comfortable. The hotel staff is very helpful and when I was craving a slice of early morning pizza they even referred me to a local hole in the wall eatery that sold pizza by the slice. The only reason that I am giving them 4 out of 5 is that compared to the amenities of the hotels I stayed at in Venice and Istanbul I can’t give them a perfect 5. I would definitely stay at the IQ Hotel Roma again if my travels bring me back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very new, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: jpossum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two night's at this hotel. It's very new, clean and friendly. The room I was put in was a decent size and everything worked. Good location. Would have no problems going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel secret in Rome Central”
Reviews.Author: RK1995
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there are many good hotels in Rome but if you're used to US style hotels than the iQ is the hotel for you. It's modern looking, clean, has friendly staff and is centrally located. You're 5 plus minutes walking to the Rome Ternimi and two blocks from the Republicka Metro. Several grocery stores / supermarkets around the area, and there's one around the block. The mini-frig was great to store drinks and the room has a safe to keep valuables. My family rented a quadruple room - one king, a single and sofa beds. Found it very comfortable. And all rooms are non-smoking though they do have smoking areas. Tried the breakfast once and it was good but who can eat a buffet at 10 euros a person per day everyday. My family bought cheese & cold meats (stored in the frig) , bread, milk and juice, and brought it up to the 5th floor terrace to eat in the morning. Spent a third for a family of four. And relaxed while eating breakfast. You can also buy your coffee at the vending machines at the roof top. Would definitely stay at the iQ again!

Reviews.Title: “iQ did not disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Diana560
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at iQ Hotel based on a recommendation we received months ago. The staff were accommodating and friendly, the rooms clean (no strange smells) and modern. Overall the hotel had a very pleasant and welcoming feel. They even had self service laundry - something we struggled to find during our time in Italy. The buffet breakfast was the best of all the hotels we stayed at and it helped to end our trip on a high note. Would definitely return next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern ideas in a modern hotel , and they're not there to rip you off!”
Reviews.Author: MorrisDf
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel ! It's fresh and clean . We were able to wash some of our clothes as this landed in the middle of our holiday ! The vending machines are half the price of any of the nearby stores . You can get anything from snacks to cold water, coldrinks, wines and many more things ! It's close to the station and the metro line ! I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent hotel”
Reviews.Author: inci61
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and we stayed at least 6 different hotels in Rome including the very expensive ones but this time we stayed 4 days at IQ hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews and everything was perfect. Very nice location, very clean, staff is very friendly, helpful, you can find anything you want from vending machines and relatively cheap in comparison to other hotels in Rome. We even recieved a 'thank you' message after returning home. You're gonne love it. Also try Cotto restaurant which is recommended from the hotel, very close; best food best price in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lillesten
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay close to Termini train station for our return to the airport, but we soon discovered that we would have liked to stay more than this one night at IQ. The hotel is modern with tasteful decor and very helpful staff. Mini bars conveniently situated in the halls for a 24 hrs service, and free gym for the morning workout. It's situated by the train station, but still close enough to the centre and Rome’s many sights. We now know where to stay for our next trip to beautiful Rome. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: stepha14paddock
Reviews.Content: The staff service was excellent- they were always pleasant, helpful, eager to please, courteous and professional. The room was spotless and cleaned every day. The ensuite facilities were also excellent. The room was slightly small but by Rome standards was more than adequate. The beds were fairly comfotable. Would have liked 2 pillows each rahter than just one. The location of the hotel was excellent- near the bus terminal but the hotel could get you a taxi within 5 minutes if you needed one. The amenites were very good- the vending machines (situated on various floors) were really useful- and sold drinks (hot and cold) as well as sweets, crisps, chocolate, toothbruses, toiletries etc. The breakfasts were really great! There was also a gym (did not use it) liked best- air con, staff, cleanliness, location liked least- no pool at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: LyndaCambridge
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for the long August Bank Holiday weekend and I have to say it was a real gem of a hotel. We welcomed the air conditioning throughout the hotel in the 36 degree heat and the rooms were spacious, modern and incredibly quiet. The location was a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro stop (Republicca) and a 10 minute walk from the main station (Termini) which is where we picked up the Terravision bus to go back to the airport. Perfect for the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The breakfast was well worth €10 with a large selection of cheeses, breads, fruit, yougurts, pastries and juices. Alberto on Reception was incredibly helpful throughout the duration of our stay, offering us good options of places to eat and giving us directions whenever we needed them. There is a roof garden which is lovely with lots of lounging chairs and there are lots of vending machines which are very reasonably priced throughout the hotel serving cold drinks (alcoholoic and non) and snacks. It's lovely to take a bottle of wine up there in the evening. I cannot think of any negatives about this hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I was in Rome. Cost wise, I would say it is on par with a nice London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved All of the Conveniences”
Reviews.Author: SMonica310
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel toward the end of a two-week European vacation, and was very pleased. The room was spotless, seemed like new, well air conditioned, modern-looking and in a good location. I was so happy to have nice touches like a small refrigerator in the room, excellent blackout drapes, and even a small clothes line in the shower. The hotel's widely-acknowledged vending machines had the cheapest and coldest bottles of water we could find in Rome. We stocked up every day. There were also machines for beer, wine and a wide variety of coffee drinks. We used the laundry machines several times. There's only one washer, and it was 3€ per use, but well worth it. My only complaints were the beds, which were very hard (but that's pretty standard in European hotels) and the dinner recommendation from the concierge, which was a dud. Otherwise, this is a great hotel with a lot of thoughtful touches for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast room on roof”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, walking distance to train station and many tourist bus stops. Lots of restuarants close by. Staff great! Rooms large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Michael-TCS
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a very nice hotel to stay. We stay for three nights at IQ hotel and we were very pleased to choose this hotel. Just a short walk from Rome central train station (Termini) in a not very quiet position, even if were on the 4th floor we can hear the noise from the street. Otherwise the hotel was really, really great. We choose to stay in a small double room, yes it is really small, but the room was very cosy with a great bathroom with shower and good space. The best things and this is why if we ever visit Rome again we choose again IQ is the beautiful terrace with the vending machines and the one of the best breakfast I have ever eaten in my life. Before we visit Rome we believe that Rome is a large town having very long distances between the sightseeing but we were wrong. Rome is one of the best walking cities in Europe. I believe that is the best city for families with little children’s. You can get to any sight that you want from the hotel in no more than an hour. Piazza di Spagna is just a 10 minute walk from the hotel and also Fontana di Trevi. Because I and my wife like to walk very much after our second day we see all the major sights of Rome so we were a little board. And there is where IQ Hotel terrace came and save our trip! After a long walk I Rome with the temperature been more than 36 Celsius (Middle July) the nights on the terrace was like an oasis for us. The vending machines with bottles of water and snacks, another one with beverages and one with free ice and coffee (You will find the cheapest bottle of water in all Rome, trust me just 50 cent a bottle). If you are thinking to book a room with breakfast or without, do not bother take the breakfast. I cannot get of my chair after eating one the most delicious and full of everything that you can imagine breakfast. It worth every cent you pay. I must not forget the excellent free Wi-Fi. Yes it is an expensive hotel with not so good soundproof but the night times that we have on the terrace of the IQ Hotel with other guests of other countries made that trip one of the best we have and trust me we travel a lot. Hope you find my contribution helpful for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerFamilyFrance
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel , good location, everything CAN be done by walk !! We clearly recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the vending machines put you off!”
Reviews.Author: ajm98
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, I booked early and got a great deal - stayed for 3 nights. Spotlessly clean, good sized room with wonderful bathroom. Best black-out curtains EVER! Very friendly staff. A small laudry with washing machine, dryer and iron on one of the floors, well equipped gym on another floor and I was a bit hesitant about a hotel with vending machines - but they were great, well stocked and very reasonably priced. Fabulous roof terrace. Convenient area, 10minute walk to train station and we walked to all of the tourist attractions from this hotel - even the Vatican ( albeit an hour's walk!). I would definatley recommend this very modern place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mdbutter
Reviews.Content: Based on other Trip Advisor reviews, we selected this hotel for our stay in Rome. We were not disappointed. Everything was fabulous. The room was well appointed with everything you would possibly want or need. The staff was pleasant, efficient, helpful and welcoming. We scheduled a couple of day trips and had to leave before the breakfast room was open, so the hotel provided a bag breakfast for us to take on our tour. (We had breakfast included in our stay). The roof terrace was a lovely spot to enjoy in the early evening prior to dinner. The hotel is located in a great area and was near to various means of transportation. We also were close enough to walk to most of the sights in Rome. The rooms are air conditioned and this definitely was a plus during our stay. The hotel has some great vending machines which included snacks, beverages (beer, wine, soda, etc.), cups. The elevators are large by European standards and there are two of them. Important when it's breakfast time! Thank you iQ!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: This is a different sort of hotel, very modern in its outlook. The room was modern, clean and quiet. The air conditioning was also quiet and worked well even in the face of 37C degree heat outside. Breakfast was good, with a small selection of hot food and a good selection of cold food. This is the only meal available (no lunch or dinner). There was a bar in reception but nobody used this. There were, however, vending machines for snacks, cold and hot soft drink and alcoholic drinks including whole bottles of wine. This can be taken back to the room or consumed on the roof lounge which was popular espeically in the afternoon. The fridge in the room was not a mini-bar and unlike other hotels it was officially fine to store pretty much anything in it, including supermarket food. There was also a vending machine for forgotten essentials, sowing kits etc. And there was a self-service laundry room with one washing machine, one dryer and an iron. (3 Euros to wash, including powder, 3 Euros to dry). Wi-fi is available but there is also a business centre with several PCs and a printer and it was cheap to use (we were charged 2 Euros for quite a few minutes use booking museum tickets etc). The reception staff were really helpful and polite. If you want something quaint or romantic this is not for you. If you want something that is good value and functional this is fantastic. We normally go for character but we trtied that in Rome on another trip and were not impressed, but we were seriously impressed by this hotel with a modern outlook.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: maurieh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IQ for four nights and all the reviews are spot on. Great location, excellent customer service, great value, and brilliant breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we would choose the same place next time”
Reviews.Author: pejomaro
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice hotel concept (people, installation, services,...)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: misskellyc
Reviews.Content: Very modern and comfortable hotel with large bedrooms and bathrooms. Fabulous roof terrace with vending machines selling lovely bottles of wine and beers for you to enjoy under the stars!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SABRI_LT80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days to enjoy the sites of Rome. This hotel is perfectly located by all the sites and is walking distance to the Colloseum! The restaurant nearby was pretty decent as well. It is close to many banks and little shops. The rooms were a decent size and very clean. We would definately stay here again. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: sbelletini
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor rating and hoped for the best. Great location. Huge room. Beautiful bathroom. Great rooftop deck (loved the self-serve wine vending machine!) Excellent breakfast. Friendly staff. There were 3 of us and they eagerly accommodated our odd group placing a full extra bed in for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great hotel will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Aglaia Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotels a few days before going on our Mediterranean cruise with the princess. We were a family of 4, with two kids ages 17 and 14years. The beds were comfortable and room had a modern set up. THe hotel had a terrace on the top where you can buy things from a grocery story and eat there. It also had vending machines for drinks and wines at amazing prices. The front desk was helpful to let you know how to get around. One person in particular , Jamellia was a big help to us since all our 4 luggages were lost and she helped us contact the airport etc..She was great!! The hotel is placed in a quiet safe area. Walking distance to many sites and the termini station where many hop and go buses are to tour. We felt very safe walking around that area. Definitely going back to Rome and staying at the IQ. Also have recommended this hotel to many friends and family who are planning to visit Rome. Thank you IQ for making our stay in Rome COMFORTABLE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “iQ Hotel Roma - very smart choice!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewLammes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the iQ Hotel Roma on our recent trip to Rome. This hotel (less than a year old) was fresh, contemporary and the prefect home base for our trip. Within blocks ot the train station (we use this as our transfer from the airport into the city) is close to all the historic sites (Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Roman Forum, Palentine Hill) and close to their Metro Station for a transfer to the Vatican. The staff was friendly and helpful in making dining recommendations (gave some wonderful options) and assisted with reservations. The hotel itself was boutique style with a relaxing roof-top patio (check out the very smart self-service beverage station which provides vending of alcoholic beverages at reasonable prices). I would highly recommend the iQ Hotel Roma to anyone visiting Rome for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ford_Prefekt
Reviews.Content: Pros: Pretty much a perfect hotel experience Lovely terrace Great location Cons: Maybe a bit more slanted at business clients No views

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaPet
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and was really happy I did. It is tucked away in the walking vicinity of the Termini Station where trains from FCO Airport and other cities arrive. It is quite a hike from Rome's main attractions (Trevi - 10/15 minute walk, Coliseum - 20/25 minute walk, Pantheon - 20 minute walk), but works if you are in the walking mood. Alternatively, there is public transportation available and it is pretty cheap (read the end of the review for the Roma Pass tips). The hotel is cute and very clean. The modern feel is great. Room was small but well structured, bathroom was big enough for two people. Yes, there was no iron in the room, but it does not seem that irons in rooms are common in Italy (we visited over 10 cities on our road trip and none of them had an iron). The shower stall was on the small side, but again it was a common problem among all the hotels that lacked bathtubs. Additionally, the bed was kinda hard to sleep on but I think it is a European thing. Facilities were great: there was a small gym with a sauna, a laundry room (6 Euros for one load of laundry) with an ironing board and the rooftop terrace was a fun place to hang out with some cold drinks from the vending machine on the 5th floor (3 Euro Smirnoff Ices). And stack up on water at that vending machine: it is 50 cents there, versus 2 or even 3 Euros outside. We were not big fans of the 10 EU breakfast, b/c mass-produced eggs and bacon were uneatable and the rest can be bought at an outside cafe for a fraction of the price (to be honest, none of Italy's hotels knew how to cook good eggs, I am pretty sure they just do it for the American tourists). Once we landed at FCO airport we got our Roma Passes on the way to the train station. 25 Euros each these cards were well worth the price. Roma Pass does not cover the 14 Euro per person cost of the train from the airport, so you will need to buy a separate ticket for it right next to the train (validate it before boarding). You can use Roma Pass to enter 2 sites for free and the rest of the locations give you a discounted price. Use it for Coliseum/Forum/Palantine to bypass the 2-hour line (just enter the group tour line at the Coliseum and head down to the Roma Pass turnstiles) and for the Vatican Museum (i think it is 12 Euros to enter). You can also use the Pass on all forms of public transportation and with this hotel's location it is easy to identify buses going to the Termini Station. The subway is kinda tiny, but definitely use it to get to the Vatican for free (note that the Vatican Museum with its magnificent Sistine Chapel is closed on Sundays). Also splurge 7EU for the ride up the St. Peter's Cathedral cupola for the best 360 degree bird-eye view of Rome. Overall, the hotel was a great value in a good location and with some smart planning you can explore Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: RedstoneBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late July, 2011. Although the iQ Hotel is not a "high-end luxury" hotel, it is pretty much brand spanking new, very quiet, modern and comfortable. Our room was on the small side, but this is fairly normal in Europe. Still, it was spotlessly clean, had plenty of storage and a large, comfortable bathroom. The AC worked perfectly and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Everyone spoke perfect English and they were only too happy to give us instructions for using the bus, or to arrange transportation to the airport. The hotel offers a full breakfast for E10, and it is excellent. A full variety of American and European breakfast options is offered buffet style. Definitely worth it. The hotel is right across the road from the Opera House, a 2 minute walk to Via Nationale and less than a 5 minute walk to the Metro station at Piazza della Reppublica. From there you can get almost anywhere in a matter of a few minutes. Our only complaint is that we found the bed on the hard side. But that, of course, is a matter of personal preference. Otherwise, highly recommended. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you possible need”
Reviews.Author: sarah t
Reviews.Content: Rooms are immaculate, breakfasts are gorgeous with a great choice. Beds are very firm but was so tired after a day in Rome we slept very well. A great base for sightseeing as everything is within walking distance or easy reach of the nearby metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - cool roof terrace, great location, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sparklyfenella
Reviews.Content: I agree it's not the cheapest but then where in August is? We just got back from a 4 night stay and I'm leaving a good review so that should tell you something. Great modern hotel with everything you want to find for comfort and convenience and without any of the extra you don't need. We found the rooms comfortable and well equipped with great bathrooms and comfy beds - a great nights sleep after long tiring days sightseeing. We enjoyed the breakfast some days and bought our own in and ate it on the fabulous roof terrace other mornings. We loved hanging out on the roof and bought plenty of wine, beer and snacks from the 'machines' for very little cost (which really helps as Rome is an expensive city). Reception staff very helpful and great linguists. Taxis were called and arrived in minutes. Gave great advice on getting to the sights. Local Carrefour mini-supermarket great for stocking fridge in our room. Would love to go back. Really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Natsyd53
Reviews.Content: Staff went out of the away to make us feel comfortable . Special thanks to alberto and maria for all the assistance they provided during our stay. Room was nice and comfortable and brand new. Strongly recommend that you stay in this hotel when you visit Rome next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good if you are not one to stay in room much”
Reviews.Author: DallasJD6189
Reviews.Content: Location is right next to the metro stop. Gets you anywhere you need to go. If you spend a lot of time in your room on vacation, this may not be the best place for you. The hotel is as basic as it comes which was great for us as we just used it to sleep. The TV was very small and most stations did not work, the decor was minimalist, common areas for iron (not available in your room). I dug the vending machines that offered anything from wine to snacks. The staff is very helpful. Was noisy in the mornings and late nights with door slams and hearing people walk/talk in the hall. Not used to having as many families in hotels we stay at, so hearing children running around was annoying. Bathrooms were large and beds were comfortable. Enjoyed the free wifi and it worked with no problems. Would probably stay here again just because the location and price was good, but if on business or spent more time in the room, I would pass.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: HC500
Reviews.Content: The breakfast upstairs was fantastic and everything cooked fresh. The location is really good for catching the metro and visiting sites. The rooms not large but comfortable! Usually hotel staff in Italy are not friendly and I would say very fake when they say hello to you but in this hotel things are different and staff were very friendly and helpful and that does make a differnce. A final note; Italy is very expesnive and not good value for money at all and we would recommend you to check the restaurant menus before entering and if there is no menu dispalyed at the door then it is a trap and avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visitors to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cazie99
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel well located in a side street so away from the traffic noise of the main road. We had three rooms, all with a sofabed (for 3 people) and all at slightly different prices which we only discovered at the end when paying the bill. The rooms are very well equipped with all the conveniences - blackkout blinds, light switches everywhere, comfortable beds, good pillows, nice bathroom. I had asked for a quiet room so ours faced the internal hotel square which was perfect for us. Breakfast is optional and is reasonably good and there is a choice of sitting inside with the air conditioning or on the outdoor terrace (no view).

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel which we would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 13th to the 16th July. It is a nice modern hotel in a great location with good facilities including a laundry room. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and the staff couldn't be more helpful. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: s_1999
Reviews.Content: As most other reviews have said, this place is excellent. Perfect location, spotlessly clean, good standard of rooms and a decent price. Like the self service concept at retail prices. Free wifi a great feature.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: 2011-bee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights over the easter period. The room was lovely, hotel nice and clean but above all the staff were so helpful and friendly with any concerns. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Vanessajeffriess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and therefore looks very out of place but this is definitely a good thing! I have never had good experiences with accommodation in Rome so this far exceeded my expectations. Fantastic rooms, fantastic location and fantastic breakfast. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel for a self serve clientele”
Reviews.Author: Love2teach02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at iQ the last 4 nights of our 2 week honeymoon. My husband found this hotel from trip advisor and booked it because of the wonderful reviews. We liked the modern look in the lobby, self serve laundry option, breakfast-although it is an additional cost of 10 euro per person, the rooftop lounge area, and vending machines with snacks and beverages. The location is fine if you want to use public transportation, right next to the metro station and a 5/10 minute walk to an On and Off Sightseeing bus. There is also a grocery store around the corner that you can buy sodas/water, and snacks to keep in the mini fridge. There was one man at the front desk who was particularly helpful with maps and two great restaurants. This is not a particularly romantic, warm, friendly, or comfortable hotel. The bed was very uncomfortable, the shower/tub is very tall and can be difficult to get out of because the ledge is so high. The tv is extremely small and for a hotel that caters to people that speak English, we were shocked by having only 2 English stations--CNN and BBC. When my husband asked for a code for the business center computers, they explained you had to pay to use them-which is very strange if you offer a business center. Also, there are no ice buckets? With vending machines that serve ice, you'd think the hotel would offer a bucket. Instead you can use a cup from your bathroom or cups to buy from the vending machine. People were using trashcans instead. If you are looking for a self serve hotel then this is the place for you. If you are looking for a warm and friendly hotel with romantic qualities then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robertp546
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the train station. Rooms are very nice and very clean, great shower. The metro is right down the street and all the attractions are within 20 to 30 minutes walking distance. Staff is friendly and helpful. Would stay here again in a heart beat. It's the best deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept for a Hotel, but avoid Ground floor rooms especially disabled room!”
Reviews.Author: PinotFanatic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. The concept of the Hotel is fantastic, 4/5 surrounds but self service options available if you need. Laundry room a great idea, but as other reviewers have mentioned only 1 washing machine and dryer, can make for a long night trudging back and forward to check! My only complaint was the room I was allocated. Room 501, (I think), it was on the ground floor and was a disabled room. There was a grate on the footpath outside the window and everytime someone stepped on it it made a clunking sound. This woke me up a few times every night. Also when people dragged wheely luggage over it it sounded like thunder. Also the disabled bathroom ment that every time I had a shower water went everywhere. To the Hotels credit they listened to my concerns and I was given a discount on my room and was told they would be looking in to securing the grate a bit better. All in all it was handled very professionally with the manger coming to speak to me. Despite my experience I would reccommend this hotel as the location is fantastic and the price was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it very much - would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: GadgetNeil
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers, so I won't repeat everything. Basically, this is a great option - I think you can't go wrong if you stay here. Every hotel has some pros and cons - of course nothing will be perfect, especially when you try to balance price and quality. You can find better hotels in Rome, I'm certain, but you could also be paying double or triple! I felt this hotel was quite reasonable for Rome, and I had very few complaints (and all are minor). If you want quaint, charming "old world" feel, this isn't it - but I prefer this kind of hotel: very clean and modern. There was a clicking sound often in our ceiling - not sure if it was from air vents - we only told them at the end, as it didn't bother us - my wife can sleep through a hurricane, and I sleep with earplugs :) The breakfast was worth the 10 euros each - fantastic spread, and being able to eat on the beautiful rooftop patio outdoors is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: SUZYQFortWorth_Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days here and loved it. The Hotel was very clean and modern. The staff was helpful and the location was very convienient to walk everywhere. There was a restaurant around the corner called Bar Viminale that was very good and reasonable, it is family owned and they are lovely. We even met a movie star there! If we ever go back we would stay at the IQ again

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: mobrien2
Reviews.Content: my wife and I couldn't have asked for a better location for our 4 night stay in Rome. only a few minutes walk from Termini train station and metro stops. And a short walk to the colosseum, trevi fountain and all the other sights in Rome. the room was large and very comfortable. The rooftop terrace was very nice to relax from the busy city. The staff was wonderful and everyone spoke english. Our only minor complaint would be the advertised laundry room. there is only one washer and one dryer for all the hotel guests. But it was a very minor inconvenience. We will stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEurotraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel's central location is a big plus and the room was nice and clean and very quiet (thanks to soundproofed walls and windows). Most impotantly the very comfortable beds made us sleep really well after a long day of sight seeing, dining and shopping. We loved it and we'll stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finearly40
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend staying here :o) Central... all areas walkable Large, clean modern room with excellent bathroom. Free wifi !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent contemporary hotel with a twist!”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room, which was immaculate and very spacious, with three very comfortable single beds and plenty of storage. Staff were all extremely warm and friendly. The vending machine concept is great; rather than build in an extra charge per night to put mending kits, slippers, etc. in every room, items like these are in a vending machine at reasonable costs. The food and beverages in the machines are especially reasonable; 50 cents for a half litre of water, 6 euro for a full size (750 ml) bottle of wine (with numerous choices), etc. Breakfast was amazing, with one of the most diverse choices of fruits, pastries, hot foods, juices, meats, cheeses, etc; quality and variety was equal to 5 star hotels, just without the linen and the omelet chef! Location is very good, and they offer a fabulous deal of airport transfers; 99 euro round trip for a chauffeur and Mercedes S-class from the airport, including tax & tip, so essentially the same as a taxi! Only negative was that the restaurant recommendations were not very good. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great, fresh hotel. Good location, close enough to station”
Reviews.Author: ThirstyBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in July, with a few days in Venice in between. They are about a 40min (45 Euro) taxi ride from the airport & 10 min walk from the rail station. Iq were very flexible for us and helped us make several changes to our itinerary. The rooms are big enough, modern and comfortable. Internet is free. TV has a (few) English channels but not many. Vending machines are available for snacks, toothbrushes and even Prosecco! The service from everyone is cheerful and efficient! Some services are limited. Do not expect a comprehensive concierge. The basics are there, a taxi booking takes 3 mins & restaurant recommendations are good but not much more. Breakfast is great. Comprehensive, fresh and you can sit on the terrace if you want.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: -_-_-_-paul-_-_98654
Reviews.Content: This hotel is prefect place to stay. 5 mins walk from the main train station so very handy to get from the airport. Room was very nice, plenty of space and clean, TV and fridge. Food was excellent and the staff are super friendly. If I go back to Rome I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tangmere4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here immensely. The hotel was modern, spotlessly clean and beautifully air conditioned, which was a massive relief after a hot day's sightseeing! The staff on reception were unfailingly polite and helpful. The hotel is also well located near the central Termini station and the Republicca Metro stop which is handy for the Vatican. There is also an excellent Gelato shop in the road on the other side of the Opera House which in my opinion was better than the #1 rated in the Restaurant section.

Reviews.Title: “A little small, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: TruTravelor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at IQ Roma for 4 nights in July and loved it. The room was a little small, but very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. (The restaurant they recommended had ok food, but it wasn't great.) Breakfast was not included, but worth the money we paid. They had both hot and cold food with a number of pastries and drinks offered. One cool thing about the hotel was that there is a laundry room. Unfortunately, there is only one washing machine and one dryer (the dryer has to be run at least 2 times to dry your clothes). There is no restaurant (you must eat lunch and dinner elsewhere). One great aspect is the terrace at the top where you can sit and have a drink outdoors. The hotel is right off of a small street situated between two larger streets that have lots of restaurants and shopping. The bus stop is about 2 blocks away and you can easily take the bus to the sites. Overall, I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Excellence with one con.”
Reviews.Author: lkehoe96
Reviews.Content: having researched the location of this hotel and read all about it, I was prepared for what the iq had to offer. it was, simply, spectacular! beautifully cleaned with goegeous, friendly staff, and lovely rooms. a marvel to stay in! the only concern I had was the sound proofing early in the morning I was frequently woken by the pitiful crying wail of the traffic light sound and on one night I was kept up by an arguing couple next door. however, all in all a spectacular night! simply fanastic darlings!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very nice, clean and modern inside, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: PandaZoo
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd trip to Rome and this time just stayed one night at the end of a cruise trip. This is a better hotel than when we stayed previously. Very nice and modern inside and the room is large, with all the necessary items. Close to subway station and just a few stops to the Spanish steps. At night we walked around the hotel, and below it there was a church and a concert (free) was being held inside the church so we walked in and stayed for about 45 minutes. Mostly local people. Then off to a nearby cafe and had a simple dinner. The hotel was not cheap but you don't get a lot of modern hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: psulovers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel IQ. Very comfortable and modern, with all of the basics available, but pay for them as you like. Loved the idea of the vending machines with wine, beer, and coffee! The breakfast in the morning is an optional add-on, but worth it, in our opinion. Both hot and cold items available, and starting your day off eating on the beautiful rooftop isn't too bad! We also hung out on the rooftop latenight with some vending machine beers:) The front desk staff were all very knowledgeable and provided lovely maps and directions, with approximations of walking distances to all the major sights. They kept our luggage when we arrived early from our flight from the US. Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhanna1
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,clean and modern . Our room was quite big ( for Italy ), it had a king bed and two singles for a family of four. Location is good , not the best in rome but very close to termini and other metro station. We took only the taxi ,it's not as expensive as they say. Breakfast is quite good ( buffet style ) but not included in the room. There is a nice terasse an the roof for relaxing, and a small kids area with a swig, a slide And a babyfoot. Wifi is included and very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAlcorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nearly one week and found the hotel comfortable and efficiently run, with very helpful English-speaking staff. The hotel is brand new and very conveniently located for Termini station, on quiet streets. Resolutely modern design, but small rooms: the pictures on the website are deceptive. My only complaint was the speed and capacity of the wireless internet connection: there are data limits on usage, so if you need to upload or download large files you will find it difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: 60750Sara
Reviews.Content: The iQ Hotel Roma is centrally located, with large rooms, and a most accommodating staff. You can easily walk to the Spanish steps,Trevi fountain, good restaurants, and fun shopping boutiques. The metro is only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it - stayed twice, very new looking, great staff”
Reviews.Author: tommy8244
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, clean, convenient to the train station, and has a wonderful staff. My daughter and I stayed in a twin room the first stay, and a family room the second stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Jamia. The breakfast room had a nice selection of food. The rooms were larger than I have been used to in European hotels, and very clean and modern. Negatives? minor ones - the hotel is central air conditioned so you cant control the temp in your room as many Americans are used to. Also, we had room 214 which was outside the very useful self-serve laundry room. This proved noisy but that is not really the hotels fault. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrulil
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights with my mother (36 & 60 years old respectively) and although the twin room was a little small it had everything you needed. The beds were a little firm but my mother thought they were comfortable. It was modern, clean and comfortable. The rooftop deck had a nice lounge and the vending machines were reasonably priced with a nice selection of wines, beer and soft drinks. The staff were very friendly, spoke flawless English and were professional. It is a ten-fifteen minute walk to the Forum and twenty to the Pantheon but you will need to take the metro or cab to the Vatican as it is too far. The hotel area is nice and has a selection of restaurants that ranged from fast food to fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “YES! A Great Affordable Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Blend5Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three rooms for three days at this Hotel and every room was perfect! We also bough the breakfast which was well worth the price. This Hotel has a great location for seeing a lot of the sights in Rome. We rode the subway, buses and the train - all within a short distance from the Hotel. The staff was great! Especially the girl from Colorado! The staff was all helpful and friendly, really made a tourist welcome in Rome! Thanks iQ Rome!

Reviews.Title: “iQ = help yourself value”
Reviews.Author: LorJaz2011
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, where you do not pay for what you do not want. Vending machines for wine, beer, food and all cheap, no ridiculous €25 a bottle BS.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and great fir business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Carolgir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great pit stop. Roof top garden to relax in, laundry room, free wi fi. Very close to the train station. A good base to explore Rome or even as a place to stay for business. This hotel is very modern. Must be quite new. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: hst_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, clean facilities, good amenities, close to historical attractions.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: pacosmom
Reviews.Content: There's everything to like: Great service....An EXCELLENT staff, extremely helpful and pleasant Spotlessly clean Free wi-fi Modern bathrooms Attractive furnishings Convenient laundry facilities Convenient vending machines for snacks, drinks, wine 10-minute walk to Termini train station 20-minute walk to "historic" center of Rome Wonderful rooftop garden seating area. Attractive breakfast area The breakfast buffet (10 Euros extra) was well worth it, in my opinion. It had a vast selection. I've read complaints that it was not well stocked. But I would have to disagree. I've stayed at some of the fancier hotels in Rome with great breakfast buffets and I really didn't see much difference....except maybe those other hotels had fancier tablecloths. We really enjoyed the rooftop garden for relaxing at the end of the day. It's true the rooms were on the small side....but that's the way European hotel rooms generally are. But in Rome, you do NOT want to be spending a lot of time in the hotel room. Lots of beautiful dress stores in the neighborhood. The only negative....and this is a "maybe".....is that if you are looking for ambiance and furnishings with the old "elegance" of Rome, you won't find it here. Instead, you will find gracious, helpful service, clean, modern accommodations, convenience, and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: KevinJ22
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean central Hotel with excellent service and site seeing advice, then this is definately the Hotel for you. The Hotel is exceptionally modern and everything works well. The clenliness and hygene is impeccable. The beds are comfortable and there are plenty available plug points to charge your electronic devices. Wi Fi is free. The kids enjoyed the vending machines and prices were reasonable, especially the water at 50 cents per bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Rome and would love to return one day”
Reviews.Author: Iri1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect on every sense. Stayed here with my wife in July for her birthday and we loved it. The room was big, the bathroom was big and very clean, the breakfast was great, the roof terrace was superb and the staff were always helpful. Free wifi and a great location make this place one we would strongly recommend. It's close to the main sights and it's close to the metro and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort in the ancient city...”
Reviews.Author: BobBNC
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed this new, ultra modern hotel with all the conveniences. It's near the Termini rather than the tourist spots but still walkable to the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, etc. It had large (for Rome) clean rooms, great service and all the amenities including a convenient, tasty breakfast buffet, free wi-fi, irons/laundry and nice baths. Recommended for travelers who prefer comfort and modern amenities to the classic Rome small hotel. The staff was very helpful and after two weeks in Europe, we really appreciated all the modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, nothing stellar.”
Reviews.Author: flipflops30
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, and train ride to Termini, we hoofed it over to iQ Hotel Roma. We arrived at 1PM. Room not ready until 2PM; however, as we sat in the lobby to relax for a few, we watched several others check in prior to 2PM. We were placed in a ground level room. We considered asking for a better room (mind you, I booked this 9+ months ago); however, we heard other ground floor guests asking for the same thing only to be offered a 1st floor room if they'd be willing to wait a bit, as the hotel was full. Despite that, the room was clean (damp floor though...did the previous guest spill something and the cleaning service wash the carpets?) The staff was friendly, spoke English, and was helpful in find out way around the city. It has a great location--easy to walk to everything. We paid 169 euro a night plus 10 euro per person each day for breakfast. Would we stay here again? Maybe. I'd like to research what else is out there, but it's a safe choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarpeZythum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel iQ in Rome in early May. We both enjoyed our stay there. The staff were courteous and helpful. All of the staff that I interacted with spoke excellent English, amongst other languages. The rooms were clean, rather large by Roman standards, and quiet at night (a major plus in downtown Rome). The bed was comfortable. The hotel is centrally located in Rome, only a 5-10 min walk from Roma Termini. After reading some suspect reviews of the 10 euro breakfast, we opted to skip it, so I can comment on it other than the fact I thought it was a bit too much for breakfast. The hotel is not cheap, but as far as hotels in it's class (and location) are concerned, it was a great value. There is a roof terrace that is quite nice as well. The wifi is free, but don't hold your breath if you downloading a large file. Bottom line - Highly recommended. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Treat....”
Reviews.Author: KYellman
Reviews.Content: IQ Roma was a completely different choice from all of our other European hotel picks being ultra-modern ...but what a refreshing change at the end of our two-week trip. Loved the rooftop deck to relax after sightseeing --- and the convenient self-serve vending machines stocked w/ beer and wine at very reasonable prices! Free wi-fi. Great location to train locations and area attractions. We walked to Hard Rock Cafe, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, and Trevi fountain from hotel. Staff helpful. Rooms very clean. Breakfast for 10 euro was a deal. Very firm beds.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jayd822
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 stayed mid June. Used the hotel service pick up and drop off from the airport. Both were prompt and had very polite and efficient drivers - would definitely recommend this. Saw too many lost tourists dragging their suitcases along the cobblestones during our stay! Reception staff were helpful, polite and obliging. Every staff member we came across was the same. Room was very nice, clean and modern. Only issue we had was with the fold out couch - when it was folded out it was impossible to get into the fridge as it blocked it! Honestly the only complaint though and it was only a slight inconvenience. Mini fridge came in handy to store the essentials during our stay. Found the beds comfy. Was amazed at the low priced beverages from the vending machines 0.50euro for a bottle of water - great price compared to the 1.50euro sold out on the streets. Within the hotel there was a small but nevertheless sufficient gym, multiple vending machines, microwave, washing machine and ironing facilities. Hotel was within comfortable walking distance to the termini (metro) which we used everyday. Most fantastic thing about the hotel was the buffet breakfast. Cannot begin to explain how great it was. 10 euro per person and absolutely every breakfast item you could think of with a whole range of drinks - was such amazing value and kept the family full up until dinner time! Free wifi was also extremely handy! Was comforting to know we were returning to a safe environment, friendly people and clean rooms after long and tiring days around Rome which were often filled with dirty busy streets and rude pushy people. Can't praise the hotel enough, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle M
Reviews.Content: This was our favourite hotel on our honeymoon. The hotel was modern and close to attractions and the open top bus tour stop, we walked to everything from here except the colosseum and the vatican. Our room was spotless, modern and comfortable, the bathroom was huge and had 2 showers one bath/shower and a normal shower. We couldnt fault this hotel at all, the vending machines and the washing facilities were fantastic, and the breakfast was awesome and pretty cheap at only 10 euros. The free wifi was great too! The only bad thing was we were pretty warm in the room and the air con couldnt be changed but we called reception and they brought up a fan in no time. The staff was really friendly and helpful too, helping us with where to go for dinner and how to find the main attractions. All in all this was a fantastic hotel and we will definitely be back when we get back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Lexaqua
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the IQ Hotel in Rome. The desk agents were very freindly and helpful, and the rooms were comfortable. The location near a Metro was very handy. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: ImpulseIX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great gem in Rome. It is within walking distance of most of the tourist sites around Rome. If you wish to unwind from you days travels, there is a semi covered deck upstairs. Rooms are nice, clean and spacey. Only issue on checkout was when the express checkout failed for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Renee26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the iq Roma in March and found it to be perfect location for our 3 day stay in Rome. Traveling with our two teenage sons, we thought the rooms were very spacious and we didn't feel crowded at all like we did in some other hotels on our trip to Italy. Rooms were clean, it had plenty of outlets ( again, not the case in all hotels in Italy) and the location can't be beat. It is located just a few blocks from the main train station although we only used the train a couple times. We mostly walked to the places we wanted to see...colosseum, Trevi fountain, pantheon. The only drawback is that it seemed a bit overpriced...again, this is comparing to other places we stayed in Florence and Venice, even though I expected Rome to be pricier.
