Lastly, the Internet connection was good and reliable. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: scvin
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at the iQ Hotel. It is in close proximity to attractions and to transporation. The front desk staffing are extremely accomodating and friendly. Every restaurant suggestion they made was a winner. The rooms are a reasonable size and very comfortable. The roof top terrace is wonderful for relaxing and enjoying a bottle of wine after a long day of sightseeing. There are many shops and restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter1025
Reviews.Content: iQ Hotel is a modern hotel near the train station in Rome. If you plan to take day trips; this is an ideal location. We were only in Rome, so I wish we had stayed a little closer to things. The rooms are small but nice. We were put in a handicapped room the first night, but the hotel was able to switch us to a new room for the remainder of our stay. The roof top terrace is a great place to chill and have a drink. Breakfast is not included, but I would go for it. The selection is awesome and you won't find a better breakfast deal elsewhere. Overall we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictnumber1
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooftop terrace, on several balmy Rome nights, sat with a bottle of wine (purchased from their vending machine, 6 Euros) and some snacks and contemplated our day of sightseeing and planning dinner. They also have fantastic hot drink vending machines, great coffees (including decaf) for 50 Euro cents! Their buffet breakfast was also a winner, with the advantage of being able to sit outside. Rooms are compact, but great beds with white linen, bathrooms are very good with plenty of shelf space. There is an empty fridge waiting for your own supplies. There is a small supermarket nearby which is great for fresh fruit, bottled water and snacks for that bottle of wine on the terrace. Staff on front desk were very helpful and friendly. There are lots of bars, cafes and restaurants within a very short walk which we found to be quite inexpensive and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: DrP78
Reviews.Content: Having decided on Rome as the location to celebrate our 5th Anniversary, we spent many months looking for a "good" hotel in Rome - one with clean modern rooms - I came across the iQ Hotel. The hotel is located just 5mins walk from the Termini and has great links with all the attractions that Rome has to offer. The concept of the hotel is very innovative and unsual for Europe and so it was a breath of fresh air. The rooms like all rooms in European cities were not the largest by any means but were clean, modern and well maintained. To be offered free wireless was also a great touch as it made communicating with family back in London so much easier. All the facilties were of a very high standard, the front desk staff polite and efficient, special mention must go to Huchim who always recommended great resaturants, and the vending machines well stocked and not overpriced. To avoid sounding like the hotel's personal marketing manager I would just say that maybe the availability of a few more English language tv channels maybe a good idea, especially when relaxing after a long day out in city. We would definately stay here again should we return to Rome. Thank you iQ hotel for making our stay in Rome a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Would Definatly Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Froggie23
Reviews.Content: We were very happy once we turned up and saw our hotel. The reception staff were lovely and very helpful providing maps and local information including best places to eat. Our room was a King Bed room and was clean, tidy and spacious. We are normally used to shuffling about the bed to get to the otherside of the room, however the room at IQ hotel was spacious. The decor of the room was nice also. Although it might not matter to some, I was very happy that the shower had two heads; one which was situated to have a a shower and another you can hold if you girls need to bend over and wash your hair only! You also are provided shampoo, soap, body wash and a shower cap. A fridge is also provided in your room, very handy!! Situated on level 4 a vending machine is provided where you can buy any little things you have forgotten i.e. toothpaste, deodrant, plasters, etc. At a very reasonable price! On Level 5, where there is a lovely roof terrace you can purchase alcohol (beers and wine, and champagne if your feeling it) from the vending machine. There is also little nibbles to purchase also. The vending machine is open at all times. There are also bottle openers on this floor. The roof terrace was lovely!! Big comfy sofas and very chilled out. An opera house is situated opposite the hotel, which lights up so nice at night. Generally a really lovely hotel, close to all major site seeing you might want to do. Highly recommended place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Speedalina
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed there for 4 nights. The room is very clean and spacious for a European hotel. Love the terrace and breakfast is great. This hotel is not close to any of the major attractions, but within reasonable 15 minute walking distance from most of them. Both Termini and the subway station is very close by. Having laundry facilities is a huge plus, I only wish they have two machines, I had to wait a couple of hours at night to get into cue for doing laundry.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, perfectly modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelchick066
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walkable distance to the Trevi fountain, the Spanish Steps and the Termini station (restaurants round Termini are cheaper) & next door to the Opera. The hotel was fully air conditioned which was a relief when coming in from tropical temperatures. The roof are has foam sofas under gazebos for relaxing with an ice cold drink from the drinks machines (beer/wine/spirits/mixer drinks.....) all available at very competitive prices. The hotel was clean throughout and made up daily & we had a balcony in our room. The staff were exceptional in their service. The sauna and gym were ideal. The only slight flaws would be that the rooms were small but this is forgiven as everywhere in Rome is small, and also the satelite tv channels had a lack of English speaking programmes. Tip for the bedroom - watch your fingers when you open the wardrobe as we caught our fingers twice. Free WIFI was also useful. Overall an absolute pleasure staying at this hotel - recommend to all who travel to Rome :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kylie1987
Reviews.Content: IQ Hotel Roma was a great base for our sightseeing in Rome. The hotel is walking distance to Termini station which we used to get to and from the airport. We found all sites were within walking distance of the hotel but when we didn't feel like walking the hotel staff directed us to a nearby bus which was very convenient. The staff were also very helpful for restaurant and shopping recommendations. The room was very large and comfortable and the bathroom was also large and spotlessly clean. The room was lovely and quiet and had free WIFI. The breakfast on the roof terrace was nice but a little expensive in my opinion. The other bonus was the coin operated laundry, by the time we reached Rome we had been travelling for 3 weeks so it was nice to be able to do a load of washing and for only 2 euro! My recommendations: Everyone should do a walking tour of the ancient sites with Dark Rome Tours - it was really interesting, we got to skip the lines to the colloseum and it was a good way to get all of the ancient sites visited in under 3 hours. Secondly I WOULD NOT recommend visiting the vatican unless you are very interested in religion/religious art. If you really must visit the vatican you should either start lining up at 7am or organise a guided tour in advance. Guided tours can be organised through the Vatican website and you can skip the lines - a tour really is the way to go as the Vatican is FULL of religious artefacts which have very little meaning unless they are explained to you. Thirdly I recommend visiting the area Trastevere in the evening. Trastevere is lovely and is full of cafe's and restaurants. At night locals set up street stalls and it feels very atmospheric, the Rome you see in the movies.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AAA04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it excellent in every way. The hotel arranged a taxi to pick us up from the airport and the driver delivered us and carried our bags all the way to the reception. It is a bit more expensive than the train but we did not want the hassle of trying to find the hotel from the train station. It turns out that the train and bus stations (Termini) are only 5 minutes walk from the hotel, but that does mean that the hotel is easy to find. The hotel is opposite the Opera House. All of the reception staff were excellent and spoke clear English. In fact one of the reception staff was American. The room was very modern and spotlessly clean. There is little traffic on the streets around the hotel and so it was a quiet location but nevertheless is very central in Rome. Breakfast was good with a wide choice of food, both hot and cold. There is a choice of inside or outside seating on the roof top. The hotel does not serve food at other times of the day but has vending machines selling hot and cold drinks, along with sandwiches and snacks. The food and drink in the machines is good value; cheaper than the shops for cold drinks, and there is a fridge in the room to store food and drinks. The Trevi Fountain and Colloseum are around 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel. The Vatican is around 45 minutes walk. We liked the atmosphere of walking through Rome but it can be very tiring so a hop-on hop-off bus pass may be a good idea to get around. We walked many miles in the first 2 days of our stay and then took the sightseeing bus tour of the city on the final day. We stayed on the bus although you can get on and off as many times as you like. It was 13€ each for a tour of the city without getting off or 24€ each for a 24 hour pass to get on and off as many times as you want to. There is a leisure facility with sauna etc in the hotel but we did not have the time to use it. The free wifi was helpful to keep in touch with home and check out things to do in Rome each evening.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: legs44
Reviews.Content: Great place which offers nice breakfast buffett in the mornings...for a fee but it's worth it. The price for this updated hotel was very reasonable considering you are in Rome. Walking to the train station is close but was confusing to us when we first got off the train. Finding our way later on around the city from our hotel got easier as we got used to the city. Lovely location which was safe and near alot of great shopping. You had to take time to search out good food in this area was one of our complaints. Sticker shock for food/drinks outside of the hotel. On the top floor you could buy bottles of wine for $8US out of a vending machine. That makes your stay a bit nicer having cheap wine..LOL. All in all I like this hotel, would next time stay in Trastevere on the outside of Rome where prices were more reasonable and the locals go.

Reviews.Title: “Great respite after long days”
Reviews.Author: Cameliah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quiet and a short distance from the train station. The front desk was helpful every time we asked for anything. The room and bathroom are large and modern, with great shower, comfortable bed and room darkening curtains. The breakfast was the best we had in Europe: a large breakfast room, lots of choices of proteins, fruit, bread and sweets. One of the few buffets that are worth the price! We were able to eat just 2 (great) meals a day with the help of this buffet breakfast. The vending machines with wine and the small bar at the front desk were a great addition to the hotel, along with the rooftop area to relax. We would DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: amy1679
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. Great location, close to the metro and a street away from some nice restaurants. Very close to the Termini train station too. The room was a good size & the staff on reception were very helpful when we needed anything. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, well located”
Reviews.Author: Jpug70
Reviews.Content: This is a very well located hotel. The hotel employees are very kind and helpfull, the breakfast option on the top floor is very well served, has many different options. The hotel is very close to main tourist locations, good tranportation points and to termini station where if you want to lease a car to contiue your travels through Italy is a great advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: spennington
Reviews.Content: My parents were treated to their first European vacation by their children as a Christmas gift. I made the arrangements with the IQ Hotel via email directly through their website and had no problems at all. The staff was very nice to work with, they even arranged for my parents to be picked up at the airport, and also arranged to help with transportation to the cruise ship. My parents have very positive comments about the location, service, room, breakfast, and the staff. I'm very grateful to the staff for making my parents feel comfortable and helping them with all of their needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel...not much else to say”
Reviews.Author: ariete415
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last city on our trip and this was the perfect hotel to end in. We got a good deal when we booked, 50% off their regular rate. It was very modern and definitely the most American hotel we stayed in. We stayed in a triple and the room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was HUGE. We had the breakfast one morning and it was definitely worth the money. The rooftop was a nice place to sit and have some wine. The vending machine sold some wine and cups and were incredibly CHEAP! The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The surrounding area seemed safe and there was a metro around the corner. I felt fine on there but just keep your bag close because it's very crowded. We had the hotel set up a car service to the airport. I highly reccommend that because it was only slightly more expensive than a regular cab. Be aware of taxi drivers, our first night in Rome, a cab driver tried to rip us off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service, Just Book This”
Reviews.Author: momuvfour
Reviews.Content: Staying at the IQ Roma was a great start to our Italian vacation. They arranged a minivan to take our large group from the airport to the hotel. The breakfast is very nice. The service was quick and professional. The hotel is small enough that you feel known, but big enough to offer laundry services, ice machines, etc. Location is very convenient for seeing the sites. We won't think twice about just booking IQ Hotel whenever we return to Rome. Also, I was traveling with 2 other families with difficult tastes and all were pleased. Oh, also, I'm a very light sleeper and appreciated how well insulated the rooms were ... very quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Flawless!!”
Reviews.Author: mboy1976
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other trip advisor reviews and certainly were not dissapointed. This is a great hotel in a great location. This hotel is modern, fresh and completely spotless. The hotel has a fantastic rooftop chill out area which is an absolute godsend after long days of sight-seeing and many miles walked. Such a nice place to chill out particularly if you are looking for a romantic break. The hotel has the most fantastic drinks vending machine situated at the roof garden available 24/7. it sells full sized bottles of wine for ony 6 euros. I couldn't believe it until I seen it either. It was so nice at night just to relax with a nice glass of wine in the warm Rome air. There is also a machine which sells tea/coffee and one selling crips chocolate etc all at very reaonable prices The hotel offers free wi-fi. You have to ask for it at reception and they will give you a code. Worked brilliantly on my smart phone so was great to be able to keep up with the news, e-mails etc also. The hotel also offers a great buffet breakfast for 10 euro a head per person per day if you choose. We used it twice. We thought it was great. You could probably get a comparable breakfast outside for about the same but if like us you don't want the hassle of hunting places down and wasting time then i recommend this. The hotel also offers a microwave area and an area where you can use the hotels washing machine, tumble dryer and iron should you need to do so. Our room size was more than adequate. I think it was a double room. ie large room with one king-sized bed. The rooms don't contain a mini-bar but do provide a mini-fridge to keep your own items cool. Believe me, you won't need a mini bar when the vending machines are so cheap and accessible 24/7. Our bathroom had a shower toilet and bidet. Again, the bathroom was totally spotless with fresh towels supplied daily. The shower was such a great easy to use powerful shower. It even had 2 shower heads, one fixed to the wall and one detachable for you to use whichever you found most comfortable. Staff were lovely and very friendly and made a point of saying hello and goodbye etc when you were coming and going and it felt a genuine greeting and not something forced on them by hotel policy or anything. They also fluent English for people like me who can't speak anything else unfortunately. Location of the hotel is perfect. It is about 10 mins walk from the Termini station. It is also ideal because it's just far enough away from all the really busy side lanes that you could potentially end up in and enough in form the main road. Everything is easily within walking distance. We even walked to the Vatican from there although this takes about 40-50 mins but worth doing because you see so so much more of the city. I think if you want to guarantee a great experience in Rome then this hotel is a total must as part of your holiday. If I return to Rome I will be booking the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter530901
Reviews.Content: Location,hospitality and cost. All are a 10. Very helpful staff, roof top breakfast a great way to start the day and a room as quite as any I've stayed in. You'd be mad to pass this Hotel up.

Reviews.Title: “What more could one want?!”
Reviews.Author: gupton
Reviews.Content: The rooms, which are spacious, clean and modern, are serviced promptly each day with clean towels. The breakfast offers an extraordinarily wide choice of continental (cold meats and cheeses), english (bacon, scrambled eggs, mushrooms, etc), fruit salad, fresh fruit, yogurts. There is a roof-top seating area (very pleasant after dark). The location (opposite the opera) is both quiet and central (10 minutes walk to Termini station). The staff are friendly, helpful, and multilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Great, location, large family rooms, very clean”
Reviews.Author: LouBeaut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ Roma post a cruise 2 weeks ago. There were 8 of us staying we had two single rooms and a family room. The rooms and hotel were very modern, clean and the amenities great for a short stay. It was in a great location in Roma, we could easily walk to Termini station, and nearby attractions. The Hotel has a laundry and business centre - which we found great to catch up on a few things after the cruise. The staff also spoke great english, very polite and helpful also. I would stay there again next time I stay in Roma as it can be hard to find accom this modern and at such a great price.

Reviews.Title: “what a great find”
Reviews.Author: bruce25oct
Reviews.Content: Being vary wary of hotels in major cities in Europe - especially Rome, it was very difficult to decide on which hotel to stay, as our taste and opinion could be quite different to somebody else. However this hotel was everything we wanted - small, modern, clean, unpretentious, everything worked, the bathroom was large. Excellent location - we walked everywhere - Colosseum, Vatican (45 minutes brisk walk). Across the road was a great little cafe with excellent coffee & croissant. Just a 10 minute walk to Termini station. Anyone not stable on the cobblestones would be best to get a local taxi. We hope that IQ builds more hotels like this - we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & clean hotel in a good location - will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: BJ216
Reviews.Content: The IQ Hotel Roma is a modern hotel in a good central location in Rome. The rooms are a good size for Rome, and extremely clean. The hotel had good facilities such as free Wi-Fi, a laundry room (wash 1euro, dry 2euros), and good hot & cold breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful, organising transfers to and from the airport and answering all of our questions with a smile. After staying in some dreadful hotels for a lot more money on previous trips to Rome, I was delighted with this hotel and will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very modern place. Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Sonyak77
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights and really appreciated how clean and well organized it was. The rooms are small but I guess that's normal in Europe. The vending machines have cheap booze and toiletries etc which is great. Really good

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Camper_2004
Reviews.Content: IQ Hotel Roma is a hidden gem. It is very quiet, very modern, and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. It is convenient to the train station and bus and Metro lines. The Roof Garden Lounge is great - just buy a bottle of wine from the vending machine on-site and relax and enjoy the open air lounge. It's a great place for breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms”
Reviews.Author: monygrl
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Americanized hotel. If you are looking for large rooms, huge bathrooms, plenty of outlets etc, this hotel is for you. Its brand new and very clean and bright. We had the breakfast one morning and it was excellant and filling. The desk people were helpful and friendly. It had a nice rooftop deck but there wasnt a view from it. But it was still nice to get out of the room at night, grab a cup of coffee/beer/wine from the convenient and inexpensive vending machines and sit out there in the fresh air and maybe meet some other travelers. The hotel itself seemed a little out of the way, but Rome is so large, unless you were in the center I think anything would seem far away. Be careful of the Taxi drivers in Rome. They tried to charge us 26 Euros to get from Termini to the hotel which is not a far distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - big room, modern decor, nice terrace”
Reviews.Author: happyphantom7
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've stayed at in Rome. Decent prices (introductory offer), location was walking-distance from many of the main attractions (about 10-15-min walk to Trevi Fountain). The large double room was very spacious by European standards - bathroom had separate bath and shower, toilet and bidet. The building is next to the Opera House and looks a bit like a sterile office block, but decor inside is nice, clean and modern. The roof terrace is also a good place to relax. Termini train station is convenient, and the hotel is a good distance from the sketchier hotels/hostels there. Not many restaurants nearby, but it's easy to find them elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: irene059
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located and in walking distance to Trevi Fountain and train station. It is safe to walk at night. THe rooms are very nice and spacious for Europe standards. The hotel was brand new when we stayed in Aug. 2010. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The linen was crisp! We stayed 2 nights. The location is superb and would defintiely come back here. The train station is a 10 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, no frills... pleasantly functional”
Reviews.Author: TheBundo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of May and were pleasantly surprised by our experience. The concept is designed around self-service: vending machines for drinks (awesome), snacks (less than awesome), and general amenities are scattered all over the hotel. The hotel still feels very new and while the rooms are quite small, they are exceptionally clean compared to some other European 4-stars we've stayed at. Location-wise, it's a 10-minute walk to the Termini Train Station and within a 20-30 minute amble to most major tourist destinations except for the Vatican (iQ's proximity to the metro A line more than makes up for this). However, we found that at EUR220 a night prior to the real summer peak, the hotel comes up a little short on value. The buffet breakfast here is a winner, with indoor and outdoor rooftop seating providing a perfect start to any morning. Cross the square and take a left down Via Torino for some excellent Gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mbmoore
Reviews.Content: Went last month and loved this hotel. From the minute we walked in the door we knew we had picked the right hotel. Staff we exceptional!! Really nice and helpful. Rooms are on the small side but still enough room to move about. Beds were grand, a little hard, but no problem sleeping. Now on to the important things!!!! Drink - the vending machines are great, really cheap, large bottles red and White wine €6. Bud beer €3.50, perp €2.50, all sandwiches 2.50, cans of coke etc €1.00, bottles of water .50 cent. Now if you want to save more money you can go around to the spar supermarket on via national(take a left and cross the road, 2 minute walk) and get 3 bottles of peroni for 2.50 and put them in your fridge that is provided and drink them on the roof top garden after a long day of site seeing. Your allowed being in what ever you like there's even a sign in your room saying you can do this. The roof garden is fab and really comfortable, great for a relaxing nite! Anyway enjoy your stay, I know il be recommending this hotel to All my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel super quiet”
Reviews.Author: jensSydney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated not too far from termini railway station.We took express train from FCO airport and 5-10 minute walk.Opera house opposite.Newly renovated ,the rooms are modern and the bathroom in our room was large with separate bath ,shower and bidet.Handy coin operated laundry in hotel and vending machines selling everything from sandwiches to espresso coffee and beer ,bottles of wine and even glasses very cheaply .You can then go to the roof area where there are tables and chairs and lounges in an alfresco setting.Breakfast is served up there in an adjoining room at 10€ per person with a good selection of hot and cold food.This is the quietest hotel we have ever stayed in in Rome,we slept in till after 10am! So if you need to go anywhere set your alarm.The staff at the hotel were terrific,so helpful,especially when there was a taxi strike,they showed us how to use the metro to get to the Vatican,so easy when you know how!This hotel was a terrific find on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VladanT
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with the quality and location of the hotel. Service was great, with all the amenities of a 5* hotel. Breakfast was well worth the 10Euros per person. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, self-service hotel that's perfect in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: KillBoggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. It's ultra-modern, clean, in a great location and is affordable. The best thing about it is that, bar reception, it's completely self-service - so there are vending machines on every level selling you drinks, snacks, toiletries and even alcohol. There's also self-service laundry and a great little gym. It works brilliantly, and clearly the savings made from not needing staff for all of those means it's a good price. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room! Excellent Service! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoelStahl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night on the last leg of our Italy vacation. The location was ideal since we came by train from Florence and you can walk to the iQ Hotel from Termini Station in Rome (two late 40s guys with a roller suitcase and a carry-on apiece -- you might not want to make your grandma lug bags that far though). The service was EXCELLENT. The room was flawlessly prepared: neat and clean, nice amenities. Despite being close to the train station, we slept very well. The rooms were surprisingly quiet. And by European standards, they are quite large. The National Museum of Rome is very close by (great mosaics there and worth an hour or two) and we walked to Trevi Fountain from the hotel, although it was a little further than we expected. Being so close to the Termini Station, you can easily hop either Linea A or Linea B on the underground metro. I'm very glad we picked this hotel. The other reviewers were spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Agervig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at iQ Hotel Roma for five days during our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it. We used the rooftop terrace every day and night bringing back lovely Italian wine from our trips around the city and enjoying the cool breeze up there. Our room was very nice (although the bed was a bit hard for my taste) and the bathroom was wonderful. Aircondition worked wonderfully and we weren't bothered by outside noises at all. The staff was friendly and exceptionally helpful. One of the receptionists offered to buy stamps and post our postcards for us, when we had difficulty getting stamps as we were leaving early in the morning. There is a breakfast restaurant serving a breakfast buffet for €10 per person (optional), and we highly recommend this. It is difficult to get a decent breakfast in Italy and this is the biggest breakfast buffet I've ever seen, serving amongst many others: fresh fruits, yoghurt, cereals, ryebread/toast/rolls/croissants, juices and a wide selection of coffees and cakes!!! We will definitely stay here for our next visit to wonderful Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Librarian_55
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in Rome. Great location and great service. We had a beautiful room with bacony, lovely roof top terrace and vending machies with wine, beer, morning drinks. It was a great location--close to train station and an easy walk nearly anywhere--would stay here again. Everything was as expected--maybe better!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozbabe1
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Australia jet lagged and dazed to be greeted by a driver IQ Hotel had organized for a reasonable $58. He was awesome and we'd recommend paying the money. The hotel itself is modern and new so not historic but exactly what is needed if you want to feel instantly at ease and safe in a new city. The rooms are great and each floor of the hotel has a self-service area with vending machines selling coffee, water (€0.50c) and beers (€2.5-3.50). The top floor has roof terrace with a vending machine selling alcohol 24/7 at cheap prices. On the top floor is also a restaurant where breakfast is served. It's a great space and definitely worth the €10 for as much food/drinks as you can eat. Location wise it's right near the main station where all the open top buses leave from. Saying that the hotel itself is in a very quiet street. Can't recommend highly enough. TIP. Doesn't have irons in rooms or tea/coffee facilities in room but freely available on each floor self-service area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Stevev
Reviews.Content: Just back from iQ Hotel, my wife and I stayed 4 nights with our 7 year old daughter. I cannot honestly think of 1 negative about this hotel, we had a triple room which I think are the biggest rooms and have a small balcony. Room very modern and contemporary, bathroom very nice, bath/shower very spacious and works a treat with towels nice and fluffy which were changed every day. Beds were firm but we found them comfortable. Free safe in room, reasonable sized fridge to stock up with items from supermarket 2 minutes round the corner. Very small annoyance was lack of English speaking TV channel other than CNN, whilst we don't travel to watch TV, it's nice to occassionally switch on and 1 english speaking kids channel would be nice. Vending machines very useful, breakfast enjoyable on roof top terrace, 10 Euros for adult but 5 Euros for children. Made use of vending machine 1 evening, snack food tasty (sandwiches) and 6 Euro wine on rooftop terrace one evening which was nice and a good opportunity to meet other travellers and compare notes! I used the business centre once to check in for flight home and send some emails although there was free wireless in hotel if you ask at reception for a password. What impressed us most was the friendleness of front desk, always met with a smile and greeting even when walking past. Gave very good directions and recommendations for restaurants and phoned ahead if need be to check tables. Location was fine quite honestly, we booked the recently available Colesseum underground tour which was fantastic and really cheap if you use the right official website as recommended on these travel forums also because they take you up to the very highest level after through a locked gate that normal entrance does not get you to and the views are fantastic! We also booked the Angel Tours Vatican City tour which was very good, paid on the day and had a nice English chap called Ben take us around who was very knowledgeable. It was a very long tour however especially for our 7 year old. Last day wandered around Trevi, Pantheon, Navona and Spanish Steps fairly easily from hotel and got the tube back to save tired legs. Lastly used Romacabs for airport on both ways, highly recommended (very punctual), chap on way to hotel drove round a few of the sites and gave us a quick tour for no extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: twocruzin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location right next to the Opera House and just a few blocks from the central train station. The staff at the hotel is extremely helpful and friendly. I had to communicate with them via email a few times before our arrival and their responses were always timely and accurate. They arranged transportation from the port in Civitavecchia to the hotel for us and it went very smoothly. The hotel is a nice modern hotel with air conditioned rooms although you do not want a room on the 5th floor (the top floor) as that seems to be always warm. We were initially given a room on that floor and the air conditioning did not work and it felt like an oven in there. After two hours we asked for a different room and they put us on the 2nd floor where we then enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel has a nice roof top sitting area with comfortable chairs and couches and tent type covering. There is also a vending machine that dispenses bottles of good Italian wine for 5 to 7 Euros. I think it also had beer available. We sometimes sat on the roof top and enjoyed our wine. It made for a pleasant experience. An ample breakfast buffet was available for 10 Euros per person extra and was well worth it. There are a number of restaurants nearby plus a McDonald's just down the street where we would get our evening tea for one Euro. Overall, the iQ Hotel Rome is a good place to stay. It's location makes it easily accessible to most of the tourist attractions of Rome either by walking or a short subway or bus ride. For our Vatican tour, we took the subway from the central train station which is only a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ptrounstine
Reviews.Content: Finding an affordable, top-quality hotel in Rome can be a challenge, but this place is ideal. We stayed three nights in a standard double room which was a good size with a terrific bathroom. Everything is crisp and clean and modern. You can get just about anything you need or want from the vending machines, the air conditioning and elevator are tip top, wifi is excellent and included, the staff could not be more helpful and the neighborhood is safe and handy -- close to major transportation hubs, restaurants and convenience shopping. When we were looking for a place, Hotels.com had a deal going, so we got a great rate as well. You pay for what you need, not for tons of overhead. There's no room service but there's a laundry room with coin-op machines, a gym, roof garden (with machines that dispense beer and wine) and super maid service. We'd stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: cclgbc
Reviews.Content: The location was great for walking and/or catching the metro at Republic station. On a quiet side street right off Nazionale. The rooftop patio is a nice place to unwind at the end of the day, but building too short for any good views. We had brought back an unfinished bottle of wine from dinner restaurant, but can buy wine, etc. in vending machine at the hotel very reasonably. We did not buy the breakfast package as we found out we really don't want that much (which was included in our other hotels), and you could get coffee in the machine to drink in your room while getting dressed. IQ is very modern and compact but has all the amenities, is very quiet, and we loved it. Shower was wonderful-spacious with two heads, and lots of counterspace in bath. Beds and pillows were great too. Would definitely stay there again, but doubt that we will ever return to Rome-too busy, noisy, hilly, and similar to New York City. After a bad experience with a cab driver from the airport, the hotel arranged for a driver when we left which was very reasonable and better. Since we did not bring our computer, for 2 euros we used the one in the business center to print our boarding passes; very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Ark_traveler_st
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated close to everything. You can walk to most sights or take the Metro about 5 mins away. The hotel was very well maintained. The breakfast bar didn't appeal to us but they had plenty of bakeries surrounding the hotel to get breakfast. The staff was very friendly and prompt to help us with any request. We used the hotel transportation service and it was wonderful! The beds were a bit firm as is the standard in Europe but after a full day in Rome you won't even notice! It is a great deal for the price and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “too far from sights & historic feel”
Reviews.Author: ssw61
Reviews.Content: This is a modern new hotel just across from the Opera House in Rome. Clean, new, plenty of hot water but didn't have the feel of Rome.. good price as we booked very early.. My first visit to Rome, would have perferred to stay in Piazza Navona area as this is where we spent time and found the best restaurants. We walked alot, used the bus service with Roma Pass but felt like I was in New York instead of Rome due to hustle and bustle of busy streets and city. Staff at desk were o.k., but this hotel is focused towards a self service type place. Felt more like for business travelers than tourists. Breakfast buffet available for 10 Euro.. was good, with variety.

Reviews.Title: “IKEA hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjh2181
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location which we walked to all the major tourist attractions from, the metro is directly around the corner and is easy to navigate. the hotel looks modern which gives the look of an IKEA show room the walls are quite thin so you can hear most noises in the hallways and the bed was like sleeping on a kitchen table, but in saying that we enjoyed our stay we loved sitting at the roof top on the big lounges drinking wine from the vending machines (there is no room service or mini bar but you have every thing you need and more from the vending machines). the staff were very helpful with all our questions an queries. we also had free Wifi for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonably priced for Rome standards”
Reviews.Author: TripleDutch
Reviews.Content: Getting to the city center of Rome, where the IQ hotel is located, takes over half an hour by taxi from Fiumicino Airport. Be aware that there is a fixed rate of EUR 40 to and from the city center, lugage included. So don't get tricked, from and to the airport they tried the higher metered rate on us. Arriving at the hotel, check- in went very smooth. Lobby was modern and inviting. Room was very clean, of average size, a little basic with a nice bathroom. There was no mini-bar but there were vendingmachines in the hotel which was fine with us. Breakfast is optional but very good. Sitting at the rooftop restaurant with your espresso and bowl of fruit in the sun was an excellent way to start the day. The fitness room served is purpose well. The hotel is within walking distance of the Colosseum. Ask directions at the reception, they are very willing to show you. The Trevi fountain and Spanish steps are also not too far away. The metro station Republica is only 5 minutes by foot. To get to the Vatican the easiest way is by metro. Get out at Ottaviano station and walk for another 5 minutes: you can't miss it! There are some nice restaurants in the area: Ristorante Cotto and Ristorante del Giglio on the Via Torino. To sum it up: if you want to have a decent hotel in good location for a reasonable price, we can definitely recommend the IQ hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: acraw42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to the main rail station in Rome. Easy 10 minute walk. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet.The hotel staff was very helpful, polite and quick to be of service...The vending machines were really an asset. Good selection of food and drink at reasonable prices. Breakfast was a little pricey, but very good.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopla_huggy
Reviews.Content: hotel to recommend. nice, modern, smart. friendly and helpful saff well-located

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RuthajBC
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean and convenient.....close to train station and Ancient Rome totally walkable from here. The rooftop terrace was so enjoyable after a day of seeing the sights. You can get a bottle of wine, beer or coolers out of the vending machine too...perfect! Good variety of choices in the nice big breakfast room too. The only downside for me was that the bed was very firm but when mentioned the staff promptly came and padded it up which helped a little.

Reviews.Title: “splendid hotel, clean, friendly and in great location! no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: luluj33
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location close to the metro and the hop on /off bus tours is just a short walk away. The rooms are decently sized - even the triple - and stocked with everything you need and the maid service is daily. They have wonderful showers and the beds are comfy too although a little hard some say! The hotel has stocked vending machines which sells everything you could need razors, face cream, lotion etc and a good selction of wines , beers and soft drinks at reasonable prices. moreover the roof terrace is beautiful and a perfect sun trap with covering for those who might want shade! the staff here are also very friendly and the hotel also has smoking areas which I have never seen before but are great as the hotel doesnt smell of smoke as these are outside on different levels of the hotel!! Overall a positive experience and I would not hesitate to stay here again - a jewel of a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ads007
Reviews.Content: A lovely clean and modern hotel located perfectly for the sights of Rome. Breakfast at 10 euros is a bargain,trust me you won't get better value for quantity anywhere else. Staff are efficient and lovely. Perfect location, 3 minutes walk from the lovely trattoria and the sights of Rome. Do the free tour from spagna piazza, for a tip at your discretion you get a good orientation and a good history lesson. For a cheap sandwich/beer/bottle of wine to enjoy on the roof terrace go to the deli that is located: out of hotel,straight across face of opera,turn left and it 20 yards down the street on the right hand side. Love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Faxman
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel on this site and after a quick view of their website booked for 3 nights. On arrival we were dealt with quickly and efficiently by welcoming staff. Our room for 3 was a good size with all amenities and the beds were comfortable especially after hard days walking. The roof area was a great place to relax with wine from the vending machines, which was reasonable at 6 Euro and of good quality. Breakfast was great and at 10 Euro for all you could eat, really set us up for the day. I and my family recommend this hotel highly and we will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - best hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JanetSEugene_OR
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel to stay at for our trip to Italy to celebrate our 25th anniversary. It is everything that they promised and more. When we arrived, we had flown for about 20 hours, and were tired and hungry. The help at the front desk checked us in quickly so we could catch breakfast before they stopped serving in 15 minutes. They were amazingly friendly, informative, and professional. It was quite a welcome to Rome! Later, my husband teased me about not taking a picture of the room for the scrapbook, but as I told him, I did not need to because it was absolutely just like the picture. Location is great as well, we walked to everything that we wanted to say. My most important tip - have the hotel arrange for your transport from the airport to the hotel, it was priceless!!! The 'cab' was a BMW, and the driver in a suit. He was professional, pleasant, and it allowed us to relax and enjoy the official start of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Chic Hotel, Good Value, Clean”
Reviews.Author: bjg896
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, good location close to the train, but not in a scuzzy area. Walking distance to just about everything (everything is walking distance in Rome). We hardly used the subway at all, but the buses were useful. This hotel is modern chic, the rooms are very nice, but get your soda/water/food at the grocery store (there's one close by on Nazionale) because the prices in the vending machines are outrageous. The rooftop garden is pretty cool and the staff at the front desk were very helpful and freidnly. Breakfast is not included here, but that's fine becuase you can find plenty of cafes all over for coffee and pastries. Overall good value for a high quality, clean, and helpful staff in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, lovely & clean. Great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Flowerpop5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were very impressed. The location was perfect for us. We only had to catch public transport once & that was to get to the Vatican, but we walked back to the hotel after and it only took half an hour. This hotel is within walking distance to all the Cities attractions. 10minute walk to the Collosseum & the Trevi fountain. The hotel staff are very helpful and give you maps with all the attractions and show you the best walking route to take. The best thing about Rome is that even walking to a attration- there are always so many things to look at on the way. This hotel is also just around the corner from a main shopping street. Local resturants close and good value for money. Transfer from airport is easy, there is a metro a 10min walk from the hotel. The hotel was always clean, with housekeeping every morning fresh towels etc. The sauna is clean and new, so works well. The gym is small.... but who wants to use a gym on holiday anyway.. it seemed adequate with lots of gear & tv. Now the breakfast. Absolutely the best hotel breakfast I have ever had! Such a great variety of hot & cold foods. Including fresh fruit/breads/cheeses/meats/muselis and lovely juices and good coffee. I highly reccommend the breakfast, it is a extra 10 euros but it fills ya up for the day and is just really yummy! The hotels rooftop area is really cool, even tho it was winter when we were here we did go out there a few times. each floor has a outdoor smoking area, but there is never any smell of smoke in the halls. The internet kiosk is modern and good, with about 6 computers. There is a bar in the reception area which you can sit at, but we used the vending machine for our drinks which was reasonable prices. Our room was great, lovely and warm & clean! The bathroom was good, with a great shower/ hair drier. The room has a safe & a empty fridge so you can buy food and keep it chilled. The hotel also has washing machines & a drier, which cost about 1 euro. Perfect if you have being travelling around and need to do some washing! We were so happy with this hotel it made our trip to Rome very comfortable. I have and will continue to reccommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Something a bit different”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with wife and best friends. We loved it. Rooms are good, although agree hard mattresses. Roof terrace is excellent - we started each evening with a bottle of wine from the vending machine - well chilled and only 6 euros, a bargain. Breakfast was also really good at 10 euros each for lots of choice. Very good location - 20 min walk to Colisseum, 10 mins to Trevi. Our room faced inwards and very quiet although our friends were over the street and suffered from noise. Strongly recommended though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to call "home" for a trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: barly
Reviews.Content: Hotel iQRoma was everything that we had hoped for and more! From the helpful welcoming staff at the front desk, to the excellent concierge service and our clean and spacious room, my 2 adult children and I were able to enjoy our fabulous Rome vacation in true comfort. It is centrally located so that we could walk to all of the main sites, and also enjoy our quiet time at the hotel with a lovely rooftop garden and convenient automatic dispensers for many different beverages (including some fine wines) and snacks. Our room also had a small fridge and a safe to store our valuables, and the free wi-fi was a real plus! The plentiful morning rooftop buffet, for a reasonable 10 Euros per person, also helped to get our day off to a healthy start. I would very highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to this magnificent city, and I would definitely stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average, Nothing Special and No Amenities”
Reviews.Author: AirlineGuyFLA
Reviews.Content: I have been Flight Crew for many years and have seen hundreds of hotels from top notch, to average... to poor. This hotel is definitely only an average. How it became one of the top five hotels in Rome on Trip Advisor is beyond me. In fact this is the first time the reviews have not been accurate in my opinion. On the positive side I will say the hotel was very clean. It is in a decent location close to the termini station. It is modern in style however the quality was average with little comfort and few amenities. It felt more like a travel lodge type hotel with Ikea style and quality furnishings. In other words...cheap. The bathroom was nice but had a very small shower. I took a peak in the larger rooms and they are more spacious and probably worth the upgrade. Still nothing special. The standard king is very small and I am used to small rooms in Europe, however this room felt like a dorm room. The bed is as so many mentioned... HARD and like sleeping on a cement block. The TV is very small. There is no iron/ironing board in the room, no coffee maker. These are what I call nice to have items that make a stay much more enjoyable. The air conditioner barely cooled the room (as mentioned in previous reviews). There were no visible vents and so the room was never as cool as the hallways. The vending machines were a plus and it was nice to have them for a late night snack or a beverage. All and all I have to say this is fine if you just want a clean basic room. If you enjoy comfort amenities this is not the hotel for you. You will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bindy76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at iQ Hotel for our 3 day stay in Rome and were very happy with our time there. The hotel and the rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The facilities were adequate for our needs and the rooftop terrace was an added bonus. The hotel is lovely and modern and is conveniently located near Republicca metro station and Termini metro/train station. We had the breakfast each morning, largely for convenience, but we found it reasonably priced and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: NJerseyTraveler22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the iQ Hotel was perfect!! This place is ideal for either business or leisure and is convenient to many locations and sites in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “This one has it all~”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandGal
Reviews.Content: There isn"t one bad thing I can say about this hotel. It had a Metro-(Repubblica) 2 blocks away and on the same street (Via Nazionale)you could catch a bus to many different parts of Rome. We took the train in to Rome Termini from the airport (very easy) and then it was a 15 minute walk to the hotel.The shower in the bathroom was fabulous! The room size is compact,but adequate. They offer a buffet breakfast up on the 5th floor which also has an adjoining rooftop area with tables and chairs. The breakfast is an additional 10 euro per day a person. It was delicious and offered scrambled eggs and bacon;fresh fruits & veggies, meats and cheeses;rolls,bread,& pastries. But the best was the coffee! Well worth the 10 euro~kept you well fueled until lunch. I would have to say though that the staff were the hotel"s best asset. We were helped with directions and places to dine~they made all our reservations and we were never disappointed. (thank you Hicham) I loved my time in Rome and when I return, I will book once again at the IQ Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, great model, excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: albilola
Reviews.Content: Very clean and new. All you can eat breakfast for only 10 euros, very good quality brilliant value. No evening meal but after hard days sightseeing they have a great private roof terrace part covered part open with vending machines selling wine(only 6 euros for full size bottle) beers and snacks. Great place to unwind at end of day before evening venture. No restaurant for evening meals but to be honest restaurants outside in Rome are excellent value mostly so who wanyts to stay in a hotel. Hotel has it spot on for customer needs. Stay just outside main tourist areas for better value and food. Small is beautiful. My only gripe would be that beds were quite firm hence 4 on sleep quality but got used to it, anyway you always sleep when your exhausted. Very good for all transport links. Underground only costs 1 euro per use, superb value and very close 2 mins walk, easy access to all main attractions. If you have not been my top visit would be St.Peters awe inspiring architecture, amazing and freeee. Fridge in all rooms for your own use.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome (We agree with all the other reviews)”
Reviews.Author: CalifTravelBuddy
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor we booked the IQ Hotel for 6 nights (Easter Weekend) Excellent decision. From the moment the Hotel Manger came out to help us with the cab driver who wanted to charge us 90 euros from the airport (It "supposedly" is price fixed and should be 40 Euros) to the great desk support personal who provide you a map and mark the hotel and nearest subway stop (Republic- two blocks):Shop at CarreFour Express supermarket to fill empty mini fridge (turn right out of hotel end of block turn right;go 1 short street; cross street to next corner;see sign CarreFour Express;go downstairs to supermarket/use elevator after purchases/bring own bag or small charge for plastic bags. Avoid the few rooms they have on the 5th floor which is the location of the roof terrace, ice/sandwiches/beer/soft drinks/wine/ coffee machines (Prices very responsible) Everyone will walk by your room all night. No skin lotion. No robe in room. No clock/alarm: call # 9 on the phone for walk up call Wonderful soft bed. Great to cure jet lag! Breakfast 10 Euro extra per person per day (Well worth it) 7:00-10:30 5th floor breakfast room Tub has a very high side/ consider moving glass by front of tub inward to hold onto sink to help in getting in and out of tub Clothes line in tub never needed to visit laundry room with coin operated washer/dryers. Free WiFi in room (ask at desk) Two Ultra fast/ large elevators in an amazing new hotel. Hairdryer/ magnifying mirror in room Strongly suggest getting a Roma Pass to jump the long lines.Colosseum/Forum/Museums Using hotel pickup at airport (50 ? euros) Online booking before you go to Rome at the Borghese Museo (two hour timed visits) arrange 9E? English 1 1/2 hr walking tour leaves 5 minutes after each two hour interval with a very knowledgeable guide. Arrange this tour after you enter the museum (at the desk to rent the audio tour devices). Example: you have a 11AM-1PM reservation; tour leaves at 11:05AM they will give you special audio device to hear the guide...you do not rent the usual audio device at the desk just pay for and get a small colored tag you wear to identify you are in the walking tour. Note: tell the taxi driver you want the Borghese Museo (if you say Villa you will be let off in the park...a very long walk to the museum! and arrive 20 minutes early for your timed visit to get on line to turn in your paperwork to get your tickets and use the bathroom/check your bags/backpack/cameras (no photography). They do not take coats (so put in backpack or have to carry them...arrange the English walking tour. Entrance is on first floor to do all the above..guide will lead you out of the building to reenter on the lower level where they will check your ticket and make sure you do not have any bags/cameras. Oh and you will have 20-30 minutes at the end of the tour to revisit your favorite areas in this amazing house/museum. And visit their website to see the statues/painting before you go. Have a great time in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gweedy
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very modern with everything new and very clean, opened about a year ago. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They have a great business center for getting on the web. The location is very close to the train station and right next to the Opera house. They do have a fitness center which is small but has modern equip that works well along with a sauna. The daily breakfast was by the far the best we breakfast we had of all of our hotels on our 2 week Italy stay. They do charge extra for the breakfast but it was worth it if you like a good hot&cold breakfast. Only hotel we stayed in that had a washer & dryer you could use on one floor, only issue with that was the cleaning staff used it too so it was busy sometimes. Overall, it was our best stay of the trip for all things mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Toshanicole
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and you couldn't beat the location! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: leapinglenny12
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel if you don't mind walking. Pretty much everything is within a 15-20 minute walk, including the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc and is within 5 minutes of the tube which took us to the Vatican. The rooms are very minimal in nature and very small, as most European hotel rooms are....if you have a room on the first floor facing the street, however, please ask the front desk to move you as the noise starts at about 630AM. The front desk staff are extraordinary in their ability to serve the public. They were the best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nixy069
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ Hotel for 3 nights. It was our first stay in Rome, and we couldn't have found a better hotel. As other people have said, its 8-10 mins walk to the Termini from there, and in a really nice location next to the Opera House. The receptionists were extremely helpful with perfect English. Our room had a king size bed, even though the bed was hard it was nice and comfortable. The room was spotlessly clean and decorated to a high standard, the bathroom was lovely and contemporary with a powerful shower. The vending machines were dangerously cheap(!) and the roof terrace was lovely. We didn't rate the breakfast very much for the price, so we went to local cafes which were much cheaper with nicer food. We walked everywhere and if you are able, I would recommend you do so too, as you discover the hidden Rome with the lovely backstreets, they were so quiet, you wouldn't think you were in a capital city. We walked to the Vatican in 45 minutes (medium pace). Check out was quick and efficient. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A smart modern hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: SolandFro
Reviews.Content: Located only a 5-10 min walk from the Termini Station this new hotel offers a host of attractive features for the modern traveller. Our double room on the 4th floor was spacious with comfortable beds, had a nice bathroom and a small balcony with a view towards nearby Teatro dell'Opera. The cleaning of our rooms was flawless. Several vending machines offer a wide choice of various commodities, toilet articles, snacks and sandwiches, coffee, wine, beer and non-alcoholic beverages, all at favourable prices. There is a microwave oven on the 4th floor. A particularly pleasing feature is the roof terrace, divided lightly into three spacious compartments, one part being covered under a canvas roof and with removable canvas walls as wind shelter. The terrace was enjoyed by many of the guests relaxing there with a snack and some wine after a busy day of walking and sightseeing. The hotel offers free access to sauna and gymroom and free Wi-Fi in the rooms. If you did not bring your laptop you can rent one of the PC's in the business room for a symbolic fee. Many of the historic sites of Rome are well within walking distance (0.1 - 2 km) from the hotel. To the Vatican City you may prefer to take the metro from the nearby station Repubblica. Despite its central location the immediate neighbourhood of the hotel is surprisingly quiet. For those interested in music and opera an extra bonus is the close proximity of both Teatro dell'Opera and San Paolo dentro le Mura, the latter a church only a 3 min. walk from the hotel where there are regular opera performances and concerts. Enjoy the acoustics! We spent 6 days at iQ Hotel from the end of March - early April. We enjoyed our stay very much, including the service of an attentive, very competent, friendly and helpful staff. The price for our room was a bonus for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezza3
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location.Lots of historic sights and shops within walking distance.Staff were friendly and helpful.We had a problem with the very firm bed and asked for a mattress topper which we were duly supplied with,although I suspect it was really a duvet!Never the less it certainly helped.Loved the vending machines selling all sorts from sandwiches(2.50 eu) to bottles of wine(6eu).Also very much liked the roof top garden area to relax in after a long day walking everywhere.Take your own refreshments to drink and eat up there.Rooms were on the small side but we did have a little balcony,which was a plus.Lovely modern bathroom and powerful shower.Breakfast was plentiful and self sevice.Lots of choice for all tastes.Metro station a couple of minutes walk away.A definite must to travel to the vatican on.Easy to use and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break at the IQ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shintybhoy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break staying at the IQ Hotel and was delighted with our choice. It was an easy walk from the Termini Station and although we were early our room was ready for us. Check in was super, the receptionist took the time to show us a map of Rome and mark out the major tourist attractions and how to get to them. Our room was a small double with a shower room but had the bonus of a small balcony. The whole hotel was spotless with the room cleaned daily. The bed was slightly hard but this was the only slight negative I can think of. The area around the hotel has good restaurants for eating out and the vending machines in the hotel are a great addition. Breakfast at 10 euros was good value and had a lovely choice. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers05
Reviews.Content: During our five week tour through the UK and Europe, this was one of the best hotels we stayed in. The rooms are of a generous size, and very quiet. The bathroom was large and had modern fittings. We appreciated the 2 Euro washing machine and the microwave. We went to the supermarket just around the corner and bought food to heat in the micro which was great. The breakfast was delicious and could be eaten outdoors on the rooftop terrace. All in all, this was a great place to stay in Rome and very convenient to all the major attractions and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - Clean - Worth Price - Great Location - Cool Roof Lounge”
Reviews.Author: vmccausland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the IQ hotel on our first night in Rome. The bed was HARD AS A ROCK, but the rest was absolutely worth it. Matter of fact, we would stay there again. The bed being super hard seems to be a theme in Rome. The only bed in Italy that wasn't hard, was at Boscolo Palace which we paid over 350/night. The roof louge was nice and had a wine vending machine. It was central to everything and the staff was AMAZINGLY friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at IQ Roma”
Reviews.Author: BrianFromPhila
Reviews.Content: We just stayed four nights at the IQ Roma and had a great experience. The room was small but clean and modern. The staff was very helpful. Very good location..a five to ten minute walk to Termini. We like to walk everywhere and IQ was perfect for that..the only time we needed the metro was to get to the Vatican for an early morning tour. A nice bonus was the roof deck, which had couches and a vending machine with beer and wine. We didn't do breakfast at the hotel as we were able to find cheaper options elsewhere. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCymru
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the location, which is great. Walking distance from Termini station and also the Spanish steps, trevi fountain, the Colosseum and the forum. It's next to the Opera House, and there a number of nice restaurants and bars nearby. The hotel has spacious rooms, with big bathrooms. There was a small balcony on our room opening onto the street whilst other rooms overlook an internal courtyard. Breakfasts were good with something for everyone and the roof terrace is a delight and a nice way to end an evening with a very reasonably priced bottle of wine or beer.

Reviews.Title: “IQ 5 star service!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at iQ hotel for 8 nights while in Rome and have to say they went above and beyond to make our stay the Best it could be! We have stayed in Rome before but IQ will be our hotel for all future ROne trips!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--horrible bed”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, it was new and modern—the room was nice sized with space for luggage and a good size closet, there was a safe, free wifi, a mini fridge, windows that open, a make up mirror, huge soaking tub, everything was very clean, a large roof top deck with plenty of comfy seating, vending machines with coffee, wine, snacks and incidentals, very nice helpful staff, and lots cafes close by. And most importantly the pictures on the internet are accurate. What the hotel lacked was—there were no iron or ironing boards, no coffee maker in the room, very hard uncomfortable beds, small tv, the hotel is located a little far from the sights, the neighborhood felt safe, the breakfast was 10 e--not free as in most Italian hotels but was very good. All in all I really liked this hotel. Other than it being a little far from most of the places we wanted to go visit, it was still close enough to walk to everything if you don't mind walking--maybe 20 to 30 minutes. And the only reason that I would not stay here again is that the beds were so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgosul
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home last night from this hotel,used Romeshuttlelimousine.com from the Airport,lovely new Mercedes,so we arrived in style.Very easy check,got 2 wifi codes that lasted for the 3 nights,had breakfast one morning only & it was very good,well worth the €10.Roof top area was excellent,€3.50 for a 37.5cl bottle of wine & €2.50 for a bottle of beer,50 cent for bottles of water,from the vending machines.Stayed in room 501,which was a good size,had a seperate shower & bathtub.We walked everywhere from this hotel,the furthest was the vatican,on the next street, via Torina,is a great restaurant dei Giglio.we left our luggage yesterday as out flight was late,with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: achique_rbh
Reviews.Content: Love the IQ hotel!!! The service is excellent, practically all their staffs are bilingual or multilingual, so you'll be able to get assistance almost immediately. The rooms are great, comfortable with all the needed amenities. Since it's a no frills hotel, you won't find any mini bars in the room or even room service. But it's not a problem since street cafes are available next to the hotel or piazza. And they also have vending machines filled with fresh coffees (espresso, cafe latte, cappucinos etc) and snacks (inc fresh sandwiches) available at various locations. And you can even enjoy your snacks at one of the open areas (roof top garden overlooking the city and Theatre. If you're feeling like cooking your own dinner (more like instant dinners), you can use the microwave available at level 5 (i think). There's Carrefour Express behind the hotel to get your instant dinners from. And there a street vendor selling fruits and snacks just a few meters away from the hotel. There's also washing machines available at level 2 if you want to do laundry. I was only staying for a day so I did not need these services but for those staying longer, i think that's a great facility. Especially since you won't be able to see all of Rome in a day. And, another plus point, their WI-fi is free!! The expiry period is 10 days! I've been to a number of italian hotels and most will charge a fee for wi-fi or internet usage, so this is great news for me. As for it's location, it's exactly next to "Teatro dell'Opera" , follow the road towards the Opera House and you'll get there. The location is close to Termini Station but having said that, you might need to consider taking the bus/ taxi if you're bringing a large luggage or travelling with little kids/ elderly. You have to walk uphill from the station a fair bit before reaching the flat plains. With regards to it's location to the tourist sites, all are within walking distance. Some are closer (2-5 mins); others are approx 15-20 mins. These are walking time. Some, like the Vatican City would require the use of Metro. So, put on your walking shoes and bring lots of water and wear sun protection. Love the IQ Hotel. Would definitely choose it for my next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “30th Wedding anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: kvr30
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the facilities offered were excellent value. The room was very comfortable and was of a high finished to a high standard and was extremely clean. The staff were very helpful, courteous and spoke excellent English. The concept of having vending machines providing drinks and snacks was an excellent idea and these offered excellent value when compared with Rome's bar prices. The terrace was a good place to relax and enjoy a drink or two.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: linazami
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, good location , helpful staff. The rooms are a bit small but organized well. The concept with the vending machines is very useful, and we enjoyed the terrace and the open-air smoking areas very much. In terms of value for money – perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: SSB11
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great stay here. People at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful with directions and requests. The hotel is very modern, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the roof patio after long days of sightseeing. The wine and other vending machines were really convenient and well priced. The room was cleaned daily, very quiet and bed was comfortable. We walked with luggage to Termini train station easily and the hotel kindly held our extra suitcase in storage while we visited other cities until we came back for it. Wished the Wifi in the room was a little faster but it worked. Would have liked to stay here when we came back before we flew out but the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, different concept for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jackfromaz
Reviews.Content: We had two three night stays at iQ Hotel Roma wrapped around train visits to Venice and Florence. Both times we had large rooms (one had bath and shower, the other shower only). Rooms are minimalist in design-no frills, no antiques, no chandeliers etc. Basically all function over form. There is a great roof garden, very good breakfast (at 10 euros-a bargain), and the best vending machines I have ever encountered, There's a business center, small gym and sauna, self service laundry. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. On the negative side, the platform bed was futon hard, and your seating choices were a small desk chair and a backless rectangle with cushion that folded out into a single bed. Perhaps a quibble, but I thought it a little cheesy that there ice machines but nothing to hold the ice (you can buy plastic cups in the vender for 50 cents or use a plastic bag). Overall, the concept is not for everyone, but it was just great for me. I think it was the best hotel value in Rome. One other note: the hotel is near Termini Station, but a bit of a hike with suitcases if you have any mobility problems. Cab drivers at Termini didn't want to take us to the hotel on the meter because it's just a 7 or 8 Euro fare. We walked rather than pay the 25 Euros they demanded, but it wasn't easy

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS, FABULOUS, FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: GLANNEY
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a mother/daughter weeks vacation. Spotlessly clean, new sheets every day. We saw cleaning people all thru the day, cleaning everything! Breakfast was giant buffet with everything, including, the best moist scrambled eggs. Lots of fruit, pastries, meats/cheeses, different coffees and teas the list goes on and on. The breakfast area is kept filled even til closing - we arrived 5 minutes before closing one day and had a full selection. Outdoor breakfast and roof top area were great - a little chilly the week we were there. Hotel room was nice and cool with a/c on, which we needed due to asthma. Never heard any noise at all from other rooms. We faced the pretty opera entrance with it's palm trees, and heard no noise from the street either. The safe was easy to use, and fit our netbook and other important things. Refrig. in room was convenient. Especially appreciated the front desk, who woke us with 3 different wake-up calls right on time, and called for taxi's for us, which arrived in about 2 minutes each time. They were so pleasant, greeting us when we arrived each afternoon from a long day of sightseeing. Would recommend the car service to the airport, it was a new Mercedes, and the driver drove really safely, unlike most taxi's that we took. Really a great hotel where we got a good nights sleep, a great breakfast, felt safe, and near many sights.

Reviews.Title: “Pleseantly Surprised By this Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arianereton
Reviews.Content: Right away when we arrived in the hotel the atendants where very nice to us and explained to us everything we asked about the city, and because we arrived very early the room wasn´t available so we waited using the internet that is free in all the hotel. When we got to the room, it was all very clean, organized and beautiful, the bathroom was huge and very clean too. In the hotel we had a lavandery, food machines and everything we needed for a good stay, the localization was very good too, near everything, so i recomend this hotel for everybody who wants a good stay in rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and concept”
Reviews.Author: Myteen
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, informal, helpful staff, clean. There really should be more hotels like this. The vending machines are a brilliant idea and great value for money. The roof terrace is excellent for enjoying a glass of red wine, especially if you just want to relax in the evening and not go out. No worrying about sneaking in a bottle of wine. It's cheaper in the vending machine as is the water. The sound proofing is amazing. You cannot hear other guests at all. Rooms very clean. Great bathroom with big fluffy towels. Comprehensive and lovely breakfast. We took the round trip to the airport as offered by the hotel which was also excellent and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well positioned”
Reviews.Author: JBLEROUX
