Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 10 months old and encourages guests to bring in their own food.On 1st and 2nd and 5th floor there are vending machines for food and beverages as well as an ice machine.There is a liquor vending machine on the 5th floor with a rooftop garden with white benches and gas warmers.The wine was very well priced at 5 euro and moet&chandon 25 a half bottle.Excellent business centre and internet available at 9 euro for the whole stay.It is 30 meters from via nacionale with its excellent shopping and close to Termini Station and Republica Metro.We really had a great time and can highly recommend.We paid 92 euro for our room which was spacious compared to Hotel Roi where we stayed 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly, 'smart' hotel”
Reviews.Author: aspen15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at beginning of April. At first, weren't so sure about the room because ours was a bit smaller-limited space to walk around bed to bathroom, but not all rooms were that size. The hotel is amazingly efficient and utilitarian. It is modern, comfortable and really answers the needs of most tourists. Great location, near Termini Station, buses, and walking to just about all main attractions in Rome. Friendly, helpful staff. Comfortable, large bed. You can sleep late with dark-out shades and quiet hallways. Everything is self-serve but very high-quality. Good laundry facilities, business center (2 euro/hour!) and awesome roof deck to sit, sleep, read or drink wine from self-serve vending machine (that was a surprise) in afternoon after walking all day. Great breakfasts-all self- serve but delicious and great variety and quantity. This hotel is very intuitive in its design and it will grow on you--it offers everything a traveler wants. Our only complaint is that some walls are thin and you could hear voices from certain areas of the room. We never, though, heard noise in the morning or heard other guests leaving rooms like so many hotels. We would definitely stay again. Loved the IQ breakfast puzzles, too! A very clever hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, great location, and the staff was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: pdiva
Reviews.Content: I just recently went to Rome on a nice vacation and stayed at IQ Hotel Roma. The hotel was ultra chic just like I like it. I loved my room, it was a pretty decent size considering European hotels are known to be very small. I loved the location of the hotel, I was able to walk everywhere! It was only a 10-15min walk from the Spanish Steps area, a place I went to almost everyday. Also the hotel was around the corner from some great shopping, something I did alot of! And the customer service was amazing. The entire staff was always smiling, and very helpful. The next time I am in Roma, I will for sure stay at IQ Roma again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kimnjinx
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our 5 day stay in Rome after reading such good reviews on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. Lovely and modern, this hotel is in a perfect location. We walked everywhere during the stay and it was a 20 minute walk to the Trevi fountain/Spanish steps, 20 minute walk to the Colosseum and maybe a 30 minute walk to the Villa Borghese and Bioparco - and we walked fairly slow! There are lots of lovely low cost restaurants nearby too. The staff are always very helpful and the housekeeping was immaculate! With regards to the beds, they maybe slightly hard but this was perfect for me. The room was quite small but there was enough room for everything. The only thing i would say is that our room only had 3 small draws and 3 coat hangers, so there was very little room to place our clothes. Also the TV only has one english speaking channel - CNN, so we just ended up watching MTV Italia. I thought this hotel was amazing, but i think the hotel managers are starting to realise that too - upon looking at booking another holiday next year, it seems the prices have shot up! Seems like a once in a lifetime stay for us, but i thoroughly enjoyed it :)

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities but rock hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: EuroAtHrt
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in Rome to be wonderful. I had come from the US and traveled to London and Paris before arriving in Rome. Only packing enough clothes for a few days, I had planned on doing laundry in Paris which didn't work out. IQ Hotel Roma to the rescue! The self service laundry was a God send! I traveled with my mother and we had a huge room with one twin and one king bed, a large bathroom with a shower and separate bath, and great service. The 10 euro breakfast was well worth it. This hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Termini station and a 5 minute (or less) walk to the Repubblica metro station. It's also near some neat little restaurants and a McDonald's for Americans who need a burger (sorry, that's not me but I know some of you are out there :) The hotel also has access to other things that make sense (IQ is for "I think" - the hotel's management has obviously thought about what travelers need). There is access to a microwave if you need it in addition to the self service washer and dryer. The free WiFi is awesome if you brought your iPhone/iPad or laptop like I did! The staff was great; all spoke MANY languages. I speak plenty of Italian and also speak Spanish, but they were all completely fluent in English and I heard them speaking Spanish and French with other guests. My only complaint/suggestion for improvement would be for the hotel to add box springs to their beds. The beds seemed to be just a mattress on a wooden frame, and hence were very hard. I was exhausted and slept anyway, but it was almost as hard a sleeping on the floor. If they would update the mattresses, this hotel would be just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: yabutravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that's clean, modern and centrally located. It took us less than 10 min to walk there directly from Roma Termini. We got there earlier than 2pm (check-in time) and had to wait to get our room which was fine because we could leave our bags and get some food nearby. My biggest regret was listening to the lady at the front desk because she recommended an Irish pub on Nazionale to get some breakfast. What a ripoff! With so many restaurants and cafes around, she could have just suggested that we go to some local cafe for a quick bite. Kind of makes you wonder if they have some shady deal with the Irish pub. Other than that, our stay was awesome. We were on the first floor with easy access to the vending machines and the sauna room (used multiple times). The water pressure was fantastic and the bed was heavenly. Free wi-fi definitely a major plus. The new city tax (3 euro/person/night) is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: morningstar06
Reviews.Content: My friends and I really enjoyed our sightseeing trip to Rome and especially our stay at the hotel. Our stay at IQ Hotel Roma was very comfortable. Excellent rooms and fantastically clean, daily housekeeping was the best we have ever experienced. The breakfast was outstanding and worth the payment.

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jdenesemorgan
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mother, husband, and 13 year old daughter, we got two rooms. The service was impeccable, the staff catered to our every need. My mother and daughter initially had a double that was on the small side, and the staff worked tirelessly to get them a bigger room, which they achieved after three days, the hotel was booked, and we appreciated that fact. I liked the fact that hotel is small, it felt cozy. The bathroom was large and very efficient. My husband and I enjoyed the exercise room, which was small and efficient. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast, which was massive, and quite delicious. I usually don't eat much breakfast, but I appreciate the selection, so it was worth the 10 euros. The manager walked the halls of the hotel all day, every day, and oversaw the buffet as well. The hotel is centrally located, but somewhat off the beaten path, we appreciate the quiteness of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for seeing an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: LivLou
Reviews.Content: Great location. Extremely clean room. Have stayed in other hotels of this type (i.e. you only pay for what you use) but it worked so much better here than anywhere else. Staff great when needed. Four star facilities. Would definitely recommend. Nice restaurants nearby in Via Urbana as well. Particularly liked the self service alcohol vending machine!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Vikingscourge
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed in 2 triple rooms. Impeccably maintained and unbeatable location. I travel extensively for business and am VERY particular about the arrangements I make for family. This trip, intended to be a "once in a lifetime" experience for my family; the accommodations had to be perfect. Having spent an entire week in Rome, walking past all the hotel options I was presented with, before booking, there is no doubt in my mind that the IQ was by far, the right choice. il migliore!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: westfish
Reviews.Content: Our traveling party joked that the new concept at this hotel was: "we'll charge you more and give you less." No help getting bags into room. No drinks in the fridge. An irritating air conditioning system that kept us awake. An exercise room so crowded and stuffy I couldn't work out. Not sure what all the fuss is about. This was a real disappointment. Want a great hotel? Stay at the hotel diocleziano.

Reviews.Title: “Wow incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Sparklygurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply the bees knees! I absolutely adored my stay. Everything from the clean, relaxing scent wafting through the room to the exquisite quality of the toilet paper was just magnificent. Stunning. The hotel even provided FREE miniature shampoos and body washes in the bathroom. It was incredible! The only complaint I have is that the coffee from the hallway made my stomach slightly queasy and tasted like poo, but other than that I loved staying here. Keep up the great work guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheSternTom
Reviews.Content: The IQ hotel is an ultra modern very clean and fun hotel with great prices situated in the heart of Rome. The staff are super friendly and the services quick and efficient. The room is probably the smallest room I have ever slept in, however it is decorated in a modern deco style, pleasing to the eye carefully planned to make full use of the small size. The hotel has a wonderful roof patio and very affordable vending machines for anything from pizzas, sandwhiches to softdrinks and coffee. There is also a microwave on the top floor so you can heat a lunch and sit on top of the beautiful roof in comfort. Loved to come up there at the end of the day. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cristimarian
Reviews.Content: Super! Great location, clean hotel, nice room and friendly people. I gonna come back and i recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,Very clean; polite staff; good breakfast; smoking balconies”
Reviews.Author: annielovessimon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean; staff friendly, helpful and most speak English well. Rooms were of a reasonable size; very clean; fantastic easily controllable shower; also with seperate attachment; beds a little hard. If you are a smoker you will welcome a smoking balcony always open on each floor. Rooftop terrace, very nice; could be a bit noisy, but it seems that rooms have some soundproofing, as alot quiter with windows closed; air conditioning is not turned on until April each year, and we found our room to be too hot. Good location, close to two metro stations with easy access to all the sights. Good and very varied breakfast available. Only one tv channel in English available which was a little dissapointing ( news ch); the rest are all in Italian, except one wich i think is chinese. Overall would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “So clean and a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotless, both the rooms and the public areas. We loved the unlimited internet access in the business center for only 9 euro for our whole stay. Some very handy features including the microwave, rooftop courtyard and laundry. This hotel is in a great location also. We were able to easily walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Only time we needed to use the metro was to reach the Vatican City. The metro is about a 5 min walk away, and Roma Termini station only 10 minutes walk. The breakfast is also good value for money at 10 euro per person. We really liked this hotel and the modern design of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Stasnyc
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in hotel IQ I choose this hotel because of Trip Advisor. The best Part of the Hotel is Stuff Everybody was absolutely delightful and helpful. Second of all, it is clean, and I mean really clean, I love it! Breakfast is good The bad part: Room is small, very, very small, even for European standards You can’t even move. Second of all during my stay smell in my bathroom was horrible They try to fix but did not work. Plus I had few more small issues (I need to admit they was resolved In proper matter) What is really surprise me, after all this inconveniences and Horrible smells in my bathroom Hotel did not offer me anything (Right thing to do will be at least some discount). Not even a drink on the house. WOW this is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: diogenes57
Reviews.Content: The IQ Hotel Roma is perfect for those looking for a quiet, modern oasis in the beautiful but sometimes overwrought city of Roma. This is a very new hotel. The rooms are a nice size and very well but simply furnished, which we prefer. The bathroom was lovely. Unlike the older hotels, this hotel had ample electrical outlets which was very useful as my husband, son and I all had electric devices to plug in. And the wireless is free! The hotel is in a quiet location, but it is within walking distance of many key sights. The staff is extremely helpful. And the price was very reasonable. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “How all hotels should be”
Reviews.Author: L878765
Reviews.Content: Please can all hoteliers, everywhere, please visit this hotel? And especially other hoteliers in Rome and other Italian cities? Modern, stylish, functional building, beautiful design and fitting-out. Friendly, helpful, English-speaking reception and other staff who actually know how to smile! Facilities you actually want (like a microwave) rather than expensive facilities you will never use (eg pool or gym). Comfortable quite hard bed (as I like it); air conditioning that works and isn't noisy. Everything just thought through and executed with skill. What could be better? The black coffee from the vending machine was disgusting undrinkable muck, and given that there are no kettles in the bedrooms it's quite important that they get this right. Must do better. And very little choice of English language tv on the nice flat screen tv - I'd have liked the BBC or something like that. But they are small minuses in a sea of pluses. Well done all involved. Thank you. Keep it up. Build one of these hotels in every city, you will conquer the world. And, as I say, other hoteliers, visit and learn how it's done. Value, service and style can be combined - this hotel proves it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and although a good walk to sights. Quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: WorktoTravel69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at IQ after finding it in Trip Advisor and were generally very pleased with this hotel. The staff were friendly, gave good help with how to get around and maps. The hotel was immaculately clean including the bathroom which is something that always pleases me! There was free internet connection in the room. The air conditioning did not work because it was too early in the year and we ended up opening the doors but as the hotel was away from the main streets (next to the Opera) there was only a little traffic noise. Breakfast was not included and we only had it once on our first morning. There was vending machines for water and coffee at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fantastic city!!!”
Reviews.Author: twish
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in Rome, but our first at the iQ Hotel Roma! We could not fault the hotel at all, after arriving at the Termini station from the airport, the hotel was only a 10 minute walk away, located conveniently next to the Opera House so really easy to find! The hotel is obviously new, but it was also lovely and clean. The staff were very accomodating and happy to assist. We had a double room with a single bed, but the bathroom also had a separate shower and bathtub. The amenities were also good, vending machines with alcohol, drinks and snacks, but also machines for anything forgotten such as toothpaste etc... There is also a small gym and sauna, along with rooftop terrace to chill out on after a day of walking around the beautiful city of Rome! Like I said we really couldnt fault this hotel, it was great and we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SoulSabbatical
Reviews.Content: This very new-like hotel is a good place to base yourself when visiting Rome for sightseeing. Across the street from Opera House, the IQ hotel is very close to Termini Station and Repubblica station/piazza. We didn't spend much time there during the day and if you are looking for a hotel to entertain you (pool, etc.) there is not one here. But, if you are looking for a nicer, newer, very modern place to sleep and relax, this is a great place. Our room had a mini-fridge which was nice for breakfast foods and drinks. They have a wide variety of drinks and snacks in the vending areas and a nice porch on the top deck of the hotel. The area around the hotel has a few restaurants (I would recommend the Cotto a block over) and there is a small store to buy some food items (Carrefour Express) around the corner. People say the beds are firm; they are, but certainly not uncomfortable. They are the typical European firm beds with excellent quality of bedding, sheets, etc. Our room had a king-size bed which is not always easy to find in Europe. The bathroom is very nice. The rooms are small, but if you are only using it as "homebase" it is a very nice place to stay for lower budgets. Each room also has a safe. I didn't see any alarm clocks, though, so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regina85
Reviews.Content: Just back at the weekend - would really recommend this hotel, only a 10 min walk to Republica tube/Metro and 5 min to bus stop on main street and supermarket 2 mins around the corner. Hotel has everything you need especially the fridge, vending machines on most floors, smoking area on each floor and of course the outside area on the roof. OK the beds are a little on the firm side but this can be easly sorted just sleep on the extra duvet in the cupboard which makes it softer. Staff are excellent very helpful with directions etc. Rooms are spotless and a credit to the cleaning staff with bed linen and towels changed daily - possible downside is no kettle and hairdryer not powerful enough. Breakfast good choice self service buffet for 10 Euro per person eat as much as you like - really sets you up for all the walking which you will do around rome. Would recommend if getting a taxi back to the airport getting the hotel to book the private hire 45 euro fixed price as some white taxis may charge alot more. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “cant praise this hotel highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: kg60
Reviews.Content: this is a brilliant hotel in a great location. the service was fantastic, the staff were so friendly and helpful. bedroom was lovely,very comfortable and plenty of room with good storage and the added bonus of a small fridge in the room to keep drinks and food in. the bathroom was very good also with separate shower cubicle and very good lighting. on the roof of the hotel was a lovely sun terrace with was covered as it was march but even so we were able to sit out and have a few glasses of wine before we went out for our evening meal. all in all a great experience for our long awaited trip to rome and we would highly recommend iq hotel roma, we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Crgallen
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great hotel in an unbelievably good location very near to a metro stop and a short walk from Termini Train Station. The hotel staff was very friendly. My first night was spent in room G400. You may want to avoid this room as it is located under a metal stairway that provides access to a side street. Whenever anyone used these stairs, it would make a very loud banging sound. This definitely made it difficult to sleep. When I mentioned it to the front desk the next morning, they found another room for me right away. The hotel rooms were very modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the wireless Internet reliable. I look forward to staying at this hotel again the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: Davidj119
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a very central location. Very friendly and helpfull staff. alfresco area on the roof was really good, and a great place for a beer in peace and quite. prices in the self service machines were very reasonable, somtimes half the price than in the cafe/bars nearby

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djpcoyne
Reviews.Content: The IQ Hotel is in a prime location for sightseeing,close to the metro and the main train station.The staff could not be more helpfull and friendly,the room was a double with plenty of space.The breakfast was very good, eat all you want to keep you going until afternoon lunch.The only thing I was dissapointed with was the lack of English stations on the tv.All in all had a great stay at the IQ Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: HerefordshireSara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Booked on the basis of the reviews on Tripadvisor. The positive points about the hotel are that it is very new, very clean and in a good central location. We found all the staff we dealt with to be courteous and helpful. It is a 'no frills' hotel - rather like a Travelodge but with a higher standard of fixtures and fittings. On the not so positive side of things, our room (410) was unbearably hot, which meant it was not a pleasant environment. It is not possible to control the heating which was at a constant 25 degrees celsius. Even with the windows open all night we could not sleep well. This is a problem the hotel seems aware of but is struggling to address. For the final night we were provided with a fan and the option to change rooms. The room we were shown had a very small bed so we did not bother. On another point I was disappointed with the size of our room (and the alternative room we were shown). Reading the reviews here it is clear that some rooms are much more spacious than the two we saw, hence the very positive reviews written about them- it is worth bearing in mind that not all the rooms are spacious. I contacted the hotel in advance as my husband is 6 foot 5, requesting a suitable room. For whatever reason we were allocated one one of the smaller rooms with two beds zipped together - leaving very little floor space. In summary the hotel did the job and was good value for Rome. If I visited again I would probably go for one of the more established options and pay a bit more money. I would score the hotel 3.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a central hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyclatina
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had a pleasant 8-night stay at the iQ Hotel Roma. The hotel is located on a quiet street off Via Nazionale, near the Repubblica metro station and about a 10-minute walk to Termini station. The hotel is very modern in architecture (so if you're looking for a hotel with antiques, this isn't it). We walked everywhere (but the Vatican) from the hotel. It's about 15 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain and Colosseum, 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps, and 30 minutes to Piazza Navona at a leisurely pace. The rooms are comfortably appointed and were cleaned impeccably every day -- fresh linens & towels. I'll agree with other reviews that the beds are a bit on the firm side -- but I found this to be the case throughout Europe. Our room faced the Teatro dell'Opera which was nice. The room offered a wall-mounted flat screen TV (CNN is the only English speaking channel), a desk with chair, empty mini-fridge, a safe in the closet, mini-toiletries in the bathroom. It was great to have the vending machines which had 500ml bottles of water for 50 cents -- at least half price of anywhere outside the hotel -- and pretty good espresso/cappuccino/cafe macchiato for also 50 cents. The machines on the 5th floor had half-size bottles of Prosecco for €4 right by the door to the rooftop terrace. It was great to go up there after a day of sightseeing and just unwind. As mentioned, there's a microwave available, a small 24-hour gym (for those who really need to run on the treadmill) with a small sauna, as well as a pay-as-you-go business center with printing and faxing capabilities which I didn't use as the hotel has free wireless internet throughout. Tip: if you have more than one device you want to connect at the same time, ask the front desk clerk for an extra username/password. I did not opt for the €10 breakfast buffet during our stay as we're not heavy breakfast eaters and found that we were good with a cappuccino & croissant from the local cafe/bakery -- total of €3,60 for two. The staff at the hotel were really friendly and always greeted us when we entered and left the hotel. One day during our stay it rained cats & dogs so we decided to wait it out by reading our books in the lobby lounge -- we were there for 2 hours and no one bothered us. The front desk clerk was even nice enough to call the airport shuttle service for us the day before our departure to arrange the pick-up time. I would definitely stay there again should I return to Rome for the 4th time. :) Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved IQ Roma for our fist stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: katiered
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IQ Roma over a weekend in February with my boyfriend, sister and parents for my dad's birthday. We had 3 rooms booked and requested that they were situated near each other on a high floor and that exactly what we got, level 4. All our rooms had their own balcony which had a view over the Opera house and square, I think only level 4 had balconys, and the rooms were immaculate with large bathrooms stocked with shower gels, shampoo, soap and shower hats. We had breakfast everyday with was worth the 10euros, pleantly of choice and a good way to start the day with all the sightseeing that Rome involves. All staff were friendly and polite and gave us a good map to start exploring from (we did buy a map back home but ended up using they one they gave us as it was clearer). Location was excellent, walked to everywhere except the Vatican (although we did walk back from it...if your legs can endure the walking was a great way to explore the City) and the nearest metro was 2 mins away, really easy to use and only 1euro to get around. Lots of reasonable local restaurants to find just off the main road (to the left of the hotel as you come out), loved Riccis (i think was down a side street called via Geneva or something like that). The best bit though was the terrace with vending machines....so nice to grab a 5euro bottle of wine and sit out there before and after going to dinner. Its all enclosed so at night just grab the spare banket from the room, the weather was so nice we even managed to catch a bit of sun up there on our last day! This was much better than paying 5euro for a glass of wine in a hotel bar, and the vending machines had everything you could want at supermarket prices. All in all we loved our stay in Rome and the IQ hotel was the perfect choice for us. Book it you wont regret it.....I will be recommending to all my friends and family and when we return to Rome we won't bother to look elsewhere. Thank you IQ Roma

Reviews.Title: “super location ultra modern and good price”
Reviews.Author: stato42
Reviews.Content: friendly staff , nice rooms , ample breakfast for 10 euro surcharge. Convenient location to Termini Station and all major sites....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice accommodation with conveniences not readily found in other Roman hotels.”
Reviews.Author: burrflies8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IQ for 3 days and loved the location. It's close to the Termini which is great if you have to catch a train to other parts of Italy and it's also close to the Republicca subway. So getting around Rome using the subway is a breeze. The hotel is not right on the main street, so you will get a quiet nights sleep but since walking is to be expected in Rome anyway, the distance to the train stations are not unreasonable. It helps saves on the cab fare. We ended up walking to the Termini to catch a train to Venice with all our luggage with no problem. We are a family of 4 and got a room that accommodated all of us in it. Both my kids got their own beds which was great and it's definitely not easy trying to get a room in Rome that will sleep 2 adults and 2 teens. The beds are definitely firm and the room is decorated in a modular style (think Ikea). However, our room did not feel cramped, it was clean and the bathroom was spacious with the basics that you'd find in a hotel like hair dryer, shampoo etc. We had a refrigerator in our room and we were directly across from the laundry room. Soap is even provided in the washing machine and there was an iron/ironing board in the there. The vending machines are definitely a convenience and very reasonable. They have vending machines for wine and beer. There was another for snack, sandwiches , soda and water. Water was 50cents a bottle-half the price of what you pay for at the store. A sundries vending machine is on another floor should you forget your toothbrush, need a shaver or batteries. It even sells umbrellas which came in handy one rainy night and it was E2.50 vs what the vendors were trying to charge us on the street (E5). There's a microwave on the same floor. There's a small complimentary gym for those who need their work out fix. Free Wifi is available throughout the hotel and in the room which was a huge bonus when we need to do a little more research on what we wanted to do the next day. The staff was friendly and helpful and happily provided us with a sewing kit when we needed one. There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding area for lunch or dinner. Breakfast was more than plentiful and reasonable. It's approximately 15- 20 minutes stroll to the Colosseum. You may want to consider a 24 hr metro card if you plan on covering a lot of ground and the card can be used on both the subways and buses. It is activated from the time that you validate the card either on the bus (a yellow machine) or the train. The IQ hotel is not a 5 star property and it it will not be the right fit for you if you're looking for luxury, robes in the room with fancy amenities and having coffee in your room balcony while overlooking the Spanish Steps. However, if you are looking for a value 4 star hotel that offers you convenience, cleanliness and comfortable place to lay your head after a long day, IQ hotel is it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Patxy
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located, clean and tidy, staff friendly and helpful. I do not hesitate to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ellen020
Reviews.Content: The whole atmosphere of the hotel, from the moment you walk in, is bright, modern and cheerful. The breakfast (not included in the room price) was the best thing. It is served on the top floor of the hotel in a bright airy room with an open air terrace. The choice was very large, cooked food or deli, delicious fruit and so on. The room was small but comfortable with good lighting and attention to detail. The only hitch for us was that we could not turn the heating down at night and though we mentioned this, nothing was done about it. It was quiet at night, well -insulated though there was an inconsiderate boisterous group on one night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, great location! Would recommend staying at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria2812
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome and stayed at the iQ Hotel for two nights. It was perfect - spotlessly clean, the staff were very helpful, rooms were great, comfy beds, big bath - we had a balcony over looking the Opera House. Great location, within walking distance of the Termini station, lots of good restaurants and many of the main sights. The vending machines are a good idea with a supply of different coffee, soft drinks and snacks. We would recommend it without any doubts! Great value for money too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean and Well-Maintained Facility”
Reviews.Author: Jano121314
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Each and every one of them was pleasant and continually offered assistance. My room was relatively large, contained modern furniture, was well-maintained and spotlessly cleaned. The location was perfect for my needs; three blocks to the train & bus terminal, for easy access to just about anywhere in the city. The covered, open-air rooftop was a great place to relax and share stories and information with other travelers. The laundry facilities worked perfectly. I thought that the breakfast buffet was maybe slightly overpriced, but they did offer a fairly large variety of different items to suit the tastes of visitors from many different cultures, and it was very convenient. I love the fact that they offer so many things in vending machines, especially the fifth floor beverages. My only negative was that my room was located near a metal, outdoor staircase. There were a couple of times that people coming and going (dragging their luggage) made a bit of a racket at some odd hours. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: janieg22609
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel transfer perfect since we arrived in torrential rain and didn't have to hassle with trains or buses to the hotel, although they also are good services. Lots of local buses/underground (Republica) to the old city if you don't want to walk and a ticket cost 1 euro. Plenty of shops, street vendors. Worthwhile paying 10 euro per person for breakfast which is sumptuous - there is absolutely everything to eat and you can last past lunchtime on it. Much better than an expensive panini at a cafe. Restaurants are expensive so I suggest some more research where to go - we only spent 2 full days so it was neither here nor there but La Traveste district is meant to be better and the Jewish quarter so we heard. Do not eat at Piazza Navonna! The Spanish steps area is gorgeous and so are the shops. Would definitely use this hotel again and recommend it to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “new and nice”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: New and nice (or nice because new?) The first night and first room was a small room with a courtyard view. The second night and the second room was a larger room with a neighborhood view. The differenes were dramatic -- bigger shower, bigger desk, bigger room, view, balcony, functional towel warmer, etc. Internet free and fast! Thank you! Buffet 10 euro and excellent! Thank you! Vending machines as described and priced equal to the stores in the neighborhood. One obvious issue. The hotel is new and nice (and nice because it is new). The hotel is not necessarily well designed. Management need to be more responsive to issues both in the hotel and in the reviews of the hotel. I loved the second room but hated the first room. The shower and desk were too small in the first room, as an example. The shower head was much too high to adjust in both room so I suspect the step stool is provided to adjust the shower head. The shower leaked between the doors in both rooms. So we have high shower head, wet floor and step stool... The staff were very professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Hotel - Couldn't Ask for More!”
Reviews.Author: xsb
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and the iQ Hotel Roma helped make the trip fantastic. The room was perfect - clean beyond clean. The beds are firm, the towels are fluffy and gigantic and the staff is knowledgeable and helpful. What more could you want? We liked, but didn't love, the breakfast - 10 euros is probably a fair price though. The location is very good, near many of the city's treasures, but a fairly long walk to the ruins. We booked about four months in advance and at that time the reviews were good, but from what I can see the reviews just keep getting better - and with good reason. We loved the vending machines on each floor and had coffee and snacks several times for just a couple euros. Staff restaurant suggestions were good. There's a very good place just across the Teatro d'Opera plaza that we liked a lot. We would go back in a second and I wish this chain was in every city!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an unbelievable price for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: stuartharris
Reviews.Content: What a find! Booked this hotel after reading reviews on here and wasn't disappointed. It is very rare these days to find a hotel that matches your expectations but this really does! Everything is new and modern, very clean throughout and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is brilliant, you can walk to spanish steps, trevi fountain, colosseum, etc. The vending machine concept works well for snacks, water, etc even wine, all at reasonable prices. We only had one very small niggle which was the fact that the bed was very firm to the point that it effected sleep but even this wouldn't stop us staying there again....don't look at any other hotels, just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: 78Tally
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for 3 days, arrived from the airport with the hotel taxi service. First impression of the hotel, modern, friendly and very clean. Nice room with a very clean bathroom, nice bed an free wifi. Breakfast at the rooftop terrace is perfect. Also liked the high level of self service of this hotel, vending machines on every floor with everything you want during your stay. When we go back to Rome, the IQ hotel is our hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very very clean”
Reviews.Author: Yenifriend
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the IQ Roma. What a wonderful hotel. Very good value and the rooms are very clean with everything you need. The whole concept is very well thought out from the cheap vending machines to the buffet breakfast at 10 Euros. Good stay and would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concept .Highly recommended - felt like they'd thought of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Carolynj17
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights to 13 Feb2011 , and LOVED it - the hotel is clean modern & friendly, and very well priced, but with everything you need to take your stay at your pace. Our room was a good size, clean and well maintained and the huge bed SO comfortable I wanted to bring it home! The shower was really good too. There was a mini fridge and a free safe in the room, and a microwave available to use if you want to.Staff were all helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was well presented, had a huge range of fresh hot & cold options and was good value. The vending machines have a wide range of well priced nice wines & other drinks, nibbles, sandwiches etc. The smoking areas on each floor are discreet and dont impinge on non-smokers, whilst still making smoking guests as comfortable as possible. The enclosed heated roof terrace is a definite bonus and a cosy comfortable place to sit for that late night cap. Its in a great location too. 5-10 mins downhill from Termini station and comnfortably walkable to most of the big sights, and just downh the road from a metro station and bus terminus for the others. If you like really traditional hotels and being waited on all the time this might not be for you - but for us it was exactly the right balance with helpful people on hand to assist if you needed, but plenty of clear advice and faciltities to let you run your stay how you want it to be. We loved it and would defintiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a place - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBungle11
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect, from arrival to departure. All facilities were clean, tidy and the whole set up was so well thought out. They have thought of everything and do not let the style (eg; Self Service) put you off. I am normally a 'tough crowd' but this hotel and its staff cannot be faulted!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nicalver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Partner and his family for 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel at around 12:30, 2 of our rooms were already ready for us, but one was not. We were told that it would be around half an hour. We waited upstairs on the roof terrace with a beer from the vending machine - the roof terrace was lovely clean and comfortable. The vending machines have a large choice of different beers, wines and soft drinks and although it would have been nice to have a proper bar this was adequate. We also used the roof terrace in the evening when it was heated. Our room was ready by the time we went back downstairs and we were given a code for the wifi with our key. Our room was immaculate, the bathroom was lovely and the bed was comfortable and king sized. There have been some mention of similarities with travelodge hotels, and this is true to some extent - you get what you pay for, this is not a fancy 5* hotel, but if you like clean surroundings, in a good location with friendly staff at reasonable prices - this hotel is for you. There is also a safe in the room. There are vending machines on every other floor selling everything you might need at reasonable prices. The reception staff recommended 2 restaurants during our stay, and both were excellent. Byrons which is just at the top of the road and accross via nazional was also a good find for some nice food and drinks. The hotel is very easy to find from the termini station, 5-10 mins walk. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Trevi fountain, 15 minute walk to the Spanish steps and less than 5 minutes to the nearest metro (repubblica) we got the metro to the vatican (€1 lasts for 75minutes) We also used the 'citysightseeing open top bus' we used this on our second day and went to the Colosseum although in hindsight we could have easily walked it and it was a waste of €18 (2 day ticket) this tour only had around 5 stops and we didn't get our money's worth. There were several other tours that were slightly more expensive but seemed to run more often and have more stops. We took a tour around the Colosseum with a guide that was outside - this was €25 and included the entrance fee, the tour of the colosseum and a tour of the palatine hill. We used the same guide for a tour of the Vatican a couple of days later as he was pretty good. All in all we had an excellent time, we would definitely return to this hotel if we ever return to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - modern, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Can_Scotland
Reviews.Content: The room was large and very comfortable. The free wireless internet worked excellently in the room (and in the public areas) and I was giving a separate access code for my laptop and my phone allowing me to have both devices connected at the same time if necessary. This hotel is modern - the decor and furnishings are sleek, and they will appeal to you if you enjoy the uncluttered approach. If you prefer old-fashioned properties 'with character' you may find this hotel to be 'no frills.' Breakfast is available (it was included in my rate) at a buffet on the top floor. There were hot and cold items (eggs, sausage, cold meats, cheese etc) - and they were regularly replenished. There were always two or three staff members present. There's no restaurant for lunch or dinner, and there's no room service. However, there are some vending machines for purchasing snack items only. But, there are so many restaurants within a couple of minutes of the hotel that this was not a problem at all. The hotel is close to the main railway station. For sight-seeing I walked to almost every location easily except for a visit to the Vatican City - I took the metro (there's a station just around the corner). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected. I think they need more practice....”
Reviews.Author: CCScotland
Reviews.Content: The iQ is well situated, close to Termini and Via Nationale but very quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was excellent and served in a nice location on the top floor. But we couldn't work out where the four stars came from; the "bar" was a couple of bottles of liqueurs at the end of reception, there's no restaurant and only ever one person on reception so service was slow, slow, slow. They weren't able to give us two keys for a double room. Apparently, "Computer says no......" Pleasant enough but felt more like a Travel Lodge than a 4-star hotel. OK if you want somewhere predictable, but if you want 4-stars go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MurielA47
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic holiday in Rome. The IQ hotel certainly deserves its top rating on TripAdvisor. A lovely modern boutique style hotel in a very good location for sightseeing, the metro and Termini station. We had a lovely good sized room which was kept immaculate. The reception staff were outstandinly friendly and helpful (Albero and Melanie to name but 2) and nothing was ever too much bother for them. It's well worth paying the extra 10 euros for breakfast as it can be very expensive eating out. The self service machines are very handy especially the ones on the 5th floor where you can get bottles of water, wine beer and coffee etc and also snacks. We certainly wouldn't recommend eating in local restaurants as the prices can look reasonable but your final bill may come as a shock! We found this at the "Terme Di Diocleriano" on Via Virminale and one other place on Via Nazionale. Ask the hotel reception staff for advice, they recommended "Trattoria Il Tettarello" which was great with lots of locals eating there and proper Italian food. The business centre in the hotel is also very useful if you dont take your computer (the hotel has WiFi) and you can pay for unlimmited use. We also used Viator for our day tour to the Vatican and we would also highly recommend that company. We will certainly be back at the IQ and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decorate and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zacharenia
Reviews.Content: I think that is the perfect place to stay in Rome. Location is perfect for sightseening and shopping!! The rooms are modern decorated.Vending machines are there to help you drink your coffee and provide you with cheap water (0.5euro)at any time. Great value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choise”
Reviews.Author: 1ex
Reviews.Content: The best 4star hotel in Rome we have ever stopped. Modern, clean, quiet - no complaints at all to the hotel. The only "minus"- breakfast for extra charge. While in Italy I can not call it a minus (there are a lot of places, where you can have a meal to suit different tastes and budgets).

Reviews.Title: “Very good value modern hotel”
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reasons to book this hotel, depending on your needs there are also good reasons why it may not be suitable so do your homework first. It is modern , very clean, good location - easy walk to Termini where airport transfers come in, plenty of bars and restaurants close by . If you prefer walking they straightforward to walk to all of the central sights. The metro is close by to go to the Vatican or further afield, and once you work out the buses easy to get back to as loads of buses go to Termini. Once you have checked in the hotel is self service with vending machines on each floor. Good prices so not being ripped off. If you are not a fan of Italian coffee then take a travel kettle - also good if you want to make a cup of tea without having to leave your room. Fridge in each room which they encourage you to use for personal items. There is a Carrefour express a minute away which stocks everything. The breakfast for 10 euros was good value. Once you are out and about in Rome it is very easy to pay lots of euros for not a great deal! It can be very expensive. The roof terrace is available at all times and even in February was pleasant to sit out on. Free wi-fi, pleasant staff. Efficient maid service.Agree beds on hard side. Didn't use gym or laundry. Don't book this hotel if you want great views, staff to do everything for you, to be made a fuss of. I would book again though.

Reviews.Title: “a great time !”
Reviews.Author: 186337Anon
Reviews.Content: we had an excellent stay at the iq, the staff were very helpful and always welcoming. Well placed for all the sights and restaurants if your going to rome choose here !! we will be returning to the iq hotel

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Vibromm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful en modern hotel, rooms with the necessary comfort. Very friendly personel en helpfull. The prices of the drinks en food in the machines are economic. Is was also very quit at night. The breakfast was excellent and there was an enormes choice. Also the terrace was beautifull and nice to sit on especialy because the weather was so good in february. A fantastic hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: mfw08
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group for a weekend trip and to take in a rugby international. All the reviews are accurate. This hotel may not be for you if you want traditional 4/5 star service and ambience but the hotel is well located, spotless, the bedrooms are a decent size and the bed firm and comfortable providing a great nights sleep. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Thanks to Melanie who recomended a super nearby trattoria. The lack of a serviced bar was no problem as the vending machines provided a decent selection of drinks at very good prices and the roof top terrace was a pleasant place to enjoy a night cap. All in all a good choice for a convenient and comfortable stay when visiting this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “follow on for a few days after Irish Rugby match”
Reviews.Author: Colin55
Reviews.Content: Found hotel through trip advisor - not disappointed. Central location modern hotel. Very well planned and appointed. Staff could not have been more helpful. Breakfast 10-euro pp extra but well worth it. Out of season is the only time to come to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in the middle of bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: KiwiViajero
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel in which we stayed during our trip to ten countries in Europe. We walked with luggage from Termini station - about 10 minutes. We then walked all over Rome from the hotel - it's well located close to most tourist sites. The hotel is new and modern. Everything is clean and done to a high standard. Free Wifi in the room was welcome. There is also a laundry with a free iron and inexpensive coin-operated washing and drying machines. This was a welcome sight for all our clothing which needed a wash. The hotel is located in a street with little traffic - there was no noise at all. Just up the road is one of Rome's main streets. Restaurants and shops are just around the corner. The buffet breakfast was good. We would definitely stay here again when back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Herinhere
Reviews.Content: Chose this Hotel due. to the Trip Advisor reviews and we both really liked it, Thanks! Nicely designed modern Hotel. The friendly Staff all seemed happy to be working there! Our room was L shaped and a good size. Shampoo, bath foam and a shower hat were provided. We found the firm bed very comfortable. Had breakfast just the once and it was the usual buffett breakfast, had better and had worse. Nice breakfast room and the roof garden was great and the vending machines. If going back to Rome we would stay here again definately.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: r00ks786
Reviews.Content: With so much to see and do in Rome, the iQ Hotel Roma is the perfect base from which to explore it all. It was a 5 min walk from Termini station, and close to Via Nazionale which has some awesome shopping. The laundry room and vending machines are welcome extras in the hotel. The wifi worked like a charm, but please ask for more than one login if you have more than one device in your room. The staff are really friendly, espcecially Hischam and Valentina who were especially obliging to our needs. We arranged an airport pick up when we arrived, and had a stunning E class mercedes waiting for us on arrival! The price was really so close to that which the taxi charged that it really was worth it. Termini station was not as dodgy as made out to be, but it helps to be on your guard a bit more than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the city center.”
Reviews.Author: macnbactravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem! On a quite side street off a very busy street (Via Nazionale). The hotel is fairly new so it is very modern with lots of simple, but essential, amenities. The hotel staff was friendly and provided helpful recommendations. The hotel is close to the train/subway/bus stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perirhinal
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean and comfortable hotel in a very good location, very friendly and helpful service (restaurant reservations, taxi to airport, flexible check-out time), reasonable price, inexpensive vending machines instead of expensive minibar - in short: super! Breakfasts were tasty and generous (not included in our price package, 10 euro per person extra and worth it), and it was very pleasant to sit in the roof garden with a glass of wine even in winter. All in all, highly recommended. Please note that the room size is not massive, but my compared to the standard for 4* in Rome it was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cosy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: sigolg99
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff was very kind, and the vending machine and rooftop garden were wonderful. Every facility is very clean and new. My father especially likes the smoking place in each floor. :D

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Oldyzudu
Reviews.Content: V. good location. Pleasant staff. Aircon. is a bit noisy, at night. Breakfast, at 10 euros each, is good value, but stick to the cold buffet; meats cheeses; fruit and drinks. The 'warm' bacon and eggs are rubbish. We imagine the roof seating area is very pleasant when the weather is warmer.No tea/coffee making in the room, which was disappointing. Vending machines supply wine, sandwiches, etc., at v.reasonable prices. (Cheaper than the street vendors!), it's a bit impersonal, but, at least it's available 24/7. Rooms aren't big, but you are in the middle of a great city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: playdoh666
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the iq in a standard double room. When we arrived we had very friendly service we checked in then went straight out to explore... when we came back our room was ready and it was a good size double n the bathroom was great size too... the whole hotel was very clean and staff friendly. Being off a main road meant minimum outside noise too. You can walk anywhere from the hotel and we did bout 10 miles in one day. It's 5 mins from the train st too which was great for getting home. All in all a brilliant stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BNAUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Great location, clean, helpful. Well recommended. Rome though is ok. Not the best capital city i've been to, just ok. Needs a good clean, is expensive and the people can be ignorant, even at the Vatican ticket booth. Apart from the vatican, Colossuem, Roman empire ruins and a few fountains there is nothing to do. I would recommend two days max or try Berlin, Prague or even London first. There are beggars everywhere, never had a decent pasta dish, coffee is expensive and not to clever. Sounds a bit negative I know, but I would seriously recommend other european capital cities for your first trip to euorpe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: endsouz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely charming, clean and the service was exceptional. I loved the modern and intelligent concept of the hotel and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The location was great too since it was very close to a metro stop, a few minutes of a walk away from the main Termini train station and yet on a quiet street for some privacy. The room we were given was fairly large, extremely clean and comfortable. There are additional amenities on several floors like a laundry service, vending machines for food, wine and hot beverages. I would highly recommend people to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located new great bang for your dollar hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 05monaco
Reviews.Content: Staff that runs hotel were all, from the front desk to the woman that took care of our room to the breakfast restaurant folks, were the nicest people that made staying there a pleasure.The hotel is within walking distance to all the main sites and there is a separately run parking garage underneath for a fee. The hotel is fairly new and if you like more modern rooms, I don't think you'll be disappointed .Thanks again to the staff for bending over backward to make our stay most enjoyable .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jo_hearts_holidays
Reviews.Content: I was in contact with the hotel before arrival to organise the airport pick up and drop off. This was handled efficiently & a new mercedes turned up to take us to and from the airport - much less hassle than finding a cab when you arrive or trying to get the bus/train. It took about 20/30mins from the airport to get to the hotel and the staff at check in couldnt do enough to help. Our room was large, spotless & I really cant fault it. The vending machines are great and in the summer the roof terrace would be so relaxing. The location is perfect, you can walk everywhere in Rome (just wear good shoes and be ready for hours on your feet). We loved the walking part though and only a few times late at night after an evening meal did we get a cab back. I really dont have a single bad thing to say about this place, its so clean, friendly, convienient & the management have really thought of every detail to make your stay perfect. People have mentioned the beds are hard but I found them comfortable - yes, they aren't memory foam soft but I didnt think they were too bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-girl25
Reviews.Content: iQ hotel was as good as all previous reviews stated! Good location within walking distance of most sights (we walked to all except the vatican and this was with a 5month old in a baby carrier!) Provided cot at no extra charge. Vending machines great idea and microwave was great with baby. Only minor problems were used washing facilities and washing came out dripping wet (seemed to have problems with opening-even with staff assistance) and then even after they had been in the dryer for an hr still wet (although red hot - burnt hubbys hands!) A kettle would be a good addition - even if could hire one (keep in mind if taking bottle fed baby!)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and was very pleased. It is less than a 10 minute walk from Termini station. (Walk north a block from the station, turn left at the museum, walk about 6 blocks -past the opera house- then turn right onto Via Firenze. The hotel will be on the left. I found everything about the hotel to be first rate. The lobby is light and airy. The staff was very helpful. There is free wi fi throughout the hotel. The room was large by European standards. I did not partake of the breakfast but I did purchase some items from the vending machines in the hotel. I also used the microwave on the fourth floor to heat hot water for instant coffee that I brought along. The location is very convenient to rail and metro stations and buses and since the sites most tourists want to see in Rome are fairly compact, it is possible to walk to most sites from the hotel. There is an ATM (bancomat) right next door to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: danabentley
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel! It had awasher/dryer; play area for the kids; microwave; wi-fi in every room- FOR FREE!!! It was clean, spacious and an absolute gem. It was right near termini station and walking distance to the colloseum!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nandyssy
Reviews.Content: Great location - maximum 5 minute walk to the nearest metro/subway station. Free wifi (no time limit, coverage throughout the hotel); friendly staff; clean; new furnishings. I like how it's a pay if you use hotel - breakfast was all you can eat for 10 euros which unfortunately I only took advantage of on the last day. Food included cold and hot meats, cakes, sweet and savoury pastries, fruit, plus the usual bread, tea, coffee, milk and juice. Business centre is 2 euros per hour, but I got an extra hour at no charge without asking. I also prefer doing my own washing so the coin operated laundry room was just what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed !”
Reviews.Author: innes0
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, excellent location, so easy to find and only 10 minute walk from the train station. In a very quiet location however still in walkable distance from all the main places in Rome you would want to visit. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotlessly clean as was the whole hotel. The vending machines were excellent - extremely well stocked and well priced. the roof terrace was fantastic - something for everyone - relaxing, eating and for children to play. the decor was very sophisticated and trendy and all very new looking. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It made our stay in Rome very special indeed.

Reviews.Title: “is it a really a four star, or a five star?!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrdon43
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel, could not ask for anything else!!! Centrally located, a great value for money ( in fact when i was going to book i was questioning myself that it's too good to be true), a wonderful friendly staff with impeccable English speaking staff, great comfortable rooms and well clean...... and much more positive things!!! I'm being honest when I say that I can't find something negative during my stay!!! I FULLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. It's money well spent!!! When I'll visit Rome again, I won't hesitate to book a hotel, I'll go directly to the IQ hotel Rome. Just 1 tip - during your stay in Rome, use public transport if you're a foreigner, don't let it even cross your mind to hire a car!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Doesn't Fit in with Rome Ambience”
Reviews.Author: BeijingDB
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed our last night in the IQ Hotel in Rome. We had spent the prior two weeks traveling around Italy and stayed in a number of smaller hotels, including the IQ's sister hotel, Artemide (just around the corner from IQ). While the hotel was clean, the architecture is much too modern to fit in with the ambience of Rome and this spoiled our last night. There is personal value in ambience and after walking around 3000 years of Roman history, it is a jolt to return to a strangely colored blue hotel that looks nothing like anything you'd seen that day. The breakfast was just so-so and it was first hotel that charged for breakfast, 10 euros. The staff was helpful and WiFi connection was both excellent and free. Other than this though, it wasn't my idea of "the place to stay" while in Rome. I would recommend the Artemide over this hotel (even though more expensive) as it had more personal value to my family (we stayed in Artemide for 6 nights). But in fairness, the room was clean and bathroom big enough...just not my "cup of tea" when I think of Roman Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ammmazzzzziiiiinnnnngggggg....Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Romalover176
Reviews.Content: I never normally write review but decided to as I had the most amazing time in Rome....The hotel is situated near all the sites, & if your a walker you could even walk to the Vatican.... Rome itself is stunning so the fact we stayed in a nice hotel just made it perfect. It is great as you have a fridge so you can bring things from the local supermarkets. The rooms are very clean, the standard double is very small so if you can afford to upgrade...Do! The staff are very helpful especially Hicham, very nice guy, will definatley be going back. We loved Rome, so if you want a nice Hotel in a great location Pick IQ. See you soon Rome...x

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone - one of the best I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LornaScotland_UK
Reviews.Content: Great location - you can walk to everything and the metro is nearby if needed. Very helpful staff. Great buffet breakfast, suitable for all preferences. Large, clean and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: morgs54
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the IQ in late December. Very close to Termni and Republica train stations, approx 10 minute walk. Agree with another review, can really get to most of the Rome sights from the IQ by walking. Friendly service from the IQ team. Received a room upgrade so cheers for that guys! Went with recommendations from the front desk team for venues for a couple of our dinners and lunches. The places they sent us to we're a little bit of walk from the hotel but we're absolutely spot on. Much better than the random tourist places my wife and I punted with. Room and bathroom was well sized and very clean. If you don't like a firm bed, be warned. Happily, that's what my wife and I prefer. The rooms are very modern and have some nice little touches, like the free internet or the sign in the mini bar encouraging you to fill it up with your various purchases. Gives a very new, modern place a little bit of humour and warmth. Amenities are fine. I guess some people might not like the vending machines, the lack of a hotel restaurant etc. But for the location, money, room size and service there needs to be some small compromises. All in all, very place to explore Rome from. Everything is just easy, clean, close, well serviced. Couldn't really find a fault. Wish we had an IQ in my home town!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the hotel - except the beds!!”
Reviews.Author: duchessjenjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at iQ hotel Roma for 3 nights, over New Years 2010. The staff was very helpful, even before we arrived - arranging private car transport from/to the airport & dinner reservations on NYE. Location was great - about a 10 minute walk from Termini and maybe 20 minutes to Colleseo. There were also plenty of restaurants around the hotel. Room was nice, if a little on the smaller side. Our room overlooked the courtyard & the windows opened, which was very nice. We enjoyed the fridge in the room & the add'l amenities the hotel provided (laundry, vending machines, etc). Only downside to this hotel was the bed. It was very hard for our tastes. We had difficulty sleeping all nights we were there. With that being said, we would most likely stay again as the amenities, locations & staff far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “It was more than perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Wakad
Reviews.Content: Excellent,despite that the room was a little bit small

Reviews.Title: “We love iQ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDoubleR_11
Reviews.Content: Large room, nice and and clean. Friendly front desk service. Central location. My son loved the shape of the hotel - irregularly trapezoidal. Would like to see more English language channels on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless smart hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: deb0910
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. It is very new, exceptionally clean and has all the mod cons. Vending machines throughout the hotel provide snacks, drinks, sandwiches, essentials such as toothbrushes, combs etc. There are ice machines and a laundry with a single washing machine and dryer. We used all of the above during our trip. The staff were great and spoke excellent english. Lots of stores and restaurants close by and only a few minutes walk to the subway. Two things detracted from what was otherwise a wonderful stay. The first is that the hotel is overheated and the second is that the beds are extremely hard. If you are used to a hard bed, this may not be a problem, but for us, coupled with the hot temperatures, it meant uncomfortable nights and sometimes, little sleep. Overall though, I would still highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect and the room is clean and modern!”
Reviews.Author: BrownieR
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and modern. It is spacious for us - a family of four. The vending machine just outside our room came in handy where we could easily get our doze of morning coffee. The location is near the metro - very easy to get around! We enjoyed our 3-day stay there!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SueRPortsmouth_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hgotel because of the price but we would go back because it is simply a brilliant hotel and the best we have stayed in in Italy at this price. The hotel is modern, smart, clean and located in a quiet backstreet yet centrally located. The price was very good for a Rome hotel and the buffet breakfast was also the best we have experienced in Italy. The staff were very helpful and friendly and checking in and out couldn't have been easier. Our room was small, but we were aware of that when we booked and we had trouble sleeping because the room was too warm, but once we realised we could have the window open without being disturbed by noise we were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel with extemely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: emyles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the IQ for 12 nights and were very happy with the hotel. Our room was small, but very comfortable with a queen-sized bed, and adequate storage space for our clothes. The bathroom was roomy with great water pressure in the shower and a big sink with small shelves to place our toiletries. Two added bonuses were a hair dryer and big built in magnifying mirror. The staff were always very friendly and helpful and willing to speak Italian (when we wanted to practice) instead of English with us. We were also very pleased with the buffet breakfasts which consisted of several kinds of bread, cheeses, cereal, eggs, meat, and fresh fruits and vegetables. Unlike many other hotels in Rome, the IQ has a small gym with 2 treadmills and other machines, free weights and a TV. The location was also very convenient to the metro and the 64 and 40 buses. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lcsaggie
Reviews.Content: We booked the room with the 60% discount, which was a real deal in Rome. The rooms are adequately sized and kept clean. The staff is helpful and professional. The hotel itself is about a block or two from the Republicca Metro; a couple of blocks from Via Nazionale with a lot of shopping, cafes, trattorias, etc. We ate at several of the places including Al Boschetto on Via del Boschetto, 30. The breakfast was fine, but you can go to the grocery on Nazionale (Despar) and pick up items for breakfast and snacks, as they have a small refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing less than perfect!”
Reviews.Author: gdeli
Reviews.Content: This is a real 4 stars hotel, with a great location near Republica metro station. If you are planning to go sight seeing in the center do not buy the daily or 3 days ticket to all means of transportation, as the hotel is centrally located and everything is in a walking distance. We booked a double room 3 months ago, so we had a bargain price for 4 nights. The room was huge and spotlessly clean, with a mini fridge, flat TV, large bathroom, excellent super-double bed with really comfortable mattress, adjustable heating and a view to the Opera's yard! The vending machines have nearly everything you would need, from Moet Champagne to sandals, all in supermarket prices! There is also a free WiFi, but I preferred to connect via cable (yes, they also have jacks for RJ-45 connectors!) Everyone has mentioned it in their previous reviews, but I have to say that the staff was excellent, professionals always with a smile and ready to serve. They even printed our Vatican Tickets for free when I asked where I could print them. The only "disadvantage" that someone could find is that this hotel has no "roman" style, it is a little bit impersonal, but I don't think that you can notice that if everything else is just perfect! We will definitely book there again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: andrewrobins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights this week, on a trip to celebrate my partner's 40th birthday. We were very surprised when researching hotels on Tripadvisor to see this hotel so highly ranked, but so reasonably priced, so there was an element of "too good to be true" involved when we finally booked. However, it really did turn out to be that good. Everything was excellent from start to finish. The staff were very cheerful and helpful. We asked slightly cheekily for as nice and quiet a room as they could find us, as it was a birthday celebration, expecting nothing to come of it, but on check in were told that they'd taken note of this and found us a really good room - which turned out to be enormous, with a nice view over the square in front. The arrangement with the vending machines selling snacks, soft drinks and beer and (very reasonably priced) wine works very well, and we felt at all times like we had all bases covered. The location of the hotel is pretty good - ten minutes walk from Stazione Termini, and pretty well located to reach everywhere else in Rome on foot. We were there three days, saw as much as we can, and the only journey we thought merited using the Metro was to the Vatican. The room was spacious, comfortable, and well equipped. If i were forced to find something which was less than perfect, it would be that the double bed was actually two single beds pushed together, but that is so small a quibble as to be barely worth mentioning. All in all, really excellent, and will be recommending it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HUGOSILVA
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located, 5 minutes walk from Roma Termini "and 2 minutes walk from the metro station" Republic ". Rooms very comfortable and clean. Breakfast superb. The entire staff is fantastic. Surely I come back to Rome and will not hesitate to choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Innovative!!”
Reviews.Author: sklaa
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff!! loved the innovative vending machines for everything from umbrellas to wine and glasses!!...enjoyed sitting on the rooftop terrace in the evenings in very comfortable sofas and chairs!.........EASY BAR downstairs near the desk was so convenient for a quick drink/wine at a very affordable price.........OUr room had a great view of the square outside the Opera House....We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4 star hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Aviv39
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend with another rwo couples The staff were welcoming The hotel was ultra clean Facilities from a high quality Delicious breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good Location For Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: jandbsev
Reviews.Content: The hotel fully met our requirements - somewhere fairly central for sightseeing. Our bedroom was fairly small but very clean and quite sufficient, with excellent house keeping. Reception and other staff were professional and friendly. The buffet breakfasts (10 euros extra per person) had a wide variety of foods on offer, and were served in a very clean breakfast room. We found the small fridge in our room very useful for cold drinks and could be used for food if one wished. Because our flight was late arriving in Rome we arranged transportation from and to the airport, through the hotel for the 4 of us This was not cheap (129 euros), but it was there when we arrived and promptly got us to the hotel with the minimum of delay. Similarly, when we left, we were taken to the airport, through the Rome evening rush hour traffic in good time for our return flight to UK. If there is any criticism to be made. then it is that the bedroom was very hot at night, and the heating controls were not easy to understand - however an open balcony door was a solution.

Reviews.Title: “Well Designed Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Quattro4
Reviews.Content: The walls are a little thin and the hotter than comfortable room temp are the only negatives but the rest is great. Took a triple room and the space is amazingly huge; very functionally design and logically configured; clean & tastefully furnished too. It has very good lighting; bright but with no glare. Plenty of charging points for your phones, PCs cameras etc and spacious work space. The breakfast is reasonable at 10 euro but keep in mind you get what you paid for; variety & quantity is there but quality is a touch lacking. Service is fine overall. There's a Middle Eastern looking guy at the counter in the evening who is really helpful with our inquiries. Great service with a smile. It is located just 5 min to Republica Metro, but be warned, do not lug your luggage to this station from Termini. Much easier to walk straight from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: cowboy78249
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to Rome. The hotel is in a very convenient location near to the train station and metro stop (republicaa). The Hotel itself was very nice, very modern and clean. The rates were extremely reasonable for a 4 star hotel in Rome. The sauna was nice too.
