The breakfast was very nice and for 10 euros was worth it. The roof top deck was very nice and the vending machines offer water (0.50 euros), wine and snacks at very reasonable prices. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rome1083
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and located in a very good location in Room. The staff are nice and very helpful. It is 5 Star hotel location and service but we paid for 4 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept for Ancient City”
Reviews.Author: gregov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Thanksgiving Holidays, It met or surpassed all of our expectations! Great location, Friendly helpful staff. Only slight negative is that the breakfest buffett cost 10 euro extra. Overall I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect :)”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowkitkat
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed for 3 day, 2 nights.. The rooms are spacious, really really clean and have everything you need. The smoking areas were private and comfy. Loved it! The bed was big, I love a big bed, the mattress was tough but I like a hard bed but I don't know if thats to everyones liking but for me it was perfect. The vending machines were handy to some extent. They were good for snacks if you get the muchies, but not for real food. The selection of drinks in the vending machines were great and at a good price aswell, pretty handy if you want to take a bottle of wine to your room and chill out. We also bought an umbrella and a toothbrush from the machines. Breakfast in the morning is pretty good, a nice selection of food, all quite sweet food though and I wouldn't say its worth 10euros but its for convenience reasons. The gym is small but perfect and clean having everything you need, including weights. The sauna is personal :) prefect for a couple on their own. We had some trouble on the second night when we tried to use it, the hotel says its open till midnight but it automatically switched off at around 10.30, and they couldn't seem to get it back on. The 2 men on duty were really incompetent, but we feel bad for them more than anything, I think it was just a language barrier. Anyway, in the end, we settled for free drinks and he filled up each of our glasses with around 250ml of whiskey - can't complain really :) that was a good night! The location of the hotel is brilliant - you can actually walk around the whole of Rome all day without transport if you fancy it, you see alot more and find things that are not on the tourists maps. And a little pointer - don't take tours from anyone, too expensive and a total con.. I brought my mini laptop and you get free internet in the hotel which was great because it helped us plan our day browsing through Roman websites. Overall, the hotel was brilliant, loved it, couldn't ask for anything better - the staff are a bit slow but everything else is amazing.. and Rome is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “By the train station in Rome - can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: beachlvrca62
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a flight from CA to Rome, which was very long and we wanted something quick and easy after such a long flight so we took the train into Rome and then walked to our hotel around the corner - can't beat the location and the staff was very friendly and accommodating to us, which was refreshing!! We were leary of staying at a hotel near the train station as we read about other people who had problems with pick pockets but if you know what you are doing and don't flash your money, it's no big deal and we only ran into super nice and friendly people everywhere in and around this hotel... BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: Zoe6631
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. We booked the transfer to the airport through the hotel. We were met promplty and taken directly to the hotel. check in was smooth and efficient (our room was ready as soon as we arrived at 11.30am) the room was spotlessly clean with everything you would expect from a 4*. We were located on the first floor. The reception staff were very helpful when we asked for advice about getting to various places. We had the buffet breakfast everyday good selection of food started us off well for a long day sightseeing. All round brilliant service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gwilliger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and looks it. The elevator is normal size, the room had all the normal amenities you'd expect in a good hotel although space everywhere was tight. The TV had CNN, the A/C worked, the bathrooms were OK with the obligatory bidet They have a rooftop deck that's great with machines serving pretty good wine for 6 Euro for a normal sized bottle and couches to laze around on in the evening. The internet was free (with your laptop) and service from the front desk exceeded all expectations. The only downside is that it's a bit pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night and Rome. It was in a very convenient location. The Hotel itself was incredible, very modern and clean. The rates were extremely reasonable for a four star hotel and newer hotel in Rome. The roof top deck was very nice. Also, the vending machines offer water, pop, wine and snacks at very reasonable prices. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, highly rec”
Reviews.Author: keenslouise
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel for a long weekend and it was absolutely outstanding! I didn't want to return home! We stayed in a standard double room (119) That was very clean and smelt fresh and welcoming when we arrived. The room was of a very nice size, comftable large double bed and massive bathroom complete with a lovely shower and bath aswell as a bida, large sink and clean toilet. The gym and sauna was just outside our room which we used serveral times. No one was ever in there so it was nice and relaxing! Lovely view from the double doors in the room aswell. Our room was cleaned on a daily basis, clean sheet, fresh towels and replinishment of shower cap, soaps etc. The attention to detail was remarkable. The hotel has a roof terrace aswell as a veranda on all floors which you can go out to smoke. I very much enjoyed taking drinks and chilling out there at night. The vending machines offer everything from the alcoholic drinks to sandwiches and light refreshments as well as hot drinks (the hot milk I would highly rec) at very resonable prices. This hotel is in walking distance of all the main attractions to. The staff were friendly and helpful, they stored our luggage away on our last day after checking out and even offered us to stay on until 1pm at no extra charge. It was a fantastic hotel in the centre of Rome and had everything you could wish for there. I will definetly be going back

Reviews.Title: “IQ Hotel for for smart travellers”
Reviews.Author: richa_9
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel that we stayed at for three days prior to leaving for a cruise from Civitavecchia. Hotel and rooms we were in were newly renovated. Modern in decor and tastefully designed. Washroom was very clean and rest of the room was perfectly adequate. Would recommend to my friends and family, and would definitely stay there if ever in Rome again. Pleasant and helpful people at the service desk as well. All nine of us were very happy with our rooms and stay at the IQ.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: gkacky
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Termini station, although we did not end up utilizing the train. We arrived from the US about 10am, and, we were very pleasantly surprised when we were able to check in upon arrival. This was a wonderful way to start the day after the long flight. We were able to freshen up and then headed out for a day of taking in the wonderful sights of Rome. Since we were trying to make the most of our short stay, we requested a one hour extension on our check out time the next day, which the hotel graciously accommodated. Upon check out, the front desk notified us that our port limo had shown up (30 mins. early) to pick us up, but, left when we were not in the lobby. We gave the front desk the limo company information, and, they were able to get in touch with them and get them back to pick us up. Our stay at iQ Hotel was short, but, quite pleasant, and we would definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: osulucan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. 10 mins from Termini. Friendly staff and lovely clean hotel. Would definitely stay here again and reccommend to others. vending machines are great value, mini fridge in room for you to use. Lots of coffee shops close by with lovely yummy coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: anett2010Budapest
Reviews.Content: we came back from a trip to italy and we stayed at the iQ Hotel. We reserved iq just a few days ago and reading some reviews my husband was a bit scared about air conditioning but we slept there 3 nights and our room was perfect, everithing worked properly. Brakfast was great and at a reasonable price. Reception desk open 24h with a good staff, always present but not intrusive. Everything seems to be for an indipendent kind of traveller. I will certainly come back there.

Reviews.Title: “great savvy hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: kadub
Reviews.Content: for the price, was a great stay. brand new facilities, super clean and helpful front desk. with wifi. rooftop garden was very nice and rooms were kept in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: hatchervian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and has so much to offer, the vending machine idea is a great idea and very reasonably priced. We actually ended up going to the SPAR which is just around the corner(on the main road) and brought food and wine from here though. The roof balcony is lovely, although a little chilly in the winter months - but still nice for some fresh air. Our main problem with this hotel was the extremely thin walls, our first room was postitioned by one of the vending machines and everytime someone brought something we could hear the whole process. We also had some chatty neighbours and could hear all of their conversations. On our 4th night (we stayed for 5) our room was extremely hot, so much so that we could not sleep. We rang down to recpetion and they gave us a fan. We spoke to the management the next day and were informed that this was something to do with the heating being put on for the first time and the position of our room. The manager was brilliant and had us moved into a new room straight away and also gae us a free breakfast as an apology, we were very impressed with his dealing with this matter. However our new room was postioned on floor 2 and was by the front of the hotel, everytime someone walked past our room (on the metal grates right outside) it sounded like someone was walking on a fire escape right outside our bedroom window. The hotel is in a great position and if you are lucky enough to have quiet neighbours, not be near a vending machine and on a high floor then I imagine it is wonderful!!!!! If not, be prepared to get little sleep. Normally I would have happily stayed in this hotel again but both my husband and I felt that the lack of sleep had an effect of the enjoyment of our time in Rome and therefore on our return we will stay somewhere else. A great hotel, great staff, great price, great location - shame about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Rome would not look anywhere else in future.”
Reviews.Author: Maggip
Reviews.Content: Great location. Less than 10 minute walk from Stazione Termini. Room we had on inner courtyard so quiet would not think you were in such a bustling city. Modern facilities in ancient city.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Victoria10017
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveler to Italy and to Rome, I relied on Tripadvisor to get hotels and found iQ Hotel an ideal location and also, price-wise. I booked in September when the hotel reviews were still few since it had just opened. By the time I was traveling and days away from my arrival to Rome the reviews have increased and true enough, the hotel ended up one of the best places I have stayed in through the 2.5 week trip. The rooms are big, bathrooms more than sufficient. The hotel crew were very assisting and I really believe it was a smart way to run a hotel. No, I did not feel nickle and dimed. As a matter of fact, when I needed museum reservations to be printed they simply asked me to forward it to their front desk and picked it up the next morning with no cost to me. Their in-room bar remained empty for guests to have the option to stock it with items that they can purchase either from their vending machines or from outside. The items in the vending machines ended up cheaper than if you got them from outside (a bottle of H2O inhouse was 95 cents while outside I had to pay as much as 2 euros! They had coin operated washing machines on another floor, in case any guest had the time to spare to wash their clothes prior to going home (no I loved wandering around Rome and didn't have a minute to spare to worry about my laundry!). The bed was very comfortable and I have had a very restful sleep even on my first day when I was flu-ish. The crew were very attention, especially Resty who helped with my luggage when I first arrived and was very cheerful everytime you saw him. Everyone was helpful with recommendation on restaurants within the vicinity but bring a block away from Piazza della Repubblica, the source for food was limitless. Truly a gem in the city and I would definitely love to return to Rome and return to iQ hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location- no frills”
Reviews.Author: paui_14
Reviews.Content: location was fantastic. walking distance to most of the sights in rome. no need to fear the mini-bar charges as they have vending machines all over the place. At the grocery a bottle of water will cost you .29 cents, at the hotel .50 cents - in outside kiosks - 2 euros! the rooms was nice and clean but the central airconditioning was turned off because it was winter. we had to open the balcony doors a bit to let the cool air in. free wifi is the best! :-) near republika mrt and termini station. my tip- take the roundt rip transfer they offer at 90 euros if you are a group of 2-4 people. we made a mistake of trusting the train which cost 15 euros each (so that's 30 already one way/ 60 both ways) but the mrt station was under construction and we had to lug around our 20kg bags up and down the stairs int he termini station (no lift and escalator geez!) so painful and tiring! so we took the 45 euro one way trip to the airport and arrived relaxed and rejuvinated! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: skmtravel
Reviews.Content: Spent a night there late Oct, 2010 with my wife. We really liked the hotel. Great location, close to tourist sights as well as Termini. Very professionally run,. Good sized rooms. Stylishly modern appearance. We located/selected the hotel based on recommendations here at TripAdvisor, and it certainly lived up to our high expectations. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the savvy traveler...”
Reviews.Author: tntom64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for seven nights and enjoyed the benefits of many of the perks highlighted in the other reviews including: - free internet access (though it is a pain to re-sign in EVERY time you lose / reacquire the signal!) - cheap water and soda at the vending machine on 5th floor - laundry service (2 euro to wash, 3 to dry (but count on a double shot for the dryer unless you have a very small load or all nylon clothes) - close proximity to Termini and Repubblica Metro stops, bus stops a block away from hotel on Nazionale St. Lows: - Biggest gripe is breakfast. Food (eggs, bread, meat esp.) was suboptimal, juices tasted very "processed" and the louder-than-really necessary video channel music was a bit annoying. - If you decide to take them up on the garage parking for your car, expect to pay 45 or 50 euro per night! - Hot water nonexistent the first night we were there. The "maintenance" man was the bellhop who gave me a shrug and a wave as he backed out of the room with no answers as to why it wasn't working. (Next morning it was fine as well as the rest of the week) - Workout room is HOT. Probably because of the sauna right next to the machines! If you can swing it, go for the "triple" room (pardon the pun) even if there are only two of you. You will really appreciate the extra room, especially if you are there for a few days. All in all an enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One Major Problem”
Reviews.Author: WombatTraveller
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were super pleased with our choice. We were early but our room was made available. The hotel is close to central station and an underground line. It is new, stylish and provides excellent amenities. It's refreshing to see a hotel show common sense and provide an empty fridge, and then have self service vending machines with a variety of drinks and snacks at 'non hotel prices'. The rooftop area was pleasant and the internet access reasonably priced. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. So why the low rating....the airconditioning. This has been noted by a previous reviewer and we had the same problem. The system used by the hotel did not respond well to the change in season and our room was uncomfortably hot. we were forced to sleep with our window open and the hotel staff provided a portable fan. We made a complaint to management after the first night which was professionally handled and treated with concern however the bottom line is that the system was malfunctioning during our entire stay, which meant we didn't get a good nights sleep any night, particularly the last night when it was warmer. If you cant get a good nights sleep, regardless of the reason, then this needs to impact the rating. If not for this, we would have rated 5. I raised the issue again with management when we returned home to Australia and they acknowledged the problem again and offered a free stay should we/family/friends return to Rome. I will compliment the management on the way they handled the problem throughout, albeit they were unable to fix the aircon. during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: InVinoVeritasEtAmor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on a business trip in November. I've stayed in a number of hotels in Rome and there are only 1 or 2 that I'd go back to regularly and this is one of them. PROVIDING... they keep the price-point around the same and the quality of the hotel remains. I have no issues with the concept of this hotel, it seemed to work perfectly OK for me or at least my requirements. The vending machines are good 0.50c for a bottle of water for example, rather than the 2 or 3euros in other hotels. The room was a great size. Most the hotels I've stayed in Rome have pokey little rooms and awful, garish decor. I like the new-ness, modern and stylish design of this hotel and the rooms and I was lucky enough to get one of the larger rooms. Service was very nice, efficient and polite. I thought the breakfast was more than adequate. Loved the location of it, on the roof of the building. The combination of the location, style, price and overall comfort of this place makes it a winner for me. If you're into a more 'luxury' hotel with room service and the extra thrills you MIGHT get in Rome, then this is not for you. If you want something slap-bang in the middle of everything then again, you might want to consider things. But then again for all those, in Rome, you have to pay for it.. and this is why I like the IQ, it comes in a very reasonable rate for Rome. NOTE: usually I arrive into Rome Termini station from Fumicino airport. It's 14euro and saves on traffic. I exit from the station onto Via Giovanni Giolitti and there's usually cabs there waiting... but they are pirates... They always try to charge 20euro, 25 and this time I was offered 28euro!!!! to go 5mins away on a ride that should be about 8euro. I know what you're thinking, why not walk if it's so close, but you know sometimes you arrive you have suitcases to drag along bumpy Roman streets. I'd pay 10euro for a cab to drop me around the corner, feeling lazy but 28euro is taking the p*ss... My suggestions are; 1. exit out onto the front of the station and check with the cabs there 2. walk out of the station onto one of the side streets and find a hotel and ask them to order a taxi 3. Weigh up the costs of a taxi from the airport vs this aggro 4. walk from the station (as I have done), cursing the taxi guys PS they're not all like it across Rome but this part seems to be a regular occurrence

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean, reasonable price! love it!”
Reviews.Author: travellerr1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in iQ for only one night and i wish i planned more days in this hotel!! First of all, the walk from termini station was only around 7 min...and walking to trevi fountain was around 15~ It's a very modern hotel and it's clean! i had a 3 single bed room and it has a little balcony over looking the opera place. The bathroom has one standing shower and ALSO a bath tub! spotless clean....my friends and i walked to all the floors just to see what they offer. they have self laundry, microwave, vending machines selling cold and hot drink for super reasonable price (2 Euro a bottle of water in another hotel i stayed in vs. .50 here!) and they also have a vending machine selling wine and cups, and they have wine opener right next to the vending machine for you~ The only thing is that we stayed on the 2nd floor and left the window open so we could hear the car on the street when we sleep..that bothered one of my friend~ so ask for higher floor or close the window if that bothers you. when we left to the airport, we asked the hotel to arrange car service and the driver was there promptly with his benz. Again, reasonable price...hope i remember how much it is exactly...around 45 euro i would say~

Reviews.Title: “There should be a chain of these right round the world”
Reviews.Author: seawife
Reviews.Content: A bright new modern hotel, centrally located, great price, and lots of conveniences. Being able to wash and dry your clothes, buy something to eat or drink (hot, cold, alcoholic) from vending machines at incredibly cheap prices make this hotel a weary traveller's home away from home. From the check in staff - efficient and friendly and speaking several languages - to the rooftop garden area - we just felt able to relax completely. And breakfast was magnificent. Continental and cooked Western, plus beautiful fruit - peaches the size of softballs. I don't think they realised how much the laundry would be used - another couple of machines might come in handy. But we didn't even have to pay for laundry powder. It was all included in the three euro wash.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui06
Reviews.Content: When we initially arrived they said they had overbooked so there was a bit of confusion but they were very professional and sorted it out quickly. The room was modern, clean and everything worked. The hotel is done to a very high spec with lovely efficient shower and big double glazed french window -the hotel is situated on a side street off the main street and is unexpectedly quiet. The mattress was incredibly comfortable and breakfast was great with everything from eggs and bacon to fruit and yoghurt and we liked the IQ tests they used as your place mats every morning. Very helpful with tourist info and the sauna and roof terrace were great. truly great value for money here - no wonder they were overbooked.

Reviews.Title: “The kind of hotel that everyone likes to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: lactmama
Reviews.Content: New modern hotel, ten minute walk from Termini Station, good service, you get an empty fridge and are encouraged to fill it, Microwaves on various floors. Do bring you own electric kettle. The staff is very international and a lot of fun. I spoke with a number of guests and we all agfreed that we enjoyed being in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lov_2_travel_10
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel - clean, modern, friendly staff, central location, and safe. We walked from the Repubblica station at 10:30pm and had no problems getting to the hotel; it was less than a 10 minute walk. The next day we walked to all the high points in central Rome from the hotel - it's a great way to see the city. They advertise 'tempurpedic' beds, and I'm not sure this is true since I own a tempurpedic and it did not feel like the same material, but it is memory foam nonetheless (a very hard memory foam that was a little too firm for me, and I didn't sleep great). If you get the small room, be prepared - it truly is small and pretty much only fits the bed. My husband and I had 3 carry-on size suitcases, and we barely fit in there with all the luggage!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pinky_pudge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at Iq Hotel Roma and it was excellent. It is in a prime location for exploring the city you can pretty much walk everywhere from here, but if you don't want to walk the metro station is just around the corner. We stayed in a small double and the rest of our party stayed in a triple. Our room was perfectly sized for the two of us, contemporary decoration, clean and everthing brand new. The room was made up everyday, on the days when we didn't get up so early we would put out the "do not disturb" sign, and take it off after we left and our room was cleaned when we got back. Our bathroom was a good size with a nice shower and clean, soft towels. The triple that the rest of our party stayed in even had a nice sized bath. On the 1st night we had a problem with our inroom safe so we reported it at the reception and there was someone at our room to fix it before we even got back! The staff are always on hand to help whether its something to do with the hotel or you want a table booking at a restaurant. The amenities on offer are very good too. On the 1st, 3rd and 5th floor there are vending machines selling hot drinks for 50cents, bottled and canned soft drinks from 50cents and snacks from €1. On the 5th floor there is also a vending machine selling alcoholic drinks with lager from €2.50 and bottles of wine from €4, very reasonable when you will easily pay €5 in most bars and restaurants for a glass of wine! The roof terrace is comfortable and clean and open 24hrs. The 4th floor has a further machine selling toiletries and other bits and on the first floor is a well equipped gym and sauna. You can get breakfast for €10 at the hotel, its buffet style with fruit, cereal, bread, meats and cheese, but also serves scrambled eggs and bacon! I would definately recommend this hotel and would use it again if we go back. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: bps75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the IQ Hotel Roma for a two night stay in Rome. The room was very modern, clean, and stylish. The bathroom was very nice as well. The hotel offered all types of amenities - business center, gym etc as well. We were on an almost 2 week trip and this hotel was the nicest we stayed in during our travels. The staff were wonderful - always very helpful. The location is fairly central. We walked everywhere - including from the main train station when we arrived. If you arrive in Rome by train, be sure to save the money on a cab and walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff, some minor problems but overall great”
Reviews.Author: amuro
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel 4 months ago, I was a bit skeptical as it was still brand new and there weren't much reviews and was not even in the top 10 list, but before I left to Rome, I found out that our hotel was ranked #1! The staff at the hotel was really friendly, every time we walked by they would acknowledge us. This is my second time to Rome and this hotel was located at a central location near Republica station (I recommend going to this one over Termini if your destination is on that metro line), Rooms were clean and there was vending machines everywhere which was convenient. The beds were a bit hard as both of us find it a bit hard to sleep through the night without tossing and turning and waking each other up. The free wireless internet was very slow and we got disconnected alot and some areas in the room the wireless would not work. We had our "do not disturb" sign/button on that day and we did not want our towels changed or beds made. I usually put valuables and clothing aside if I want our room cleaned. But that day we didn't feel like we needed it so I left everything laying around (including socks, undergarments). However when we came back to the hotel, our room was cleaned and beds were made. So the do not disturb sign was ignored. The other thing was we booked a private car from hotel to airport for 52 euros as our flight was on Sunday morning at 6am. We were under the impression that they will bill us when we checked out and we spent most of our cash and carried only 30 euros with us. At the time of the check out, I asked the hotel staff and t hey said we have to pay the driver directly and t he driver did not take credit card, only cash. The driver did not speak english but he drove us to three different bank machines before we could find one that worked. IT was a last minute panic as we had to catch our flight while trying to find a bank machine that worked at 4am in the morning to pay our driver. Other than those minor things, our experience at the hotel was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a place that is reasonably priced, clean, friendly staff with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 2305steve
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with the IQ Hotel Roma. From the location which is close to The main train station and subway line to the roof top garden for relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Staff was always there to help out and give direction. The rooms had everything you would expect and they offered a Great breakfast. Perfect place to rest and explore Rome from.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and service with clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very close to Termini station and walking distance to many sites. Staff are extremely helpful and attentive. We were upgraded as we arrived a little early and our room wasn't ready. Room was spacious, very clean and hotel facilities were fantastic. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Average overall, but failed with the details.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavinUSA
Reviews.Content: I booked IQ Hotel in July, and was excited to see the ratings go up on tripadvisor before our arrival in October. At first glance, it seemed like a lucky find, but after two nights we are ready to leave. Why? Just to name a few: 1- IQ will nickel and dime you for everything (ex. we asked for an ice bucket, being that there are ice machines on two floors, and were told they had to ice buckets but to buy plastic cups from their vending machine for $1). 2- Although new, our bathroom tub/shower was clogged, safe didn't work, and one pillow had stains on it. 3- We spent most of our days and nights out in Rome, but on a rainy night we decided to stay in with a bottle of wine and take out with the tv. Unfortunately, our tv did not work nor did anyone know how to fix it. Plus, the walls are paper thin and we heard a baby crying two doors down for the majority of the night. On the bright side, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, as I am sure they are trying to over their butts for the inadequate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary to make the most of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cghillary
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here a few weeks ago. And while not an inexpensive place, it was a brand new hotel, with lots of great amenities. Within walking distance of most of the big cites, or just a few blocks from the metro. The neighborhood felt very safe. Our room had a view of the inner court yard, and was very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveladyc
Reviews.Content: The Rooftop Garden for gathering with freinds, the Vending Machines (with wine and beer at grocery store prices), the clean modern rooms, the location just off Plaza de la Republica where you can get the Metro made this the perfect hotel for our group of 7 couples traveling together. We look at over a 100 different hotels and this one was the lowest price with the best amenities. Free Wireless too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whoatemyling
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent! The hotel is very new and modern, the hotel is clean and the room was clean. No bugs, or dirt underneath the bed. The balcony was a plus. The bathroom was large enough for both of us at the same time and contained enough towels. The bum cleaner in the bathroom was an experience... The bed is a too firm for North American standards, that was the only down side. If you're expecting North American sized rooms, be prepared as these rooms are standard European/Asian sized (quite a bit smaller). The hotel staff was very helpful in all aspects and spoke very good english. They were always smiling and seemed please to help. The fact they ran 24 hours was also nice plus. The wireless internet is pretty flaky and requires constant reconnection, be prepared and bring an ethernet cable to wire into the high speed internet instead. The rooftop terrace is a nice way to end the evening, you can purchase a bottle of wine from the vending machine (between 4-6 Euros) and sit back and relax on the terrace. The location is very convenient if you are taking the metro, it is a 2 minute walk to the Repubblica station and 5 minutes from the Termini station, my recommendation would be to walk 2 minutes to repubblica to Termini if you're taking the Red line anywhere, as the Red line in Termini is a nightmare to get down to. There are a number of food/restaurants close by and all within walking distance (the gelato store on via torino, close to via nazionale is worth checking out, the nocciola [hazelnut] is very good). All in all, the hotel is definately worth the #1 spot on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Book it”
Reviews.Author: UKhol1
Reviews.Content: Having spent some time looking at horrible chintzy hotels in Rome, I was delighted to find the IQ hotel on trip advisor and changed the dates of my trip so I could stay here. The hotel was modern and clean, although in my opionion on the cheaper end of modern (but I've stayed in a brand new vegas hotel recently, so it's possibly not fair of me to judge it on those standards) The beds were a tad firm, but sleeping wasn't a problem as the rooms were lovely and quite, I didn't hear anything from other rooms above or any noise at all from the corridor. The hotel is in a central located and has an amazing roof terrace. The breakfast at 10 euros was very good value and the breakfast outdoor area was a bonus. All staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: randstyr
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the IQ Roma since our reservations at another hotel were canceled -- and we were VERY glad things turned out this way! It is a great hotel. Everything is very contemporary and clean. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. The room was furnished very nicely, and was comfortable, functional, and "user-friendly". If we get to Rome again, we will definitely stay at this hotel. The location was good too. The only unusual thing was the interior courtyard, which (I assume) most rooms look onto -- but it looked kind of cold and uninviting. But that is such an insignificant aspect (especially when compared to all the other great amenities), it shouldn't deter anyone from staying at this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: l0ckie
Reviews.Content: A lovely comfortable hotel with great attention to detail. Welcoming, friendly and efficient staff. always on hand to be of assistance. We would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would want...”
Reviews.Author: heather1ee
Reviews.Content: Rome is a great walking city and the IQ Roma Hotel was convenient to everything (Trevi, Colosseum, the Forum, restaurants, shopping...although a hike, we even walked to the Vatican). Additionally, everything is new and spotless. The beds were firm, but I like them that way. The front desk receptionists were friendly and helpful. The roof top deck was a great place to have a glass of wine (that you could get from the vending machine). Or, there was even a little grocery store just a block away. Excellent choice! (I traveled with my husband, mother and father and we all enjoyed the hotel very much.)

Reviews.Title: “oasis”
Reviews.Author: 2010wanderlust2
Reviews.Content: After a very long travel day from the west coast of Canada, we arrived at the hotel mid-morning and amazing enough they had a room ready for us. What a gift. We spent the whole day touring Rome to return to our hotel to freshen up and go for dinner. The breakfast was beyond what we expected and fueled us for another long day of sightseeing. The day ended with us being very tired and so we picked up some supper food and headed to the rooftop terrace to finish the day under the stars. What a peaceful spot. Great service from all of the staff! The only negative would be that the beds are very firm. Location was great, less than 10 minutes walk to the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel / location just ok / nice staff”
Reviews.Author: revengeofaone
Reviews.Content: Termini location is good for train access and metro, but not the best location in town. Everyone was friendly, even if some simple questions got a crazy look or two. Just go with the flow. You may even get lost in the interior courtyard. Ha ha silly customer, you are trying to enter our business offices?! Don't you know where that door leads or how to get back? It's not really marked! Ha ha now you do know! Oh yes that elevator is for employees only, haha, you must have missed the little sign on it! Ha ha, this is Europe, the exit is on "0" level, not 1... The rooms were new and clean. The showerhead was at a strange angle coming from the side which required a strange glass protector so you didn't spray the rest of the bathroom...and climbing into the deep tub was a bit awkward. Laundry: 2 euro for a european sized load in a high efficiency washer (soap included). 3 euro to run the dryer, or 0 euro if you use the tub clothesline. No washcloths, but this is Europe I suppose so i guess you are supposed to lather up with your hands or use the ubiquitous butt towels by the bidet. Typical deep Geberit brand Italian toilet. Your poop may splash you from its depths. You may smudge the sides of the toilet which despite the Niagara falls-like strong flush, cannot overcome the geometry of the Italian toilet and the physics of the horizontal ledge and steep precipice of the Italian toilet bowl. You may require the use of the poop cleaning stick or the butt towels. Marvel at the horizontal shooting bidet and wonder how exactly it's supposed to help. One day we didn't receive new butt towels or hand towels, but a few euro tip solved that issue. Breakfast not included. I think we paid more than others, but the place was filled. Supply and demand I guess. If I ever return to the Eternal City...I would go back to this place. The terrace on the roof was excellent 5 or 6 euro buys you a bottle of wine from the vending machine. The breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Knightfamilyphoenix
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We were told by other reviewers that it was a real pleasure. We agree! It was modern, clean, great service. Front desk personnel were first class. They knew many languages. Great location to transportation. Walking took ten minutes to bus and train terminal. Subway less than five minutes away. Breakfasts in hotel were very good and everything was very clean. If i would change anything, it would be that the beds were european firm. A little softer beds would be nice. When we go back to Rome, We will stay there again. Many restaurants close by. Walking distance to many sites. All the staff was very polite and helpful.. Roof top balcony was a nice addition. We had free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: mfernandezcpa
Reviews.Content: We booked IQ Hotel back in June 2010 for our stay 2-night stay in September 2010. We did not find any ratings at the time but the pictures and the description sounded good, and there was something that made us trust them. Well, our expectations were met! The hotel was perfect and the staff was super professional and nice. : ) The hotel is new. The rooms are not super spacious but have everything you need. The bathrooms are very clean and the room offers nice size closets. Good size beds, a buit harder than US beds :) but I still slept relaxed and was good the next mooning. The hotel has a modern/clean look. It has vending machines with sodas and snacks at very good prices, laundry room and a rooftop terrace to have breakfast in the morning. The breakfast is 10 euros per person-we did not try it as we left early to go sightseeing and ate on the street cafes for a cheaper price. Overall, was great and we ended up getting another room for our last night in Rome when we got back from our roadtrip.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype. Recommended unreservedly.”
Reviews.Author: golsonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night on September 6, but it was enough to make this hotel our favourite of a long trip around Italy. As the reviews all say, the experience is great from the off. We arrived early, but the reception phoned up housekeeping and found us a room that was ready. The room was large (for a city room) with one of the nicest hotel bathrooms I can remember. Good wi-fi signal. Vending machines means you can get snacks and drinks either for the room or for the roof terrace. The hotel is near enough to the station to make it an easy walk, but far enough to avoid the scruffiness. Slap bang next to the opera, and just across the square from a good restaurant called La Matriciana. Overall, can't fault it. I guess prices may rise as it becomes established.

Reviews.Title: “One word : Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: goyjuilim
Reviews.Content: I walked pass to this hotel and decided to stay here, just for 3 nights. This hotel is approximately 5 mins from the termini and it is good for me as i didnt rent a car, so i depend mostly on public transport. The beds and rooms are top of clean quality, very comfortable and the room service is like 24/7 you need anything the recetionist will help you really quickly. The breakfast is cheap and satisfying, Anyway, since other reviews said too many things about this hotel, in short , it is a awesome budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam715
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, nice large rooms, modern feel and amenities, lovely new bathroom with bath and separate shower cubicle and lovely terrace that's not crowded (most of the time, we had it to ourselves). Nice staff and good location, 15 mins walk to Spanish Steps and Republica tube station only 3 mins away. Could find no fault. Taxi from Fiumcino 45 Euros. Book early because this truly is a fab hotel near to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lindha316
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a gem in ROME! We were scared to book this hotel at first because it was very new but to our surprise, it was awesome! The staff were friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay, (even gave us an upgrade). The best part about this hotel is the roof top terrace, we were there most nights after our long walks around Rome. Instead of going out to a restaurant, we bought take out and grabbed a bottle of wine from the vending machine(provided by the hotel) and relaxed there to the weee hours of the night, also met some great people that gave us tips about Rome. I highly recommend this hotel, the location is also great because it was right by the termini (train) station.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh ideas and great service”
Reviews.Author: nbdoc
Reviews.Content: Wow! Finally someone dared to break away form the traditional style in an old part of Rome in favor of a thoroughly modern design and high tech amenities, and combine it with the attentive, very personal service. The location is reasonably good, if you don't venture towards the railroad station (which is ugly in every single city I've visited), but the other side provides access to Republica with subway connection to Vatican, Spanish Steps and Barberini/via Veneto, and buses to elsewhere. Via Nazionale has lots of shops, and there are plenty of restaurants around. Opera is next door (literally). Rooms are very large, comfortable, with nice beds, lighting and bathrooms. Very fast free Wi-Fi in the room (their internet provider plays a big brother, though, blocking some web sites, which mistakenly prevented me from accessing one of my work-related sites; that was annoying). The breakfast is very good in quality and variety, and could be had on a rooftop veranda or indoors. If you arrive by car - make sure to request a permit from the front desk, because they are in a limited traffic area. Parking garage is 2 blocks away, but it's not cheap. Overall - this hotel was a fresh breath of comfort and relaxation at the end of our 8 day trip around country, and I will call them first next time I am in Rome. Unfortunately, their introductory sale will end sometime, but at this time it was a great value and a great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Prefection ! Our number one !”
Reviews.Author: Betimoli
Reviews.Content: We came here as part of our Europe trip. And iQ seems to fit on what we are looking for which are clean, good rate and comfortable. == What we like about this hotel :=== Frankly, all aspects of the hotel : multi-lingual staff. They are very friendly and attentive. Location is superb - just around the corner from busy Nazionale and also many restaurants nearby. Excellent cleaning of the room. The rate was alright, the cheapest hotel during our whole european stay ( about $100p/nite) ! == What we don't like about this hotel == Almost nothing to mention. Perfect for a trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern remodeled hotel, decent location near Termini”
Reviews.Author: europa00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel three nights, with 4 friends. We had 3 rooms, were all located together on the same floor, next to each other. After first night, room was not cleaned, as apparently there is some mystery do not disturb button in the room. Upon reporting the concern, the hotel quickly delivered fresh towels to us though, and the room was made up the next day. The room was a bit small, so there was not a good place to put the second suitcase, unless you unpacked and put the suitcase in the closet. Breakfast was good, and wished we had eaten the day we checked out as we got to termini and realized McDonalds' didn't have any breakfast food. Vending machine upstairs that I think was supposed to have the beer/wine was empty with a sign to check downstairs, but we really only were buying water, which was priced at 50 cents, so a great deal, since the next hotel vending machine in Milan was 2 euro. Internet access didn't work consistently. Would however definitely stay again if this continues to be priced competitively in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here in Sept 2010 and had a...”
Reviews.Author: andrepaulGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2010 and had a wonderful stay. Hotel is very modern and new which is hard to find in Italy without paying a small fortune.The hotel is in a great location just around the corner from Piazza Della Republica and only a 10 minute walk to most attractions. We chose the double room which, while comfortable and smartly designed, was a little small for us so would recommend choosing a larger room. Inclusions like a laundry to wash ur own clothes ( which was a great help after 2 weeks of traveling ) and free wifi along with the friendliness of the staff made our stay in Rome very pleasant. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The iQ Hotel, a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pyramid66
Reviews.Content: I had recently spent a few nights in Rome in a quite distinguished hotel. I enjoyed the stay at the iQ hotel because of the many reasons that make this hotel really different from others in central Rome. The concept of the iQ hotel is to keep the room price as low as possible while providing the customer with a very good level of comfort. For example, the hotel doesn’t have a big restaurant or an expensive bar but instead an array of vending machines that provide the guests with all they need at prices that are even cheaper than the shops. There were laundry machines for a few Euros instead of an expensive laundry service. There is a fridge in the room that I was able to put drinks and light food items without being embarrassed of walking through the hotel lobby carrying plastic shopping bags. I didn't have my laptop with me although there was a free WiFi service but I was able to check my emails in the well equipped business centre for a few euros. There is a huge roof garden equipped with drinks machines of nice Italian wines and beers, snacks and sandwiches. The hotel was very modern and very nicely decorated, the room including the bathroom was spacious and comfortable and also quite which is a big plus considering being in such a noisy city like Rome. The bathroom had basic essentials like shampoo, soap, bath foam and a shower cap, anything else was available at the iQ shop across the corridor for a few coins. I fully recommend this guest oriented hotel to anyone who visits Rome and wants to enjoy a central, comfortable and not a very expensive stay in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: colingeddes
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here at the start of september the hotel is brand new so it is in perfect condition. the staff in the hotel are very helpful on our last evening we arranged an alarm call and asked about ordering a car to take us to the airport the staff arranged for a mercedes benz to take us which cost only 45 euros 5 more than a taxi at 40. the vending machines in the hotel sell wine for about 6 euros a bottle,beer 3 euros they even had smirnof ice and various snacks and sandwiches these could all be enjoyed on the roof terrace which was very tastefully decked out with seating there was also a small kids play area which i saw 1 kid using when we were there. There is a small gym and sauna on the 2nd floor with some free weights and cardio machines. the location of the hotel is ideal its on a quiet street just of one of the main streets through rome you could easily walk to all the major sights or there is a metro station just up the hill from the hotel the metro was safe and clean and easy to use 11euros for a 3 day unlimited use ticket. i will go back to rome and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: damandatcan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is approximately 5 mins from the termini but don't let that put you off. I stopped for 5 nights in September, It's brand new,spotlessly clean and in one word AMAZING!! The staff cannot do enough to help you, the roof terrace is great (and dirt cheap compared to the prices around town), breakfast is cheap and satisfying, and the beds and rooms are top notch. Not much more I can add that other people haven't already said on here, but if you get the chance I highly recommend this hotel to stop at

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, clean, modern, quiet and in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Moski49
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was modern, clean and quiet with free wifi. Although the hotel did not have a restaurant but a full breakfast was served every morning on the roof level which had indoor or outdoor seating. There were vending machines that had food, beer and wine at good prices. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the terrace one night after going out for dinner. There are several great restaurants nearby. The metro station was about 3 blocks, a 3-4min walk. The main termini was also a short walk. The coliseum was about a 15min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Thank GOD there's a hotel like this in Rome for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: scintillater
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th hotel we had stayed in during our stay in Italy. It's in a convenient location, it's very new and trendy, and a decent price. The rooms were modern, spacious, and the bathroom was spacious and very modern as well. Service was friendly and prompt and their command of English was great so it made it easy for travelers. The only thing I'd improve on is that they don't have hair conditioner in their bathrooms, but do have shampoo and bath foam. *TIP they have a private car that you can book to take you to the airport if you want: $45. it's an E class Mercedes which is a nice alternative to the train or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: VangrooverKits
Reviews.Content: We loved iQ Hotel in Rome. Exceptionally clean and beautiful modern room with thought out details like lots of space to lay out suitcases. Stunning, huge bathroom with both bath and shower stall and loads of fluffy towels. Wi fi and air conditioning both worked very well. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only downsides were no pool, and some early morning noise from a child playing in the hall once. It is perfect for a family with older children. We can't wait for them to open worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdo47802
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly renovated, well kept, and clean. Rooms are small but nice, even if the mattresses are a bit hard. The staff was friendly and did their best to be helpful. They have a really nice business center, but for some reason the internet always seemed to be down for the 3 days that we were there, which was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme75
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, friendly knowledgeable staff, spotless rooms, great location and great price. An interesting concept for a hotel; but I don't care that a city centre hotel doesn't have room service or serve anything other than a breakfast. It has free wi-fi and beer and bottles of wine can be purchases from vending machines on every floor. I highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find- Best hotel of my trip in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea22_10
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how we stumbled into such a great little hotel during our stay in Rome, but what a fabulous find. We were immediately impressed with the quality not only of the hotel, room, decor etc. but also with the superb staff! The front desk staff were always friendly and willing to be as helpful as possible. The location was excellent, within walking distance (less than 10 min) to Termini, and 5 min walk to the Metro, Republicca. Located just off of Via Nazionale (major road with shops etc) the street was very quiet, and away from a lot of the hustle and bustle. We found that not many people (taxi drivers etc.) knew about the hotel yet, but we would just mention the Opera and they would immediately know where. The breakfast, though not included 10 euros, was excellent and we were sure to stock up on the fresh fruit, eggs, yogurt, juice to help us start our day. The rooftop patio was a great place to relax after a long day of sightseeing, and the very reasonable vending machines provided everything from water (50 cents!) to full bottles of wine, beer, coolers. The mini-fridge was also a great convenience to have in the room, as we went to the little grocery store behind the hotel and stocked up on snacks. IQ Hotel Roma was built with convenience, and self-service in mind. With laundry machines, free business centre/wifi, workout room, rooftop patio, ice machine, vending machines all available. We were in a double room, which was spacious enough, had a easy to use safe, flat screen tv, comfortable bed/duvet, and very clean and modern decor. The only problem with the IQ Hotel Roma is that when I recommended it to my parents for their upcoming visit to Rome- it was fully booked!! Word is definitely spreading about this fabulous little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BrandonNewton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the IQ hotel while we were in Rome for 3 nights. I could not be happier with the room, the quality of service, and especially the value. During August which is the height of the tourist season, we got our room for such a low price that I don't even feel right disclosing it. Then on top of that, the hotel staff were so nice to give us a free upgraded room. Our room was very large, very well accommodated, and our glass doors/windows opened right out to overlook Teatro Del Opera De Roma from a small balcony. Our breakfast, though not included in the price of the stay, was delicious. They have everything from cereal to eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, fruit, deli meats and cheeses. They also offer a very nice selection of fresh juice. We loved the red orange juice. On top of that they have an amazing coffee machine which will make anything from an espresso to American coffee, to a cappucinno, and more. Very tasty as well. They do not have room service or a restaurant or a bar on site (they do have an easy bar), but they do have some well stocked vending machines. My favorite of course was the vending machine with all of the beer and wine. You can buy a full sized 6 euro bottle of some great tasting wine (Castelli Romani), or you can buy several other wines and beers. The hotel also features a roof top terrace which is really nice for hanging out with friends or reading a book any time of day. There isn't a view from there though. The location was pretty perfect. Very close to the train station which will take you to the Vatican and several other attractions. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum, and is close to restaurants and other attractions while being just far enough away to enjoy some peace and quiet. I can't think of the name of the restaurant off of the top of my head, but if you cross the street from Teatro Del Opera and walk away from the hotel, the first restaurant on the corner is pretty delicious. I had my doubts, but my wife convinced me to eat there, and they had the best pizza I tasted in all of my stay in Italy. I would suggest getting a Roma Pass, and seeing all of the sights on foot without a tour guide. The tours tend to rush you through areas you'd prefer to spend more time in, or spend too much time in areas that seem of little importance. Plus it's immensely cheaper if you do it on your own. The Roma Pass doesn't cover the Vatican though. I suggest buying a "skip the line" ticket in advance online. Again, I wouldn't suggest taking the tours. Just be sure to see the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica. If you have several days in Rome, I would recommend dedicating at least one entire day, if not two, to the Vatican. Also, be sure to get the panoramic view of all of Rome via the glass elevator. I forget the name of the Palace that has it, but the hotel staff can help you find it. In conclusion, I absolutely loved this hotel, and I would certainly recommend it to anyone I know or don't know for that matter. Enjoy your stay, and enjoy beautiful Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem - no-nonsense, modern, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: uniboy02
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon so it was important the hotel was great. We are not fans of fancy hotels that provide facilities you never use, so IQ Roma seemed to fit the bill as we simply wanted a good, clean room at a fair price to use as our base for sightseeing. Frankly, however, we were delighted with all aspects of the hotel. Friendly, multi-lingual staff. Excellent cleaning of the room. Lovely 24 hour roof terrace with a self-service bar that offers great selection at unbeatable value. Rome is very expensive and this hotel breaks the mould for value. I never thought I'd write such a glowing review - if you want no-hassle, clean, modern hotel which leaves money in your pocket for the important sightseeing/eating out, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “It's all good when its new!”
Reviews.Author: shez12
Reviews.Content: I really don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. It was the cheapest hotel during our whole european stay ($93 AUD p/nite) and it was the best hotel we stayed in! We booked the hotel on its first opening week and did have some doubts then because we couldn't find any reviews ~ boy were we surprised to find this plush gem! Booked a small double room and it really is not that small - normal good size. Lovely modern furnishings and with great aircon throughout the whole establishment. Great concept of the vending machines as well ~ and good prices (especially the ice-tea!). Great facilities, gym, wifi, breakky, vending machines, upper terrace area, smokers courtyard and even free ice! (although probably best to provide ice buckets next time). The bed was cleand and comfy, shower had great pressure and staff were very helpful. Location is superb - The entrance is actually facing the opera; just around the corner from busy Nazionale (great street for shopping and theres a supermarket too), restaurants nearby, metro repubblica about 5 min walk but yet also quiet because its on a small street. Would highly highly recommend this hotel for Rome stays!! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA+++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Concept”
Reviews.Author: mang0jam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Italy doing a three centre holiday where we started in Rome and stayed at the newly opened IQ Hotel. What can I say? This was a fantastic hotel with a wonderful concept of having vending machines rather than room service. A microwave was also available for those who wanted to heat up food and the hotel positively encouraged its guests to go to the local supermarked to buy food and then eat upstairs on the lovely roof terrace which has extremely comfortable furniture in it. The rooms were extremely clean and it was possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The breakfast was of good value and those vending machines - was that not the cheapest water in Italy that we bought during the whole holiday? The staff were friendly, the location was great - all major tourist attractions either accessible by foot or accessible by the very good bus service nearby. I loved this hotel - I wish more were like it. I would highly recommend it to anyone considering a holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bdamsel81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the IQ to kick off our 12 day Italy vacation July 22-August 2, 2010. We booked the hotel through their website as they were giving a huge grand opening discount. Even without the discount, the hotel would be completely worth it! It was within walking distace from the train station and was easy to find. The hotel was in perfect condition and the staff was overly helpful. We were able to check into the hotel and get a room at 8:30 in the morning, receiving a free upgrade! They also give you a password for free wifi in your room. Our room was on the 3rd floor and looked out over the street. The beds were the hardest of our entire trip, but all of the amenities were A+. It's a close 5 minute walk to the Barberini Train Station and the staff gave wonderful recommendations for places to eat. We even found a little liquor store around the corner and bought a bottle of wine to share on the rooftop terrace one night. The only downside was the 12 euro per person cost for breakfast. We skipped it and bought croissants every morning while heading to our sights, and saved money! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visitng Rome. It was the best hotel we stayed in during our trip!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jooona
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have found this hotel before it opened so we immediately booked it and got a good deal. The hotel is top-notch! Staff were friendly and courteous and very helpful. Room was clean and super comfortable. Having a self-service laundry in the hotel is a big plus. And we love the free wi-fi! Already planning a second trip and we're definitely staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fan-frickin-tastic”
Reviews.Author: imnotadt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in July. Cannot fault this hotel at all . The room was bigger that expected in the centre of Rome and was close to the station and the metro line and there is a carrefore market just behind, which was great as we didnt buy the breakfast so we just got it from there. The hotel has vending machines to give out snacks and there was an alcoholic vending machine that was a bit broken and gave us double what we'd paid for....amazing!!!!! Free wifi, computers to use, a small gym and sauna, and a lovely roof terrace to sit of an evening with your free alcohol. It was clean & tidy and the staff were lovely and friendly and did everything they could for us. I'd definitely recommend you to stay here as it never took long to get around rome and especially as it was cheaper than a lot of the other lower star'd hotels! If we're ever back there again, we'll def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: WalterNewYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Rooms are modern, clean and spacious with Flat screen TV, nice bathrooms, good lighting and well working air conditioning. I had a family of 5 with three teenagers so we had 2 rooms adjoining – a double and triple. The triple room was exceptionally large. Both rooms had a balcony overlooking the Opera House. Free internet (through private kiosks located in the business center), exercise room, and laundry facility are nice extras. Loved the self service vending machines located throughout the hotel providing moderately-priced drinks (including water, soft drinks, wine and beer), snacks, and sandwiches. The self service roof-top garden area is a great place to relax and have a late night drink or snack under the stars. Staff was extremely polite and helpful. All spoke fluent English. Good location in Rome’s center. You are a 15 minute walk or short taxi ride or bus ride from most of Rome’s major attractions. The hotel does not have a restaurant or room service, but there are plenty of places to eat in the area. They did serve breakfast, however, my plan did not include breakfast so I cannot comment. I did not have a rental car, but parking appeared to be difficult. Great value for the money. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is seeking a modern, clean, high-quality hotel in Rome’s center who does not need the amenities of a restaurant and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: hopskipjumptravel
Reviews.Content: iQ Hotel Roma is a new hotel with great facilities, located within walking distance (maximum 10min) of Roma Termini station (where you can also catch the A (red line) and B (blue line) Metro). The metro lines will take you to points of interest in Rome (Colosseo, Spanish Steps, Vatican, etc.) We arrived from Zurich and were happy to find iQ Roma quite easily. Service at the front desk was exceptional and they were helpful at every occasion. Hotel was exceptionally clean and the large room was also immaculately clean. Sauna and fitness facilities are available free of charge to guests - a bonus if you need to work off a few pizzas and all the bread and cheese. I recommend running in the early hours through the streets of Rome over the treadmill. This allows you to appreciate the Vatican etc without the large crowds. Breakfast buffet is available upstairs for a cost of 10 euro per person. Very decent breakfast. Vending machines with drinks at very good prices. Complimentary wireless and business centre is also available. If you ask for a restaurant at the front desk, they will recommend that you go to one in particular. While we found that this restaurant was ok, we had better meals at other places - That's Amore (near the Trevi and there is also one conveniently located around the corner from iQ, though we did not try this one) and Strega (we went here twice, pizza first time was great, second time was average). If you are looking for a comfortable, clean, convenient and affordable hotel in Rome, I highly recommend iQ Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: Veejnas
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the reviews this hotel is well located, clean, had good facilites and the staff are all really nice. The hotel itself is about a 35 minute cab ride from Rome Airport (€35 in a taxi) and just off a main shopping street. It is very close to the major attractions. 15 minutewalk to the Trev Fountain or a <€10 taxi ride to any of the major attractions. It is also a 5 minute walk to the local metro station / bus routes. The hotel is new, minimalist but has a nice feel to it. The rooms are small but well apportioned. The hotel offers free wi-fi access and has a nice roof top terrace to enjoy. There are vending machines to offer those essentials and the prices are not too expensice (given Rome's Prices in general). Happy to recommend this hotel for a decent place to stay in Rome - 4* all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Elanou
Reviews.Content: We arrived on their 1 month birthday. This is a new hotel that is trying to appeal to the business/ avid traveler that is looking for all the stops in their hotel. There is a fitness center, laundry room, business center with free internet. All rooms have A/C and beautiful bathrooms. They are very eager to please since it is brand new. Breakfasts are quite good as well. We also stayed here after 17 days on our trip and it was a relief. Very close to Termini train station and another metro station as well as to the Palatine. I highly recommend this new hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: WayneLord
Reviews.Content: Ended a 17 day trip to Italy by spending the last night in iQ Roma. The hotel was excellent: new furnishings, nice bath, good location, friendly hotel staff. I would definitely stay here again. Location is about 6 minute walk from Termini and right at the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Everything at your fingertips!”
Reviews.Author: JessMal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has thought of everthing a good size business centre that is free, washing machines, a gym, rooftop garden, vending machines with drinks, food, nicknaks and alcohol. The rooms are modern and clean and the staff are fantastic. Makes for a very comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Maz80London
Reviews.Content: After LOTS of deliberating I booked this hotel as part of a surprise week away in Rome for my wife and I on our first wedding anniversary. The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing. Most sights are within walking distance, however, my wife has a back problem so we wanted to cut down the walking as far as possible.... and this is where the hotel came into its own. Being close to the Termini station you can easily find a bus going to the bit of the city you are interested in or jump on the metro at Termini or Repubblica. The staff were great at helping us with which bus we needed. The hotel itself is new and looks fantastic. The web site gave me the impression it might be a bit basic with few staff around to help. This wasn't the case. There were plenty of staff and they were all very helpfull. For example, initially there had been a misunderstanding about when we could check-in, but the young lady was quick to resolve the situation. All rooms have controllable air con a fridge and a TV. We booked one of the larger double rooms... and it was plenty big enough. One of the small rooms would have been fine really, however, in our larger room we had a bath rather than just a shower..... great for the wife to soak in in order to ease her back off after a long day of sightseeing. The TV was perhaps a little small for the room, but in all fairness, we weren't there to watch TV! There is a lovely terraced area at the top of the building. Perfect for drinking beers purchased from the Spa (just a short walk away). We kept our drinks (not just beer!) cool using the handy fridge in our room. There are vending machines throughout the hotel and ice machines. The vending machines are reasonably priced, except I think for the alcohol. I'd strongly advise people to purchase from the Spa. The breakfast was great, although possibly a tad overpriced at 10Euros per person per day. The business centre was very handy. Free PC's with internet connections! Also, there was a printer. Not sure if you had to pay for this though. The gym was a tad small but if you insist on doing a workout, there's certainly enough kit there for even the most hardcore gym enthusiast! If I were to go back to Rome soon, I'd definitely go back to the iQ hotel. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel...no frills concept”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeat
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the IQ Hotel, it's modern, spotless and very comfortable. I was expecting some sort of do-it-yourself establishment but by the contrary the Hotel has enough staff to help you at all times. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable, with electronic lock and light control, temperature control, flat screen TV with free international channels, free Wi Fi throughout the hotel, big safe box, and 110v built -in converter in the bathroom. The location is unbeatable; across the street from the Opera palace and steps to Via Nazionale and Metro station Republica, also the Termini Train Station is a 5 minutes walk. At check in you receive a booklet with a map of the property and very useful information. The hotel has a spectacular terrace, gym, sauna, children playground, breakfast zone, easy bar, laundry room (coin machines), and vending machines at very very reasonable prices for drinks, snacks, alcoholic beverages and the best coffee machine ever. The breakfast buffet is amazing, offering a great variety of fresh fruit, fresh squeezed orange juice, espresso machines with fresh ground coffee, scramble eggs, boiled eggs, bacon, sausages, hams, mortadella, salami, cheese, all sort of breads and pastries. A very good refuel to start a busy day in Rome. The staff was always courteous and ready to help with a big smile, it seems that they enjoy their jobs. All of them speak very good English. I'd like to thank specially to Melanie and Hazram for their excellent customer service and their help dealing with the delivery of my delayed luggage. I really want to congratulate all the staff of IQ hotel for their excellent service and highly recommend it for your trips to Rome. I'll definitely stay with you again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonjour33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a brand new hotel, so it was very clean and everything was shiny. The hotel staff was very kind and willing to help. The only thing that I wished this hotel offered was free breakfast since most hotels in Rome include free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: alit
Reviews.Content: Hotel IQ Roma is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I cannot find a fault with this new hotel. All the staff are a credit to the manager/hotel they go out of their way to help guests. Check in was very swift - we were really pleased to get an upgrade to a larger double room each. The hotel is spotless - very well cleaned and the facilities are great. The rooms and whole hotel have air conditioning - essential in the July heat. The rooms are spacious, clean and have comfy beds with memory foam mattress. The TV is widescreen and has a large amount if channels. The mini fridge is very useful - we stocked up on food/drinks and saved lots of money that way (supermarket in the road behind the hotel) There is a laptop sized safe and free wifi in the room. The bathroom had a large shower with 2 showerheads in, soap is provided and plenty of towels and a hairdryer. Around the hotel there is a business centre with 7 computers and a printer - this is all free. We did not use the gym but it looked well equipped. On level 4 there is a microwave and several vending areas are around the hotel plus well priced drinks/snacks. Laundry room is useful 1 washer, dryer and iron. Nice roof terrace, plenty of seating. We did not use the breakfast room but it did look very good. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Rome; the area was safe and well lit. Close to the trains/metro/bus. I cannot find one fault with the hotel it is just fantastic and Im sure all reviews will be positive! I would stay there again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfetto!!!”
Reviews.Author: belamis_10
Reviews.Content: we came from Athens Greece. this was a brand new hotel with very friendly staff and a location that is close to everywhere. everyone was up on helping in everything we demanded. to have the right hotel is the key on having a good vacation. We stayed for 7 days and this was the hotel to stay at!! We recommend this to anyone. The Vending machine idea works great for after hour snacks and drinks.. Room was cleaned everyday and smelled like new! THis is a well worth 4 star hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and great value for the savvy traveller”
Reviews.Author: antrimman
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new high tech hotel which only opened a few weeks ago, offering great rates compared with other central Rome hotels. We stayed four nights and I'm going to give a full review as previous reviewers haven't given as much details. Firstly the location is excellent, within easy walking distance to the Termini Station and a pleasant walk to major attractions. While the hotel would be classed as being in the Termini Station area (which would be known not to be the best area), this hotel is in a very good and clean street about six blocks from Termini and we felt totally safe at all times while walking in the local area. It was right beside the Opera House and the nearest metro station is Republica, which is only a few minutes walk from the hotel. If you wish you can take the Metro to the major attractions to shorten your walk or save time but there's no need. There's a well stocked Carrefour Express supermarket in the street behind the hotel. The concept of this hotel is based on the guest being given the opportunity to avail of services themselves, without having to pay for additional staff or services which you may not require. So, to be blunt, if you are the sort of pampered hotel guest who wants to be greeted by a concierge who tips his hat at you as you enter and then valet parks your car, who wants to be able to pick up the phone and have meals and drinks delivered to your room, who wants someone to collect your laundry and return it ironed, the IQ Hotel is not for you! For those on B&B, there is a breakfast bar lounge leading to the beautiful roof garden but there is no restaurant or bar. Within the hotel there are many different vending machines which offer snacks, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks, range of coffees and toiletries plus microwaves situated at various locations. There is a business centre with seven new widescreen computers which are free to use, with a printer, so you don't have to bring your laptop to stay in touch. There is also a small but well equipped gym plus coin operated washing machine and dryer, with ironing board and iron. The hotel is no-smoking but caters for smokers by providing a small dedicated smoking outdoor balcony onto the courtyard. The rooms are modern, new (obviously!) and very clean. They are sitated either facing the front or rear of the hotel, or inwards around a hotel courtyard. Our room faced the courtyard and while we didn't have a street view, there was no noise whatsoever. There was double glazing through the hotel so I don't imagine there would be much noise anyway, as the hotel faced two quiet streets. The room had a large bathroom with excellent two-head shower, no bath. Fast wifi is available in all rooms and throughout the hotel, accessible by password provided at check-in. There is a flat-screen TV in each room, with many national channels, including English speaking BBC World and CNN. The room also has a safe and a very useful mini-fridge (not minibar). The bed was quite firm but that seems to be normal for Italian hotels. The front desk staff were always very helpful, polite, courteous and speak very good English. They will provide you with maps and advice on what to see, where to shop and eat. As with all new hotels, we had a few teething problems, mainly around regulating the air-conditioning temperature and our room not being made-up once (a mis-communication as to whether we wanted it made-up or not) but these were professionally and quickly resolved by Management when brought to their attention. We would have no hesitation in recommending the IQ hotel, on the proviso that you aren't an "ultra-services" orientated guest - these types of people would be more suited to staying at an over-priced, antiquated establishment elsewhere!

HotelInfo.Name: iQ Hotel Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze, 8, 00184 Rome, Italy
